Reviews.Title: “Excellent apartments in top location”
Reviews.Author: Ratichon
Reviews.Content: With easy access to the city centre, Darling Harbour and Chinatown, Meriton Kent Street apartments are certainly well positioned. Studio apartments are fully furnished with washing machines, ovens and cooktops so it's possible to be completely self-catering. The only drawback is their policy of taking a separate $100 deposit to cover "any breakages or damage to the apartment". This credit card transaction isn't scrapped on check-out but held for "seven to eight days" before being re-credited! With over 400 hundred apartments in the block, this amounts to a substantial interest-free loan to the company!

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment, Great View”
Reviews.Author: rarokin
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in a studio apartment, 3903. A lovely spacious apartment with balcony which had wonderful views across to Darling Harbour. This was great to watch their firework display on Saturday evening. It was very well appointed, quiet & central. 30minute walk down interesting Pitt St .. buskers.. shops...to Circular Quay,Opera House, Ferry Terminal & on to the Rocks. Would recommend Pitt Street's Makanai Japanese Restaraunt for either takeaways or eat in. Coles is also close by for everything you need. We also walked to Hyde Park & through the Botanical Gardens.Thankyou Meriton, we hope to return & would definately recommend you.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: GREATFELLA
Reviews.Content: stayed with wife and two kids.Overall a good stay.Have stayed at property a few times before.The customer service at the front desk could be improved in terms of better communication with guests and explaining facilities etc property offers.I know the property is not a 4-5 star hotel but it is a serviced apartment so explaining the customers who are going to stay longer than hotel is a great idea in the competitive hospitality industry.rest was all good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment, but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: CSBristol
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights in a 1 bedroom skyview apartment, which turned out to be on floor 48, and were delighted with our accomodation. The apartment was clean, well furnished and had everything we needed, as well as some things we didn't - like the mirror on the bedroom ceiling! Meriton have obviously had issues in the past with wild parties - there are signs all over the place warning of immediate ejection from the building for any guests found to be having a party in their room, though we saw nothing else to suggest this might be a problem. Indeed, our floor was deathly quiet. The apartment had a great view looking towards Darling Harbour and the Anzac Bridge (I guess if you were on the other side of the building you'd be looking at skyscrapers in the CBD) and the balcony was great, although was bizarrely locked for the first couple of nights we were there. There's a note in the guest information book that says "all balconies are locked and guests who tamper with the locks will be charged" so we initially got cross and were going to go and complain to reception ("why advertise an apartment with a balcony if you can't use it?") - before deciding it just wasn't worth the hassle. Then, on the next day, I tried the patio door again and it opened. Given that I've since seen reviews from other guests complaining about locked balconies at this property, I can't understand what was going on here! The full kitchen was great - all the facilities we wanted; the bed was comfortable (though I really prefer not to wake up to my own reflection looking back at me from the ceiling); the bathroom was clean and new-ish and having a washer and dryer was very helpful. We parked in the property's underground car park, which was fine, if eye-wateringly expensive for my pocket. Then again, all the city centre car parks in Sydney are. As for location, it's a block and a bit walk to Town Hall Station, and the property is surrounded by cafes and restaurants. Plus there's a Coles supermarket under World Tower just around the corner and a Woolworths opposite Town Hall station if you want to buy and cook your own food. Darling Harbour is also walking distance. The was the most expensive accomodation we stayed in during our trip to Australia, but comparable in price to good city centre hotels in Sydney. That being the case, I'd definitely stay here or in another of the Meriton properties if I was in Sydney again, rather than paying a similar amount for a much smaller hotel room with fewer facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Worst value hotel stay in years”
Reviews.Author: aussiedarkhorse
Reviews.Content: This place is VERY dissapointing! A lot of apartments with few resources . I have stayed in plenty of places in Sydney over the years but this joint takes the cake. Over $500 per night for a two bedroom apartment. Worn furnishings , lounge badly stained with goodness knows what, two luggage trolleys for hundreds of rooms. To top it off a wild party in the unit directly above that finished at 5.30 am. They had the hide to charge me $20 to supposedly separate the double bed in the kids room into two singles. One of the beds had dirty sheets( nice touch) so they obviously didn't separate it but what a sneaky charge anyway when you are already paying $ 500 + . Long waits for eelevators. This place is rubbish

Reviews.Title: “1st Time at Meriton inSydney, Kent Rd”
Reviews.Author: Dennis B
Reviews.Content: We were treated really well, great apartment, checked in early no problem, had a great stay for 5 days, can thoroughly recommend them. close to darling harbour, paddys markets, sydney tower myers, had a ball. thanks Meriton you guys were great.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions where great but...”
Reviews.Author: babaw
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were pleased with our room. Our one bedroom apartment was a good size and was clean and well equipped. We had followed the tips on trip advisor and requested a high floor and a room on the Darling Harbour side. We got exactly the opposite. Now I realise they can't fulfil everyone's requests but considering most people probably would not have asked or booked as early as us and considering that we were staying for 10 nights I would have thought our request may have been granted. Our view was of the street behind and the Planet Hollywood Cafe glaring sign. The balcony was not a balcony you could use at all due to it's size. The quality of the fittings was good except for the lounge which was so uncomfortable to sit on. Hard as a rock, no arm rests and only one. We woke the first night in the early hours because the couple in the room near ours was having a domestic. After listening to them yell for a while we contacted reception when things started being thrown. We heard security arrive and it quietened down for awhile but then we were awoken again. Again we rang reception. Same thing happened three times and neither me, my husband or our 21 month old that kept getting woken were happy. When we decided to go out early for the day so we didn't have to listen to it any longer, the couple were continuing their arguments in the hall but none of the staff seemed to care. We only had occasion to speak to the staff a few times and every time they seemed completely exhausted and as a result were not very friendly. The daily room service was great for the first day but after that it was terrible. The detergents were replaced once and then not again. Toilet paper was not replaced. Milk was not replaced and on some days the garbage wasn't emptied. The hotel was definitely convenient. Train station around the corner, short walk to Darling Harbour, loads of restaurants around and ofcourse plenty of shopping. For the price it was an ok stay. If you go make sure you make your reservation on myrez.com.au as it was definitely the cheapest way to book. A good place to stay if you just want a bed at night. Will I go again? No, I'll try to find something a bit more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfort in Central Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: Keithsutt
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here three times. It offers a very comfortable apartment style room in the central part of Sydney CBD. It is not close to the Opera House or Circular Quay, but they are easily accessible. It is very close to China Town and and Darling Harbour. There are many dining and drinking and night spot choices all within easy walking distance. The rooms are very well appointed with daily service. The bed is very comfortable too. The only downside was that the check in was a bit slow and for some people the counter at check in is too high. I saw people standing on their toes to speak to the representatives of the hotel. They should make this part of the experience more user friendly as it sets the tone for your stay. I think many visitors have travelled great distances to be here so they are tired and want to get to their rooms fast. As a plus, I have stayed in both the one bedroom apartment and the studio and both have heaps of room. It is very spacious, even in the studio. I have been here three times and will most likely return if I have the need to.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Cobby202
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 night in the final part of our Honeymoon, we were so glad that we did! Our Skyview room was on the 42nd floor which was fantastic. Choosing a serviced apartment gave us the hotel feel with the independence of having our own place to come and go as we please. The room was freshened every day and fully serviced once during our stay. All the amenities you could need were available, a well equipped kitchen, dishwasher, washing machine and a good living space with a great balcony view over towards the Darling harbour side of the town. We really were a little bit reluctant to leave but sadly a 20 hour flight back to the UK was calling.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but you need to like a soft bed”
Reviews.Author: DavidMcDonald
Reviews.Content: Meriton units are all the same. You know what you are going to get. Plenty of space, clean, friendly helpful staff, good location, easy parking, everything works, good price. â€¨â€¨The room was on floor 37 and was very quiet even though it faced George Street. The view was not scenic. There is no free WiFi.â€¨â€¨ The bed is too soft, but this is subjective.â€¨â€¨ We will go back but I could not stay for long because of the bed. â€¨â€¨ That we will go back is the best recommendation I can give.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Zumba12
Reviews.Content: Our second stay here & this time we were given a 2-bed 2-bath apartment on the 55th floor!! What a view. The balcony was great - if you have the head for it - and lots of action to watch! We were lucky enough to see helicopter manoeuvres in the dark one evening, landing on the Commonwealth Bank, very exciting! Generally a spotless & spacious apartment, very comfortable for four adults & good kitchen & appliances for self-catering. We took some friends from UK and they were astonished by value for money. We particularly liked the 'no party' policy & it is a great place for a good night's sleep after sightseeing all day. A special mention for service... our microwave broke down part way through cooking and we reported this & got an immediate response. Our microwave was checked out & replaced in minutes! Quite something. Also each day the beds were made up & amenities replaced if necessary. Also cleaned during our 5-day stay. Can't recommend this place highly enough & will certainly be back on our next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, no frills”
Reviews.Author: myvoyager
Reviews.Content: Good location, average value, slightly old with basic gym.

Reviews.Title: “Penthouse!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: Amazing is what we thought of when we stayed here. We booked one of the penthouse apartments for 2 nights and couldn't believe how big and modern our apartment was. It was like our own house in the sky! Everything was catered for, spa, amazing views of Sydney everything. We booked at last minute and got a great deal for 2 nights . We stayed an extra night and had to transfer to their pitt st building and still we had a room up high with double balconies and was also fantastic!!! This is the place to stay every time we go to Sydney from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Top Apartment”
Reviews.Author: KB100255060
Reviews.Content: Great Location, modern, clean with a great covered balcony.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST RATE”
Reviews.Author: KateCTunbridgeWells
Reviews.Content: Our one bedroom appt was well furnished, well serviced,& very comfortable. All the staff we encountered were polite, efficient & helpful. Not cheap ( UK exchange rate!) but good value. Try & get a high floor, the views are great. We have stayed 3 times & will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: trinimc
Reviews.Content: Great self-contained apartments to stay in Sydney. Rooms cleaned and serviced daily and staff was always obliging to assist us with tours, directions and places to eat. Central location, minutes walk to George Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, top apartment!”
Reviews.Author: Sonlou73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a girls weekend from Victoria with an overseas visitor. Perfect location. Absolutely fantastic apartment, spacious and on the top level. We were all surprised and excited about this apartment, it had the WOW factor. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: nzwccw
Reviews.Content: compared to Meriton Pitt St, the building looked a bit tired. the apartment was nice, but disappointingly my room had a slight smell of cigarette smoke which affected my sleep quality. the service was good. the location was excellent. after all, will consider staying with them next time.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected for an apartment”
Reviews.Author: hotwog4all
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Mardi Grass weekend and had a 2 night minimum stay. 2 bedroom apartment located on 41st floor. There was only 8 apartments on the floor so it wasn't an over crowded floor at all. I say 41st but the lobby is on the 10th floor so not really as high as it seems. We found the location great to all amenities, and sites intended for the weekend. Our balcony opened up onto the cnr of Liverpool and George st so our view up and down the streets were amazing! The only downside I found was that the main shared bathroom was half the size of the ensuite that also had the bathtub. Strange but that's how it is I suppose. Check in and check out were speedy, no issues there, and the staff friendly and professional at all times. I would stay here again if ever the opportunity came up again.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking view!”
Reviews.Author: Lynne B
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights and got a skyview room on 41st floor with a fantastic view over darling harbour. Apartment was spotless and very spacious. There wasn't any street noise at all at night. The entry to the apartment was unusual,for security reasons I'm sure. Access to the apartment from the main corridor is through your room numbered door into an entry hall, then your apartment is either A or B. The noise from our neighbours door every time it was opened and closed was annoying as the small entry hall accentuated the noise. Unfortunately for us our neighbours were in and out of their room a lot. Apart from that small issue it was an amazing place to stay and worth paying a little extra for a sky view apartment.

Reviews.Title: “amazeballs!!”
Reviews.Author: eirecoretraveller
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 5 nights. got a skyview room looking out over darling harbour, up on the 52nd floor. the place was amazing!! massive apartment, really clean, great aircon units. amazing views. really quiet at night. all in all, brilliant. only negative was the tv, not a huge amount of channels to choose from. free foxtel would have been great. would defo stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Extended Stay”
Reviews.Author: TOgirl47
Reviews.Content: I just wrapped up a 75 night stay at the Meriton on Kent Street and was extremely pleased with my experience. The building is very clean and modern, and the suite I received was excellent. I change rooms early in my trip - so if you're there for an extended stay I would suggest pressing for a room with a full kitchen as they are excellent. I thought the size of my suite was incredible, good sized bedroom with a big comfy bed, full kitchen, full size laundry and a good sized living room. The room was serviced once a week, which was good but a bit inconsistant - some weeks I received additional ammenities, sometimes I didn't, sometimes I'd be given extra toilet paper and some weeks I'd have to call and request more. The actual cleaning during the servicing was excellent though. I didn't experience any noise coming from within the hotel, but if you are a light sleeper I would reccommend getting a high floor that is west facing to avoid the nightly commotion from George Street. I'm an excellet sleeper, however, so while being aware of the noise, it never bothered me. Elevators are sometimes a bit slow, but I never experienced the ten minute wait I read about in other reviews. I usually just found the elevators to be busiest at the end of the day if there was a big conference staying in the hotel (and as I was there for 75 nights, I saw quite a bit of turnover). The Neighbourhood makes you accessible to so many things - two grocery stores within walking distance, tons of restaurants, as well as Paddy's Markets only a few minutes away for cheaper veggies, and of course Darling Harbour. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Meriton again and highly recommend it for long term stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: jessw188
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio apartment for a long weekend and the apartment was a lot bigger than we expected it would be and contained a good sized kitchen area with everything you would need for a short stay. Location of the apartments is great, however because of the location you do get a bit of street noise, but we still slept well and the bed was very comfortable. There are lots of nice restaurants nearby and it is around a 10-15 minute walk to Circular Quay. The price was also fantastic compared to other hotels in Sydney (we booked through Wotif). We did have a problem with our DVD player not working and they replaced it that day while we were out.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for seeing Sydney”
Reviews.Author: martpt
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Australia and booked here for a week. You pay A$10 more for higher room past the 34th floor. Go for it as its worth it. We asked for a great view as it was our first int in Oz. Ended up on the 52nd floor and loved it. Great views over Darling Harbour. Stayed in a studio apartment - more than big enough for two people. Great facilities - even include dishwashing powder for the dishwasher! Everything had been thought of for the traveller. A very contemporary and high standard of accommodation - loved the huge bed. The pool is good, the gym OK yet if you really want a good gym you'll fine it outside. The perfect location to explore Sydney. Certainly will be rebooking for the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Kya07
Reviews.Content: I chose this apartment for its central location, reasonable price, and how much more spacious it is when compared to hotel rooms around the area. China town, Darling harbour and the train station are all within walking distance. We didn't have to hail a taxi once all weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: katch55
Reviews.Content: I find myself in Sydney every few months and prefer apartment style accommodation. This Meriton has location but it certainly has problems. Being an older Meriton it is not well insulated and even on 30th level there is continual street and service vehicle noise to the extent that it is unpleasant to use balconies. An issue that management must address is security. Unshirted drunk young men lolling about the foyer and riding lifts without being challenged by staff was a problem on my last stay and this was early in the evening. Returning home after work we also had to push through weekend crowds who group between pavement & entrance door stubbies in hand waiting for pickups. I have no specific comments about cleanliness, service or price, they are all OK, but I would suggest the new Meriton in Campbell St is far superior in terms of design, quietness, furnishings and it's cheaper too. It has style which at one time belonged to Meriton Kent St.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier (:”
Reviews.Author: droo2ric
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 3 nights in this Hotel. Everything was modern and clean. The room was spacious, comfortable and had a private balcony overlooking George Street. The hotel features a good quality gym, sauna, heated pool and spa. I received a warm greeting on check in and found the staff to be friendly and helpful throughout my stay. My only complaint would be the traffic noise but that's just sydney. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend At Meriton On Kent St”
Reviews.Author: leo v
Reviews.Content: Very good apartment, nice location and good views. As usual, Meriton Apartments are very nice and comfortable. Unfortunately, it comes at a price. They are not cheap, far from it. especially on a Friday and Saturday night in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favourite”
Reviews.Author: SR121
Reviews.Content: Our old favourite was Medina on Kent Street, but on this occasion they wanted to charge over $350/night for a weeks stay (something about February being a busy time of year). So we tried Meriton. The main difference from our point of view was the amazing view and probably reliably quieter on one of the upper floors. We cooked breakfast everyday and had no trouble with the smoke alarm going off, but I did notice the sign saying to leave the windows open when cooking. I would have thought they should write: leave the windows open and use the rangehood fan (actually some people wouldn't know how to use it without instructions - just pull).

Reviews.Title: “Nice studio apartment in a good location - really pleased!”
Reviews.Author: HellsbellsChester
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights over the NYE period (30/12/11 to 03/01/2012). I found it really difficult to find an affordable place to stay over this time and was really pleased when I found this accommodation because it was approximately Â£500 cheaper than any other available hotel (I booked in August 2011). We stayed in a studio and I emailed the hotel to request a higher floor, a balcony and a view towards the water as it was our belated honeymoon and we were delighted when we arrived because we got two of our three requests as we were on floor 48 and had a nice view towards the water. The apartment was clean, bed was super comfy, shower was great. Location is really good - 2 mins walk to the underground, 15 mins to the Harbour Bridge & Rocks area and there are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. We enjoyed the Bridge climb (if a little over rated for the price), the Oz Jet boat ride in the harbour (make sure you wear the waterproofs provided!), a trip to Manly on the ferry, a trip to Bondi and a coastal walk to Bronte, a trip to the Blue Mountains (bought a train ticket and travelled from Central station and picked up the Explorer bus), pizza in the Australian Heritage Hotel in The Rocks, Lawn with the View at the Botanical Gardens for the NYE celebrations (awesome view). Would definitely recommend this accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Well equipped and good location”
Reviews.Author: MadHattor
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom apartment which was relatively spacious, balcony with furniture, work desk, full kitchen and full laundry. Very clean and comfortable. Two air conditioning units - one in the bedroom and one in the living room and both individually controlled (great for those who like a cooler bedroom). Very nice indoor pool and gym area. Full supermarket only one block away, monorail or train station two blocks, Darling Harbour only a short stroll. Overall a very comfortable base to explore Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but dont expect a great service”
Reviews.Author: Alcabideche
Reviews.Content: My husband & I choose the meriton for our honeymoon. We had a 1 bedroom apartment which was spacious, the furnishings were nice and the added benefit of a washing machine was a bonus, so would recommend on this basis alone if it wasnt for the rude reception staff who were less than friendly. We were made to wait for our apartment pon the promise that they had reserved a special room for us on one of the higher floors for our honeymoon, only then to find that this wasnt true and we got a standard room. We just wanted what we had booked as after an 11 hour flight, you just want to check in- but this seemed to be ignored by the reception staff who seemed more interested in carrying on their conversation that attending to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with some flaws”
Reviews.Author: CBCBUX
Reviews.Content: There are many shops and restaurants around the apartment. With 3 mins you will reach George Street. The check in is fast and efficient and like what other travellers have said, the apartment is neat, spacious and modern. However like to point out to areas that we feel disappointed. 1) the hotel staff seemed not patient enough to explain the set up of wi-fi internet in the apartment and it took us an hour to figure out ourselves. 2) they provided a full kitchen however whenever we cooked the smoke alarm is triggered. It made us so embarrassing and caused unnecessary disturbances to the people stay next to us. We reported this incident to the hotel but what they can say is "there is nothing we can do actually". It did made our stay little stressful as we planned to cook than dine out during our stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “NOT AS GOOD AS OTHER MERITONS”
Reviews.Author: kiwiKento
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Meriton properties previously in both Sydney and the Gold Coast and had great experiences, hence us booking to stay at another Meriton on a recent trip to Sydney. We selected this particular Meriton due to its location at the other end of town, away from the super touristy spots around Circular Quay and the Harbour Bridge. Meriton on Kent St had also received great reviews so it was a no brainer booking here. I am not sure if we were upgraded, however we ended up in a two bedroom suite, which can only be described as plain, run down and in need of some maintenance. The room gave the impression that the whole Hotel was very, very old and had not been taken care of. It was not well appointed and was a huge disappointment given the standard of other Meriton properties. The rooms were very large, however doors opened onto furniture and were not well laid out. Other than the size of the rooms and the location (not so good if you are a first time tourist to Sydney), I could not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and good location”
Reviews.Author: Deb367
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a number of times for work and leisure and still find it great value. This trip the weather was not so good so made use of the monorail. Easy to get to around the corner without lugging umbrella's around for the day. We were headed for the powerhouse and then headed up town and then down to the aquarium so got good use out of a day pass that came with some great discounts. The 2 bed apartment was on the corner and a quirkly layout to what I have has before but was great from the point of view that the bedrooms were right away from each other. I found the lifts to be working a lot quicker this visit as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Another Great Meriton Property”
Reviews.Author: Jobell66
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at a Meriton property. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment which was very spacious and clean - excellent location close to Town Hall station - World Square monorail station and cinema complexes. Service was excellent with staff efficient and helpful. Have stayed with the Meriton properties in Broadbeach, Parramatta and Pitt Street and Meriton always provides a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent apartment stay”
Reviews.Author: majelperth
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few nights at this apartment hotel in Sydney CBD and can confirm that the excellent reviews already given are genuine. Several things are to be applauded. First, the rooms are large (typical for converted apartments being used for hotel-style accommodation). Stayed in a 1-bedroom apartment which had spacious living and dining, good sized kitchen and bathroom was appropriately sized. Excellent sense of light and space, though I was on a high floor and had a balcony so that helps. The complex is very modern and the furnishings and other features of the room were contemporary, comfortable and fresh. Much better than some other nearby apartment hotels which are a bit rundown (eg the Radisson Liverpool St which is another one I've used recently). Second, there is a good gym and spa/pool facility - emphasis is on cardio workout (6 running machines, x-trainer, no free weights, small number of weight machines). Third, location is unbeatable, though it may be personal preference - I love the Chinatown end of the city. It's about a 10-15 minute walk to the main shops around QVB building, Myer, Westfield if you don't know Sydney. Fourth, excellent air conditioning. I mean REALLY excellent. Three independently controllable units, very effective. BEst I've had in this kind of hotel. One very big minus - there is no television in the bedroom of the 1-br apartments. This doesn't worry us when travelling as a couple but I'd be a bit annoyed if I were on my own. Studio apartment presumably doesn't have this problem. Did also have a problem in that we asked for blankets not duvet in room and it was not provided; problem solved within 2 minutes of ringing them upon arrival, however. Only other minor complaint would be parking cost - $35 / day. Then again, 9 times out of 10 you don't need a car and at least the parking is easy to navigate and the bays are not all cramped as in some others. Curious feature. This may not be true of all rooms but the one I was in had a very large ceiling mounted mirror in the bedroom (!!!). I wonder what the owners or earlier tenants have in mind for this place haha. If that's your thing ask for room 4602A All in all, this has won me - better value than Fraser Suites, about a block down Kent St, and more modern fittings and feel (esp. gym) than the Radisson Suites hotel nearby. I suspect it would be better than Quest Chinatown too, though have not stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! Luxurious, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Kristy L
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was wonderful.. From the moment you walk in the door you feel like a celebrity or someone rich ! ... marble lobby,, friendly and very helpful staff,, and the smell is soo fresh ! Our room was lovely,, the views were great from the balcony Very Clean, and fresh ! .. Beds were very comfy Room had full kitchen, fill sized fridge, oven, dishwasher, microwave .. was fantastic 1 bedroom apartment.. very roomy ! Great TV .. Great bathroom ! Pool and Spa were the best !! Spa was massive Pool was massive, great temperatures for both pool and spa ! Gym looked good Very quiet ,,, Great location close to main st, George st... Walking distance to darling Harbour.. 10 minutes on bus to circular Quay Very Very nice !!! We will be going back and would defiantly recommend Only one small issue.. a pair of our sandals went missing from the room and also a calendar i got for christmas... went missing from the room... So we are unsure whether the cleaners took these.. rang hotel and they were not left there and they are in our photos of the room .. so its a mystery.... But overall .., Very Very Nice :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well appointed”
Reviews.Author: bianca5699
Reviews.Content: Chose this apartment based on cheaper price and was really pleased to see how nice it was. we came for the Australia Day celebrations and it was only a short walk to Darling Harbour from the building.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Jomax100
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights in January in a studio apartment. Accommodation is comfortable and spacious and includes a basic kitchenette and washer and dryer. Check-in and check-out were both fast and efficient and staff friendly. Supermarkets are nearby and location is not far from the Town Hall Station and George Street. Public transport system made it easy to get around and if you are an Australian 'Senior' you can buy and all day ticket for buses, trains and ferries for $2.50. The property was within walking distance of many attractions, including Darling Harbour, China Town, the Sydney Markets and Queen Victoria Building. We have stayed here several times previously and have always found it ideal for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: GOLFERS_10
Reviews.Content: We are enjoying our stay at Kent Street Darling Harbour. I bed sky view apartment on 52nd floor with stunning views. Apartment is very well equipped with good quality furniture and white goods. After ten days living out of suitcases on tour it is a delight to unpack and catch up with the laundry! Very handy for all major attractions and easy access to public transport. We bought two sixty dollar week passes which cover all trains, ferries and buses. It is very easy to navigate your way around. The Monorail is not included but worth ten dollars each for the short circular tour to get your bearings. We are very near China Town and eating places around Darling Harbour and excellent. Sydney and Australia generally are expensive for uk visitors so be prepared a small beer is going to cost you about Â£5. Good to be able to self cater a few meals and drink wine on your balcony whilst the works rushes by 52 floors below.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Excellent Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Droumleigh
Reviews.Content: Position, Convenience, cleanliness, Friendly, views, price, All excellent For old or young, business, families, solo, short or long stay. Excellent Came across it by accident its now on the favorites menu.

Reviews.Title: “Great option with kids”
Reviews.Author: FloraWood
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times as it has become our preferred option for visiting Sydney since having children. Location is convenient to: Chinatown restaurants, World square shopping centre and supermarket, Town Hall train station and Darling Harbour attractions. I find it convenient to have laundry and kitchen facilities when travelling with young children. Apartments are spacious, clean and value for money. On our most recent stay we arrived at 10am and were given access to our apartment even though check-in is not usually until 2pm (this may have something to do with being on a corporate rate). There is a pool, gym and spa. I have never experienced these to be very busy but I am usually visiting them at off-peak times i.e. during the day. Highly recommend these apartments with kids although I think charging additional $35/night for a cot when we had booked a 2-bedroom apartment for 2 adults, a 4 year old and 4 month old was a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable value for money accommodation in the heart of Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: TheUnicorn
Reviews.Content: When Sydney is calling and you don't need a 5 star experience nor do you want to rough it with the backpackers, where would you go? The Meriton Service apartment is the perfect place to stay. There are several Meriton apartments in the CBD and this review is specifically about the one located on Kent Street. Paid secure parking is a breeze as it is under the apartment and only at AUD$35 per night - what a bargain!. The parking ticket is validated at the front desk and you can go out and come in to the car park as often as you like. Reception is quick and easy (on line booking is easy also). If you have not stayed here before, they will photocopy your driver's license or passport if you are from overseas. Check out is 10am but we elected for a 'relaxed checkout' which is a 1pm checkout time for just $60 extra. The standard room has a queen bed, quite comfortable. Air conditioning is standard and it has all the amenities such as internet connection (wired, costs extra), kitchenette with stove, microwave, fridge & a dishwasher. Kettle, tea/coffee/, crockery, plates, washing up detergent, teatowel, washing up brush are provided. Bathroom is of a good size. Next door to the right are cheap quick eating places (Vietnamese pho noodles, coffee shop etc). To the left, Spanish quarters with excellent Spanish restaurants, plus more eating places. The 3 Monkey Pub is just around the corner. It's a 5 minute walk to the Events Cinemas, 10 minutes to Queen Victoria Building (QVB) shopping arcade, Westfields Shopping Centre (MYERS, David Jones etc etc). What do you expect to pay for a quality room at a hotel right in the CBD? $175 is the standard rate at at Jan 2012. It's certainly NOT the Hilton or Sheraton but it has every one needs for a comfortable stay in Sydney CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and standard, shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug_83Sydney
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Meriton on Kent a few times however also book all our corporate employees who travel to Sydney. They offer excellent value for money in modern, spacious and clean rooms, the standard of the rooms is great compared to a lot of others in Sydney. Location is more towards China Town end which means a bit more walking but it's worth it. Unfortunately the let down with this hotel is the service. Staff are not very helpful and you get the feeling they are not keen to assist with anything that requires additional work above checking you in and out. Providing you are not needing assistance then this should not be a problem. Overall, great rooms and value for money, ideal for business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: theMelbourneDemon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights prior to a Bridge Walk and cruise and found it to be excellent value for money, great area to be in and although a fair walk to Circular Quay (which I enjoyed) trains are close by

Reviews.Title: “Great Sydney CBD base”
Reviews.Author: smithbeachhouse
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights while enjoying Sydney. Ii cannot recommend these serviced apartments enough, there are the perfect place for staying in the CBD

Reviews.Title: “OK value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Tistybus
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Fraser Suites up the road and much prefer it to the Meriton. Something always goes wrong. Last time we were evacuated because some muppet burnt his food and set off the fire alarm. Evacuation was chaos and very poorly done. Staff didn't know whether they were coming or going. The time before that someone was smoking in the room next to us and partying. Staff were alerted and spoke to them, but we still smelled smoke. We gave up. Pool is small but OK, however usually fairly crowded as with the spa. The gym is really small. Room have recently been refurbished (12-6 months ago) and are your basic cookie cutter apartment. All furnihing and fixtures are cheap, but cosmetically look OK. Room are clean, toiletries minimal. Beds are fine. Noise levels are not great. You can hear your neighbours - not hugely but it's not quiet enough for me to sleep without ear plugs. A few of the staff are OK, but we've found the majority don't really care or are quite arrogant. If you get a really good deal, I'd stay here because you do get an entire apartment for a reasonable price which I always prefer to a small hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 1 week, on business GREAT APARTMENTS”
Reviews.Author: TravelCrazyPenguin
Reviews.Content: I didn't have the best impression upon arrival as check in took about 20 mintues however this was during busy times. After check in though, everything was fantastic, ran smoothly - I stayed in a VERY spacious 1 bedroom apartment on the 17th floor. I used the gym everyday on the 15th floor and I have to say the gym / pool area was the BEST I have ever seen in a serviced apartment. I would certainly stay here for pleasure next time I'm in Sydney. Location is great, close to restaurants, shopping, city life but far enough to not be noisy. My room even had a little balcony with a table and chairs. All in all, a GREAT place.

Reviews.Title: “Great home away from home”
Reviews.Author: megpowis
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January 2012 with my parents (tourists form the UK) and my 3 week old son. The apartments were clean, comfortable and had everything I could possibly need to care for a newborn (although I brought my own cot). The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel is excellently located between the CBD and Darling Harbour. I would recommend it to tourists, business travellers and in fact anyone who needs accommodation in a central Sydney location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & reasonable for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TSN_10
Reviews.Content: We were wrapping up a 3 week vacation and chose this location based on price and the reviews. I much prefer Pitt Street or being at the Harbour, however the prices were crazy for this time of year. This apartment was a value compared to other hotels we have stayed in the past. Check in went well and the staff were friendly. Great help with our luggage and parking short term with our car. I was disappointed in the apartment. Clean and basic. Balcony- dirty. Not something I wanted to use. (Old cigarettes on the floor, just needed a good clean). Based on reviews, I was expecting more. The location is great for Darling Harbour and the shopping on Pitt Street. Thirty minute walk to the Opera House. For a family or wrapping up a trip, this is a good place to stay. For your first visit to Sydney, I would not stay here. If you do, just lower your expectations slightly when booking. We stayed at the Marriot Circular Quay and Hilton on Pitt Street last time- they are more luxury and great locations. This is basic and convenient. (But overall clean)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for visiting Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Likes_to_Travel
Reviews.Content: Apartment style rooms. Ours had a Washer/dryer, small kitchen, dining area, living room, bedrooma nd bathroom. Also had a nice balcony with a table and chairs. We used the fitness center, basic but nice. The pool and jacuzzi were good. Pool was a bit cool as was the jacuzzi. The location was great for getting to Darling Harbour. Lets of activities and places to eat & drink nearby. Very important since we did not have a car! The yaki-soba place in the bottom floor of the hotel was awesome! We ate there several times. Very authentic!

Reviews.Title: “Central location & perfect for long stays”
Reviews.Author: menad38
Reviews.Content: Nestled in the heart of syd city, close to town hall, darling harbor, world square, monorail & buses on George street including free shuttle 555 green bus to circular quay. Short walk to museum station bus stops for paddington, bondi beach (bus 380/389), surry hills (Bourke st bakery, Bill's, Red Lantern, Billy Kwong or great shopping). Requested room on higher floor as per TA advice. Top floor is 55 but their lobby/ground floor is 10. Swipe key for after hours entrance into lobby & for lift. You have to type in floor number on keypad in lift. Upon arrival before scheduled check in time of 2pm, we were able to do the paperwork & payment so it was quick & easy when we returned later to just pick up the key card. One set of key card provided for room. We were able to store our luggage before official check-in and also after check-out (10am) as our flight was in the evening. Transport to apt: small bus companies $14/trip, train to museum station & walk $15.40, taxi is about $35 dependent on traffic. Lovely well furnished & clean apartments. Just missing some good sharp knives and at least one serrated knife as it was hard work cutting a loaf of bread. A pair of scissors would have been good too. Otherwise lots of kitchenware to cook your own meals. You'll need to probably turn the fridge temperature down/coolness up as we found out the hard way - our milk went off. We couldn't work the front loader washing machine after reading instructions & called down to reception. They promptly sent someone up to help us. They provide satchels of dish washing liquid, dishwasher tablet, washing machine liquid. All in all we really enjoyed our stay, staff were helpful & efficient & location was extremely convenient!

Reviews.Title: “A very high spec, comfortable, clean and great location serviced apartment.”
Reviews.Author: ajdonald100
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had been travelling the east coast, for 10 days, in a camper-van and had decided to spend a couple of nights in Sydney. We were looking for somewhere central and somewhere to appreciate comfort and the convenience of the city. Especially after being cooped up in a camper-van for 10 days. We were really pleased with this choice of serviced apartment. From the moment we entered the staff were very attentive and answered all or questions in regards to the local area etc... We had booked a studio apartment and the standard of the room spec, size and cleanliness could not be faulted. We were on the 27th floor of this 42 floor sky scraper, which meant we had amazing views of the city. For our convenience there was a washer/dryer with washing liquid supplied (this was great after our travels through Oz so far) Wifi (with great speed) was accessible in our room for a charge of $18 for 24 hrs. The reception gave us a code to access this and the receptionist was very helpful in telling me how to do this on my iPad. Our trip to Sydney meant we wanted to do as much as possible in 36 hours. Here's a what we did and I would definitely recommend you do something like this, to get the most out of this amazing city: - Harbour Bridge climb... This was quite pricey, but it was a 3 and a half hour climb, with a very professional service. It felt like such an achievent to look up at the bridge throughout the day and think we'd climbed to the summit. - Sight seeing tour bus. This took around 2 hours to do the full circle. Definitely worth it to see as much of Sydney as we could. You do have the option to hop on and off as many times as you like though and your ticket is valid for 24 hrs to do this. You also have the option of getting on another tour, which takes you to the eastern suburbs, including Bondi. This is all included in the total price of $35. - Ferry to Manly. This was a great photo opportunity on the journey of the Opera House and of course the Harbour Bridge, as well as the whole of Sydney's skyline. We then had a stroll around manly and headed to the beach to watch the surfers take in the early evening waves. - After our return ferry journey back to The Quays (Sydney Harbour) we took a stroll up the Opera House steps to take in the amazing architecture of this phenomenal building. After our long and exhausting day we opted to go back to our beautiful apartment and cook our evening meal in the very well equipt kitchen. Also to make the most of the very relaxing and comfortable facilities. My only regret is that we didn't have a longer stay in this great apartment and in the amazing city of Sydney...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, poor reception and service, for tall guys only”
Reviews.Author: Matilda F
Reviews.Content: The room (sky view) was spacious, great and had heaps of seating options (including a loggia). Paying for the view was worth every cent. Many of the electrical appliances not working (dish washer not at all, internet box not at all; washer and drier only with tricks; some lights not always working) and there is no room cleaning for short-stay. Internet (wifi) not always available and you need to trek to reception to get access. What really annoyed me was the reception was badly designed, half of conversation was lost but the reception people were to proud to ask back so they made a lot of mistakes with my reservation, my payment, my internet accesses and also did stuff I did not want. (Reception counter is about 1,50 high, quite deep and you cannot hear properly plus you don't see what they do). You must pay upfront like in a cheap accomodation but they still take a bond AND they copy your passport. - In the room many things are high up and cannot be reached when you are under 1,70 (shower head, coats hangers, crockery in the kitchen).

Reviews.Title: “Fitlhy, Rude, No Privacy”
Reviews.Author: Martin M
Reviews.Content: The place was filthy, Security harasses you for your name and ID and room key when you try and get into the building after 9pm, reception was rude and gave out my full name and room number to complete strangers, people above us were noisy - throwing bottles off balcony - security didnt stop this at all. Building manager refused to address any concerns. Was a loyal and regular Meriton guest but never again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: jjwals
Reviews.Content: Visiting from Europe and unfamiliar with accommodation in Sydney, I relied heavily on reviews in Trip Advisor to help me choose. We chose Meriton Sericed apartments on Kent Street. It was an excellent choice. The location is very good - close to public transport/restaurants and shops. There is a Coles supermarket just across the road. Darling Harbour/Circular Quay/Opera House are all easily accessible. The studio apartment we had was modern, clean and very well equipped. It really had everything - my wife was most impressed!!. Tablets of washing powder for the dishwasher and clothes washer are provided free of charge. Staff at the Meriton are professional and very helpful. Within 10 minutes walk in any direction from the apartment block, you will find an array of eating options. Asian to European and many offering great value meals. I could not find any fault with this establishment and if you like to stay in an apartment rather than an hotel, I suggest that the Meriton on Kent Street is about as good as you will get. Finally, if you are staying in Sydney for a week, get yourself a weekly multi travel ticket - it gives you free travel on all Sydney buses/ferries and limited access to the underground network. It costs about Au$43 and is worth every penny!!.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: rr84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the meriton apartments on Kent Street over new years. I chose it because of the close proximity to darling harbour (10 mins) and circular quay (15 mins) Given the time of year most hotels in the centre were either full or ridiculously expensive so we opted for a cheaper alternative. I'm really glad we extended our search beyond hotels because the meriton apartments were wonderful and exactly what we wanted - clean, newly refurbished and relaxed enough to do laundry and cook breakfast etc... It essentially felt like a home away from home. The apartments were very well serviced and we were given everything we needed to keep the place clean ourselves. The bed was incredibly comfy and in the living room we had panoramic views from the numerous windows which was a nice touch. My only criticism would be that the windows are not very well insulated so music from the late night bars could be heard even from our 37th floor! Also the tv reception was apalling with most channels not even having sound. But when you're in a great city like Sydney one of the last things you'll do is watch tv so that's not a big deal. Overall I would not hesitate to stay there again and would definitely recommend it to anyone seeking relaxed self-contained accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location”
Reviews.Author: Ninnynin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in a one bedroom apartment in January 2012. Staff here are very nice and helpful. Stayed in room 3303A which is a connected apartment (there is one door that leads you to a small hallway with two separate rooms). That was probably the only downfall of the place, I recommend to try and get a one bedroom apartment that is on its own. Room is very spacious and clean. Kitchen had all the necessities and was stocked with the required appliances. Room had a very nice view of Darling Harbour as well. Will definitely come back and stay here when I have another night out in Sydney. Good for couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pert S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just a night since we were in the Sydney to watch 'Love Never Dies'. It was great. Location was good right in the middle of everything basically. Few minutes to go here and there and the free shuttles are good for further places. The room was clean like other Meriton apartments and was great. We were on floor 43 and the views were exceptional! Facing towards Darling Harbour and Pyrmont. The service was excellent no problems whatsoever. Will DEFINITELY stay here again.. and again. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Family Holiday”
Reviews.Author: CWKB2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at a 2 bedroom Darling Harbour view apartment for 3 nights. The location was fantastic. We walked everywhere. A few minutes walk to Darling Harbour, World Square (Monorail station), QV building (train station). Lots of restaurants around so you don't need to go far for your meals. The apartment was beautiful. It had a large enclosed balcony (Windows can be opened) which was fantastic for our children as a play area and for us as a place to unwind at the end of the day. The view was well worth the extra you pay. The Master bedroom had a large bevelled mirror on the ceiling and the en suite was spacious and had a bath tub which was helpful as we had a baby to bath. The second bedroom was a little small but still large enough to fit 2 single beds and 2 bedside tables. The staff were fantastic from check in to check out. They were courteous and helpful. We used the parking as well but had a minor hiccup with the ticket not letting us out so make sure your parking ticket is properly validated. The only gripe I have is that I only saw the cleaning lady once during our 4 days/3 nights stay and also they should provide larger bags of washing powder, dish-washing detergents and extra rubbish bags.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and very well kept”
Reviews.Author: Cloughy1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for just under 2 weeks. The location is great with plenty of places to eat and drink close by. The staff we friendly and helpful, for example we needed one of the room converted from a Double bed to a twin and they took care of this at 8pm at night which proves they have staff on hand any time of the day. Nice indoor pool with an acceptable gym. All in all apartments were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best location - superb accommodation”
Reviews.Author: happyinoz
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. Great location. Advice - 1 - book on Agoda for a great price. 2 - do not expect the same amenities as a hotel. I needed a shower cap but they are not provided (you cannot shower without getting your hair wet and I had just had my long, think curly hair straightened). Not a problem I just popped out a bought one. Apparently serviced apartments do not provide the same stuff as hotels. 3 - head to Darling Harbour for breakfast, you will not get a fresher or better deal. We will return to this fabulous place. Paid $126 for one night in a studio apartment. The bedding was crisp and so clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: scruffygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Meriton during the Christmas holidays and was really happy with my choice! We sprung for a "Skyview" studio and had an amazing view of Darling Harbour. The room exceeded my expectations. I thought studio would mean regular hotel room with kitchenette, but it was larger than anticipated as the bedroom was separate, there just wasn't a door. The room had a nicely appointed kitchen area and the whole unit was modern and tasteful. The balcony was large and very nice. The location was just perfect. Away from the super touristy bustle of Circular Quay but super convenient to Darling Harbour, Chinatown and the Spanish Quarter. Also a very short walk to the shops at the Queen Victoria Building and the Town Hall CityRail stop. The front desk was not overly friendly, but helpful and the lobby always smelled amazing - I don't know what scent they pump through there but it was nice. We booked 2 months in advance and got a great rate and were very happy with the overall experience! I plan on considering the Meriton brand on any subsequent trips to Australia I may be lucky enough to embark on in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Staying in the Meriton was awesome”
Reviews.Author: Toitjie
Reviews.Content: I cannot begin to describe how wonderful it was to visit the Meriton on Kent. I have read a lot before I made the choice, but they surpassed our expectations. The staff that met us in the lobby and did the book-in were extremely polite and friendly. The apartment we stayed in was nothing short of luxurious, we loved it. Very clean, beautiful view (52nd floor). Our water pitcher had a hole at the bottom and after we told them, it was replaced immediately, without any fuss. The gym area has a very nice swimming pool and a huge jacuzzi whihc the kids enjoyed thorougly. I think if we have to go back, it would be for their enjoyment of the pool and jacuzzi. Without a doubt a very nice place to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “New year's eve celebration”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneLola
Reviews.Content: We booked a 1 bedroom apartment for 4 nights. Our apartment was on the 41st floor, with balcony and great view of Darling Harbour, plus! We watched fireworks on New Year's eve, from our balcony, with overseas guests, who were staying on the 42nd floor. Location is fantastic, close to all amenities, public transport and pretty safe at night, despite been such a busy area. Room was serviced every day and staff at reception desk very friendly. The apartment was quiet and spacious, despite outside noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: BuriedBones
Reviews.Content: I have spent 3+ nights here several times in recent months and am struggling to find any faults at all. The staff are very effificent and courteous, the rooms are well appointed with everything you will need or expect in a serviced apartment - and always very clean. If you can get one with a balcony - even better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice studio apartment in a convenient area”
Reviews.Author: erikaisthebest
Reviews.Content: My husband and I rented an apartment over the New Year holiday. It was a good size and had a balcony. We were told it was the largest studio: room 1501. The building is right next to the Town Hall and convenient to George Street and Darling Harbor. We spent a lot of time down by the Opera House and The Rocks. We could walk there in about 20 minutes. There is also a free bus down to the Circular Quay area (Opera House). It's green. Number 555. Nice apartment, easy check-in and check-out. Clean. Good area. Can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid K
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, good value, had everything we required within the apartment. Nice to have sachets with dishwashing liquid (both for hand-washing and machine-washing) as well as for the washing machine. Location is a definite bonus, with a short walk to Darling Harbour, shops and plenty of restaurants and cafes around the area. Staff provided great service too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quite spacious rooms, reasonable price, good swimming pool/jacuzzi”
Reviews.Author: ozTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 4104 recently for 4 nights for approximately $170 per night (I had stayed here before and will continue to use it). It's a great location for Sydney, close to Chinatown, about 20 mins walk to the Rocks. Our bed was a king size bed. Quite comfortable. We used the washing machine/dryer (complimentary small packets of washing detergent), and also the internet which was quite expensive (still don't understand why Australian hotels are still charging for wifi). $18 for 24 hours. The pool, spa, and sauna were great to an end of day activity. We didn't use the gym but it looked good. This hotel is quite reasonably priced compared to other hotels in Sydney. I would come back here again if I were to stay in Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Professional service and spacious apartments.”
Reviews.Author: wendywanda
Reviews.Content: Always clean modern and outstanding service. I always stay here and now we live in sydney I always recommend this apartment. Staff are accommodating, great pool and love the roomy spa. Check out the Vietnamese soup downstairs... My favorite dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Zigletta
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a studio apartment for 4 nights. The room was spacious, modern and well appointed. It had everything that I needed on the short business stay. It's a 2 min walk to World Square, 5 min to Town Hall, and 5 min to Darling Harbour. There was plenty to restaurants and cafes just by the door step of Meriton. I was on the 40th floor and had excellent views of Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous accommodation in the CBD”
Reviews.Author: alliglenn
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a long weekend in Sydney with my daughter and we stayed at the Meriton on Kent. From the time we booked, the service was wonderful. Our booking agent looked after us and gave us a high level apartment (45th floor) with beautiful views over Cockle Bay. The apartment was spacious and very clean. We had a twin bed room and the beds were very comfortable. There is a beautiful pool, spa and gym in the building which we didnt have time to use but if time had permitted it looked very inviting. Location was perfect as we were able to navigate our way around the bus/train system very easily. We didn't use the hotel internet because we each had our own and we really weren't in our apartment very much. It is an easy walk to Darling Harbour for dinner and some cocktails if you don't want to bother with transport. You won't have any trouble finding great food as there were plenty of cuisines to choose from. We paid $400 for 2 nights - great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Cat255100
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with our 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom room. The staff were really friendly and helpful, including getting us extra towels and blankets. They also helped organise a $50 van to the airport for all of us. Would definitely stay again as it's very central and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “This is about our 8th stay here - can't ever fault it.”
Reviews.Author: vicbrett
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a heap of times over the recent past and we can never fault it. This time we were told by the very pleasant fellow at reception that they had "a surprise" for us - and what a nice surprise it was; we got a studio on the top floor! What an absolutely outstanding view - we can see both north and south head as well as the ocean over towards Bondi area and the Sydney Cricket Ground (where the game is still playing as we speak under lights). As usual the check in was quick and efficient with well presented staff. The room is typically Meriton furnished - which means very nice and comfortable. A small kitchen (remember it's only a studio) - which has a 2 burner halogen stove with rangehood, a Smeg convection microwave (if you can't cook a full meal in this thing, short of steak or pan fried food, you can't cook anything) and a half sized Smeg dishwasher. An Omega washer/dryer combined (not a fan of those as everything comes out creased beyond belief if you dry in them) and bar sized fridge. The bathroom doesn't have a bath but it's a studio - and with this view, who is in bathtub?? I'm sitting watching the lights outside as I write this. The windows open hearing the buzz of the city 55 floors below. The king sized bed is also a welcome comfort as this is what we sleep in at home. I know it will be comfortable as all the beds have been in the past quite firm, just the way we like them. A quick lie down on it earlier showed that it was the same as we are used to here. Full sized wardrobe space and a marble 2 person square dining table with a separate office nook near the almost floor to ceiling windows - this place is awesome. There is a lap style pool and sauna with a spa pool (which isn't really heated). It's great if you don't have anyone with their horrible screaming/screeching vile children running between all three. I don't mind children provided they're behaved. Why don't seem people stop their children from interrupting other's relaxation? The place is enclosed in glass so if you luck out and have these types of children running around you'd best leave and come back another time, because their ignorant parents won't do anything about them. The location is fantastic if you want to go to Chinatown or Darling Harbour. Personally we think Darling Harbour and King Street Wharf are waaaaay overpriced. Better to go down to a small Chinatown restaurant where you can walk and check out the menus (steer clear of Dixon Street - the main pedestrian mall - unless you want cheap mass produced goopy Americanised Chinese food at inflated prices). From here in 5 mins you can get to a underground railway station or in about 7 mins you can be at the light rail which takes you over to the cosmopolitan Glebe or the Star City Casino. The rail network is excellent if you want to jump a couple of stops down to Circular Quay which has got to be the best view from a railway platform in the world - The Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge right in front of you - all for about 4 or 5 dollars from near the Meriton on Kent. About 5 mins walk to the Queen Victoria Building (which is stunningly beautiful) where you can see the original parchment signed by Queen Elizabeth II on it's opening. Walking through that place is magic - especially around now at Xmas time, looking down all the open federation tiled floor openings to the basement and watching the foot traffic is an hour's enjoyment on its own. We get a deal on parking nearby but if you want to park here you can get it for $35 a night - steep it might seem - that's not bad for Sydney City overnight. At least here you get multiple in/out privileges. If you park in a carpark it's one time in and one time out each time before you pay again. Immaculately clean and always a pleasure to walk into - we casn't go past the Kent Street Meriton. Give it a try - we hope you like it as much as we do. Have a look at the photos I took today. For sure we will be back. We find it on the edge of good value to expensive, but the location, cleanliness and attention to detail keep us coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in CBD”
Reviews.Author: MikeyOz
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights from 1/12/2011. I have been here before,and this stay was no disappointment. Walking distance to all of the CBD and Darling Harbour. Quiet rooms with a fresh feel and clean bathrooms. Hot water in the shower night and day. The price can put you off at times - but keep an eye on their specials, when the rooms are under $200/night - they are worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a short term stay”
Reviews.Author: Nonny16
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at these apartments. Well stocked kitchen, comfortable lounge and dining. The views were good, and the airconditioners really chilly. We booked a "queen' room, the master bedroom had two single beds pushed together to form a King bed, however was uncomfortable due to the raised edges in the middle and the springs in the mattress were sticking into us! We mentioned this at checkout and were told they were were currently in the process of replacng all the beds....this didnt help us get a good nights sleep! Location great for mono rail or restaurants and easy walk to the Power House museum and Markets.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: PKR_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place and found it great. Well located for public transport, dining and tourist attractions. The apartment was spacious and clean. As they were serviced apartments, I wasn't expecting a quick daily clean and towel check which was a bonus. The gym was adequate and the pool was cool, although it didn't bother the kids. The price was much better than most places I checked out and we would definitely stay there again. In fact I have encouraged my work to book accommodation here for our Sydney trips

Reviews.Title: “Can't say a bad word about it”
Reviews.Author: ronnyk76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here when we went to Sydney for the marathon.We turned up early, they organised our baggage to be stored right away. Our room was neat and clean and the location is really good just off George St only a short walk to some good places to eat. The service we experienced was always very good, staff were always helpful whenever we needed something. The room was quiet and we were always able to get a good nights sleep. We had a one bedroom apartment with kitchen facilities, there is a supermarket just across the road so you could easily cook for yourself if you wanted too. Overall, one of the better places I have stayed in Sydney. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back here for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: richardbernstein
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a one night stay and going out for the evening then this would be better suited to you than us. The 'serviced side consists of a less than 5 minute make of the bed and change of twoels ONLY if you leaver them in the shower. No vacuum, cleanse of sinks. Outrageous when you stay there for 6 nights and booked a 'serviced apartment'. Both remote controals to the TV were taped over to keep batteries in. The dish washer did not clean and the clothes tumble dryer's timer did not work. TV was fuzzy. We were not asked once (not even on checking out) if we enjoyed our stay. We felt the service was unfriendly and the staff did not appear to care. Most things you'de need were there for kitchen and we were able to cook and we had a great view (though were unlucky with the weather). So if you are going foir one night and are not looking to really use the place then it would work - but not for a 6 days!

Reviews.Title: “Central and perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Stephster73
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect stay for 2 35+yr olds staying in Sydney. Great space, good kitchenette, 500m from the train station (airport transfer) and close to everything. We walked everywhere with ease. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good”
Reviews.Author: Daren L
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Meriton Kent street in a studio apartment. Like so many other serviced apartments the Meriton is quite o.k., with reasonable facilities and adequate rooms. The studio room was spacious enough, with a kitchenette, standard bathroom, TV (with Foxtel) and was clean and tidy. The indoor pool was nice however the gym is looking a little tired and needs a revamp. The location is good and surrounded by a number of pub's, bars and restaurants, and is close to Darling Harbour and Chinatown. My biggest criticism would be the level of street noise that invades the room all night long. I have stayed here of a few occasions now as my company has a preferred rate, and on each occasion have been woken by alarms, sirens and even people shouting in the street below. I don't know if it is the sound proofing of the hotel, or simply that the area is typically noisy. The hotel itself is generally o.k.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: wendyinafrica
Reviews.Content: What a brilliant location...I have just returned from staying 7nights here, booked a studio and requested a high floor with a view...Firstly location..Brilliant in the heart of everything, I walked all over the place, and enjoyed the closeness to China Town, Darling Harbor as well as the City in general..The Studio..perfect for one or two...please note there is not a sofa bed or lounge where you could add another adult, although spacious enough I guess they could add a rollaway for a child but donot book a studio if you have more than 2 without asking for extra bed..The kitchen looked functional, although to be honest I only made coffee the whole time I stayed...the washing machine took forever but I was extremely grateful for it as I had been travelling for some time and needed to do a wash! ...I prepaid my internet at sydney airport so I did not use the apartments internet which was expensive, as was phone calls..so best be self sufficient here..I loved the view from my room on 46th floor over darling harbor..the staff were lovely and cheery and I LOVE that about sydney...the taxi rank is directly outside the building...no problem getting a taxi to the airport at 5am!! This is wonderful value for money...so keep in mind on the weekends (especially saturday night) there seems alot of noise and the building sort of changes from a great business apartment to a more roudy place...but hey that was OK 1 night of noise as apposed to 6nts of quiet...and the fireworks display from Darling Harbor was brilliant!!

Reviews.Title: “An awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: trixiedior
Reviews.Content: we were 2 couples looking for a self catering apartment in the city of sydney for 4 nights and Meriton Kent st fit the bill perfectly. This apartment had a massive balcony with views of Darling Harbour. The modern kitchen had everything required, including the dishwasher tablets and dishwashing liquid. A fully equipped laundry including dryer was an added bonus. Check in was very fast and the duty manager very friendly. The hotel is very centrally located , just a quick two min walk to Town Hall Station. There is a great coffee shop downstairs, and an AMAZING Vietnamese restaurant called PHO next door. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Two bedroom units highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: TripVisorAustralia
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Kent St Meriton before in a one bedroom apartment and thought it was decent, but wasn't overly impressed. The two bedroom apartments seem to be on higher floors and have balconies and a good amount of space, which raises their impression. Service was quick and friendly and the facilities are decent. The location is of course excellent, though bathrooms could stand a little more attention when being cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “As good, if not better, than any hotel”
Reviews.Author: Antwerpengl
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights at Meriton Kent Street during a city trip to Sydney. My stay was overall a very good experience. Meriton is situated in the heart of the CBD only a few steps away from the main shopping street George Street, the Queen Victoria Building and town hall. The Airport shuttle train stops at a 3 min walk (exit Town Hall) and the bus to Bondi Beach can be caught near Hyde Park, only 5 min. away. Darling Harbour, Circular Quay and the Opera House are a 10 to 15 min walk but are not far either. As the apartments are virtually on the route of the free shuttle bus service, even that can be shortened considerably. The building seems to be new and on arrival awaits a friendly and helpful staff for check-in and general info about the city. I had a studio but it was surprisingly large with a large bed, well equipped kitchen, nice and rather spacious bathroom and sitting corner. All amenities were there. Rooms are spot clean and wel taken care off. As I left and my plane was late in the afternoon they allowed me to use my room an hour longer although they had a full house that same evening. There is a small bathroom I could use to freshen up downstairs later in the afternoon. One downpoint though : the internet charges are over the top. Unbelievable that in a city like Sydney, where obviously business people are a large part of the clientÃ¨le, these prices are charged. On top of it it is stil cabled and not WiFi. Meriton needs to do something about it. 5 AU$ / hour is just not done ....

Reviews.Title: “Top stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: WellingtonGavin
Reviews.Content: We just keep coming back to Meriton and we are never dfisappointed. This is a top value for money apartment hotel. One of our musts for all but the most polluted places in the wirld is to have a balcony. We stayed on two sepeate nights over a long weekend - both rooms were roomy and comfortable - great place to sit back and relax and enjoy views of the city. Definitely staying next time we visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: Baldies
Reviews.Content: A great recent 5 night stay here. Our family of 4 fitted very comfortably in the generously sized apartment. Staff nice. Good kitchen with nice range utensils/saucepans etc. Great location. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “return visit as ecellent as first”
Reviews.Author: totarapom
Reviews.Content: I have visited Sydney, using the Meriton for business and this is the first family visit. Still the same excellent service and great location for tourist and business interests alike. I was interested that the family had the same response as I had on business...that this was a hotel group that really was concerned with tenants having a positive experience in the city of their choice....great stuff i was very impressed with the service and quality of our sky view one bedroom apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation & great location. Recommend.”
Reviews.Author: hskhsk
Reviews.Content: I was able get off the train from the airport and get to Meriton Kent St very easily. Great location. Lots of restaurants and bars that are within walking distance. Was able to walk to Darling Harbour in 10 minutes. Rooms are excellent- we stayed in a studio apartment, which had a king size bed, kitchen area and washing machine and dryer, which is very handy. Our room was very clean and quite spacious. Staff are very friendly and helpful. There's excellent spa, swimming pool, sauna and gym facilities. I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: gkg28
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Meriton Kent Street for 3 nights. We arrived very early from Perth and the hotel were able to check us into our room immediately, which was a nice bonus. We stayed in a studio apartment. It was quite roomy, very clean and reasonably quiet. We heard a little noise from the street and the corridors but the rooms were well sound proofed from each other. The room also includes a washing machine and dryer which would be great for someone on a longer trip. The only negative was that the little laundry room smelled of stagnant drains, so we had to keep the doors closed across it. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel is in a great location, close to China town, Darling Harbour, Pitt Street Mall and a $10 taxi ride to Circular key - or a 20 minute walk. Overall we were very happy with our choice of accommodation.
