Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SRM30
Reviews.Content: Exhibiting at the Sydney Exhibition Centre calls for long days setting up and attending the stand. We took Trip Advisor recommendations and stayed at the Meriton Apartments in Kent Street. A perfect choice for a central location close to hundreds of restaurants, a few minutes walk to Darling Harbour and with basement car parking. We would recommend the Meriton Apartments in Kent Street to anyone wanting a spacious and well appointed apartment in central Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “good service apartment for families”
Reviews.Author: kelly_ngkl
Reviews.Content: we booked the 2 bedroom apartment 4 nights for our family of 4 at AUD175 per nite via the meriton website direct with a spring promotion. lucky us~! the bedroom was well furnished ~ nice neat clean living room w balcony ~ make me feel at home open concept kicten ~ excellent! well equipped for my mom to prepare meals for us daily location ~ good & accessible ~ near the busy streets but not too near to absorb their noisness at night overall the expericence is wonderful~! will definitly book again during my visit to sydney~!!!

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Sonlou73
Reviews.Content: This was our annual girls weekend, being a group of 6 mothers ranging from mid 20's to mid 30's. Our apartment was on Level 56 with 3 bedrooms. When we walked into the apartment we couldn't believe how spacious and modern it was. There was no noise from the street, the rooms were clean, the view was lovely. We felt like we were up in the clouds we were so high up! We spent the evenings in the closed in balcony overlooking chinatown and glimpses of darling harbour, with some great food and wine from the takeaway restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DreaminAgain
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night on the weekend and were pleasantly surprised to find we were upgraded from a studio to a 2 bedroom apartment. This accommodation is clean and spacious, the bed was comfortable and it was great to have a kitchen and balcony. Underground parking was available for added cost. Our room was on the 30th floor and had nice views from the windows and balcony. The balcony was a little noisy as is to be expected. We also noticed a little noise coming from the lifts and hallways, but nothing too bad. The only thing I didn't like was the water saving shower rose. This location was excellent for access to Chinatown, Darling Harbour Precinct and the Entertainment Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - Great Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: fitzfloyd
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed a week in a two bedroom apartment with two bathrooms. We were on the 50th floor with a view of the water. It was a lovely apartment, with a balcony and plenty of room to relax, and was located not far from key tourist locations. Eateries and a small supermarket are located nearby. When we first arrived one afternoon we were advised that our room was not yet ready; after thirty minutes the room was still unavailable. The person at the desk organised an upgrade for us, which we were thrilled about and we spent the rest of week relaxing in our wonderful apartment, grateful for the excellent front counter staff. As tourists to Sydney, we felt the Kent Street apartment was a great choice: it gave us room to stretch out compared to individual hotel rooms and we were not compelled to eat out every meal time. I'd recommend booking direct with Meriton apartments, as their website sets out lots of room options which are not necessarily displayed through the various booking agencies. The prices rise steeply over weekends, so you may be able to avoid weekends or, alternatively, select an apartment which suits the budget. I'd definitely return, and recommend to families and friends. We chose the accommodation on the basis of Tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “An odd building...but okay”
Reviews.Author: mjref
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night last week for work. A colleague and I checked in separately; she got an upgrade to a 2 bedroom apartment on the 24th floor while I got a studio on the 15th floor. When I asked if I got an upgrade too the reply was, "No." The check-in staff weren't friendly but they did their job. The studio was nice enough but the building is strange. There are three, maybe four rooms on each floor with the lifts in the middle. You can hear the lifts going up and down from inside the room but I was near the office lifts (companies on floors 1-15, hotel on floors 15-up) so the noise was pretty much non-existant after 6pm. The studio had everything you need - kitchen, washing machine, dryer etc. There was a big TV, a table, a desk and a comfy seat. The bed was a king size; however, the four pillows were big. When I rang reception to see if they had different ones again the reply was, "No." Any half decent hotel/motel has two types of pillows: a thick one and a thinner one. Not this place though. There was a reasonable amount of noise from the street, and combined with the poor pillows I didn't sleep very well. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from QVB at the start of Chinatown. There are plenty of cafes nearby to get some breakfast. I walked down to Darling Harbour (two minutes) then up to Miller's Point and the Rocks - a lovely walk. Would I go back? If I was travelling by myself, no. With my family, maybe. If I did I would ask for a room on a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: nickandlou1
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel is you have business at Darling Harbour or in Chinatown. Close to many restaurants and shops. We had a two bedroom, two bathroom apartment for three girls sharing for a week. The hotel was really clean and well equipped. We loved having a balcony and some fresh air. We were on a high floor so noise was not too bad from the street. I think it would be noisy lower down though. We will definately stay again next year!

Reviews.Title: “a great experience”
Reviews.Author: mci_11
Reviews.Content: Booked for one night a two bedroom 2 bathroom skyview room. Well worth the extra as being on higher level meant no noise, view of Darling Harbour ok. Quiet for Sydney, clean and comfortable. Close to restaurants and walking distance to shops. Pity couldn't stay longer, perfect for a family as it had a full kitchen and laundry. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views over darling harbor”
Reviews.Author: crystalblue71
Reviews.Content: This the second time I have stayed here both times have been great, location close to everything, awesome views from apartment. Used gym & pool. Apt are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: j-lho
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, walking distance to underground train station, QVB, Westfield, Darling Harbour, Cinemas, supermarkets,restaurants and China Town. I booked one bedroom apartment for 4 nights, the room was spacious, with windows from ceiling to floor and very quiet. Bathroom was clean and the housekeeping cleaned the room everyday. I would recommend this apartment to my friends, and I definitely would stay in this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Space Great Location”
Reviews.Author: barrindp
Reviews.Content: Booked a one bed apt for a overnight trip to sydney. It is so nice to be able to enter the room, and not feel that you are sitting on the bed to watch tv or have dinner - the ability to cook for oneself is great. Location wise - this place is awesome near the outdoor shops of kent street, the trendy shopping of the QVB and Pitt St Mall, and the entertainment and night life of china town, darling harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, centrally located, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: FreeHoliday
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently from the end of September until October for 12 days. Our studio appartment was on the 48th floor, very quiet, and quite roomy for the 2 of us. The king size bed was very comfortable and honestly, I slept better than I do most nights at home in my own bed! The location cannot be beat, we were able to walk to and from the Opera House, the harbour and bridge, and just a couple of blocks to Darling Harbour. Minor inconveniences were solved with calling the front desk (towels, extra laundry soap, etc.). I do have to say that the combo washer/dryer is not what I was used to so scratched my head a bit figuring out how to use it, but really appreciated having it. We had to check out to go to Brisbane yesterday on business, and I am missing the Meriton very much. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, everything you need”
Reviews.Author: Cloodle
Reviews.Content: The apartment was nice, comfortable, clean and spacious. We were only on the 15th floor (reception/ground is on the 10th floor, so 15 is not high up) and consequently the view was nothing special - looking out over the local shops. Reasonably well located, within walking distance of Darling Harbour, Oxford St shops and bars, CBD attractions. We didn't spend much time in the apartment so can't comment on the kitchen/tv facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TheGilboids
Reviews.Content: The Meriton apartment was great, everything we hoped for. A great studio in the centre of town (we walked nearly everywhere.) Nice bed, nice bathroom etc. Only thing was that the CD player, then the microwave were broken, and we asked for them to be fixed, but it took a while for someone to fix them both times (about 3 days for the CD player.) Also they only gave us one roll of loo paper at a time... meaning we had to go to reception to get some more. But overall it was great, staff friendly, great location, modern rooms, amazing views, I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, contemporary apartment in the heart of Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: Ruthie3005
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in an apartment rather than a hotel as we were travelling on a budget and wanted to have the option of self catering. We were delighted with our one bedroomed serviced apartment not only because the kitchen was fully equipped with a full oven and all that you needed to make a meal but also because it was cheaper than some hotels we had considered. Besides all this it was a spacious, clean and sleek modern apartment, a real home away from home. The staff on reception were helpful and friendly and the location excellent, in the heart of the CBD, we were able to walk to most places around the city. All in all a great experience for the last leg of our Australian trip. I would most definately stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous View on level 42!”
Reviews.Author: Sang M
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my girlfriend, we were lucky enough to get an apartment on the 42nd floor facing out to the darling harbour. Although it was slightly obstructed by a building, it was not high enough to be much of a problem, try get a floor above level 30 and it should be well out of your way. It is located as the name suggests, on the corner of Kent Street. It is basically in the CBD so all your local food and entertainment is just conveniently located at your door step! There is even a movie theater 2minutes walk down the road! However, this property is located on the opposite side of the city in reference to the Oprah House, we walked from the hotel to the Oprah House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge and it took us roughly 20 minutes. Or you can bus it, the bus is just down stairs! The room we got was excellent! Extremely clean and spacious (studio room). Amenities were restocked daily and bed was made daily as well. The rooms also have a small safe. Although it was a little expensive (since we were traveling for the new years eve period), but overall, we thought it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and stunning views”
Reviews.Author: chrismarkadams
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment, and decided to pay a little more to have one of the top floors and we did not regret it at all. The view of darling harbour was amazing, made all the better by a firework display while we were there (not sure why). It is close to Paddys Market, and circular quay so you can so easily get to everywhere in Sydney. Having said that, the location also means that it is walking distance to everywhere. We also used the indoor pool one day, which was clean and nice, and there was also a sauna. If you want to spend some time in theiddle of Sydney, and for great value, this is it. The room also had a small kitchen, which we never cooked in, but was handy to have a fridge etc. It also had a decent TV and a safety deposit box. The room also had a balconly to enjoy the view. Recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment in great location”
Reviews.Author: Toby H
Reviews.Content: Nice modern apartment hotel, I had a studio room. It had everything you could ever need in it, laundry and all. Location is great, just back from George St which is main road through cbd. Easy ride from airport on train to Town Hall station. There is a Coles up the road, so you can stock up the giant fridge in the room with food to cook for yourself if you don't feel like eating out or breakfast in room. Nice asian food shops down stairs, no need to go far from some really tasty and cheap dinners. I was on George St side of building, so noise from the street can carry upwards at night, I was tired and slept no problem but a light sleeper might find that hard. I would definitely stay again, it it close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and central location.”
Reviews.Author: 1dolcevita1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for six weeks while relocating to Sydney from Ireland. The apartment was gorgeous- very spacious and the bed super comfy! Housekeeping very polite and helpful should you need anything. The concierges also very smiley and helpful. Some of the reception staff could be a bit friendlier but would still defo recommend here to people of all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and much better than a hotel room”
Reviews.Author: shabangle23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in January 2011. Having stayed ina hotel on our first night in Sydney (to help ease jetlag!) we wanted a bit more space and independence so chose an apartment. These are in a great location close to Darling Harbour. And easy 30 minute walk to Circular Quay. Plenty of bars and restaurants nearby if you want to eat out close to the apartment. The washing machine and dryer were great to have, bathroom was very well equipped and the kitchen facilities were just what we wanted. We didn't cook in, but used it only for breakfasts and to have the odd lunch in which was perfect. The staff were helpful if we needed any advice on getting around. Overall a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: zia30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the meriton for 3 nights at the kent street since it was cheaper than the other meriton apartments. It is very well located, 10 minutes walk to darling harbour and 2 minutes walk to the free shuttle bus that can bring you to the circular quay. We booked a two bedroom apartment and were on the 41st floor with a beautiful view of the city (not of the harbour unfortunately :( ). Rooms were clean and tidy, everything available. A coles supermarket is 5 minutes away so you can do all your shopping there and in the shopping center. I found the visitor center in darling harbour a bit disappointing with the lady not being helpful at all, i wanted to know how to take public transport, the monorail, and she did not even explain, just gave me a copy of the route of the free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Central Location, Quiet room”
Reviews.Author: JenfromNorcal
Reviews.Content: Meriton on Kent was our final hotel, finishing up a two week vacation to Australia. Our room was on the 55th floor and being so high-was incredibly quiet. This seems to be a newer property and our room reflected that. We appreciated the kitchenette with the refrigerator and tea/coffee fixings. The beds were comfortable. The location is great - just a short walk to the harbor and a 20 minute walk to Circular Quay. Our room had a beautiful view of the harbor. We took advantage of the free wifi in the lobby to check email - a nice bonus :) I would recommend Meriton on Kent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Business accomm. Meriton- Kent Street”
Reviews.Author: AWCfarjar
Reviews.Content: I always stay with Meriton Kent Street when in Sydney for business (15-odd visits/year). This is a newer premises (opened 2005?). Usually spacious rooms (except one, stuck around a corner). For family accommodation I'd use either here or Meriton World Square around the corner (more bedrooms). Staff are great- courteous & friendly. Rooms are clean & tidy, with decent mattresses and copious pillows. Air-con is simple, effective (and you can open the windows if you want fresh air. Centrally located 2 blocks away from Queen Victoria Building (QVB), near China Town, Short walk across Pyrmont Bridge to Darling Harbour. Lots of restaurants nearby. Cinemas around the block. Usually exceptional value. Couldn't find anywhere else for this quality/value in Sydney CBD. Only negatives are carparking expense ($35/d) and trying to get early check-in because they're always booked to capacity (because they're so good!). I'd definitely recommend them! Overall...Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Inner city Reasonably priced apartment”
Reviews.Author: craigmcgrath66
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location of this inner city apartment .. just steps from little spain and little china- korea - and Japan ..... one block to townhall station etc etc etc This is the first time I have stayed here -- for the price it is very reasonable, apartments are looking a little sad in places, which reflects the maker..... But a very comfortable stay -- I would go back

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: constanttraveller26
Reviews.Content: Stay was principally for business but had a few days at the end for leisure and it was perfect for both. Accomodation was on the 49th floor in a studio apartment, ideal for one person or a couple. There was a fully functional kitchen with a washer/dryer for laundry. Room was a good size, modern , clean and quiet and we even had a lovely view of Darling Harbour. It is in a handy location, about half hour walk to Circular Quay and 15 mins to the Pitt St Mall. Free Bus Service (No 555) is just around the corner and Town Hall station a 3 min walk which makes all parts of Sydney CBD accessible. Lots of nice inexpensive places to eat nearby and good shopping area surrounds. It is just around the corner from World Square. All our requests were honoured and staff were prompt to respond to any housekeeping oversights we had. Would definitely recommend and we will stay again when we go to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “My annual home away from home”
Reviews.Author: dmrudy
Reviews.Content: This last trip was my third and is now my ONLY GO TO place in Sydney . I spend an average of 3 weeks there every December and although they have thousands of people coming and going they always remember me when I arrive and it's great to see the same staff year after year. I've stayed at others and the service here just gets better and better. Also you MUST try the Sky Apartments, they are spacious and have amazing views! The only (and big) DOWNSIDE is the extremely expensive internet fee (especially for long term stays and repeat customers). Looking forward to my trip this December (2011) for an entire month but not too excited about paying for that internet access I need for work. See everybody soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice studio apartment but dusty!”
Reviews.Author: camerartist
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the way the studio apartment was set up. Nice and spacious. Looked very clean until we opened the cupboard to take out some cups to find dust floating out as well. Apparently, the top empty shelf was not wiped. When we started to sneeze constantly every time we're back at the apartment (we stayed for 2 nights), we decided to check other corners and sure enough, there was dust at the TV area as well. We've stayed quite regularly at Meriton at World Square. This was our first stay at Kent St. Will we go back again? Yes and no. Depending on the rates offered and the competition out there. Plenty of choices in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for a Family!”
Reviews.Author: KillarneyFarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the weekend in two x two bedroom apartments because we were a family group of seven.The apartments were spacious and well appointed.Most of the staff were helpful and gracious.It is situated close to a nice restaurant called 'Mamma's' where we ended up having breakfast and dinner! and it's quite close to the train station and shops.I think if I was staying in Sydney with just my husband I would prefer a hotel but it was the perfect option for the group.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Sydney visit”
Reviews.Author: paulberckmans
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom on 46th floor with fantastic views to Darling Harbour. Check-in was flawless and we were very pleased with the customer service at front desk. Wireless internet did not work but everything was sorted out and we received a wireless internet credit for the first day. Apartment was wonderful, marge balcony, spacious and clean. Kids used the swimming pool and very positive. Location is great for Sydney. Close to Market Street, Pitt Street and just 15 min walk to Circular Quay or Darling Harbour. Can recommend Meriton at Kent Street. Paul Berckmans Switzerland

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely use again and again”
Reviews.Author: 255100Diane
Reviews.Content: Whenever I travel to Sydney, CBD I always use the Meriton Serviced apartments. This time it was the Kent St apartments, but I have also stayed at Pitt St. They are conveniently located just a ten or fifteen minute walk from Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, The Rocks and Chinatown. You can also use the monorail to get around if you prefer. You can travel by train or taxi from the airport. They are clean and comfortable and the staff are always courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice one bedroom apartment - fully equipped”
Reviews.Author: OZinNY
Reviews.Content: A great location in the Sydney CBD very close to Sydney's Chinatown, Darling Harbour, Queen Victoria Building and all local transportation. Buses run along George Street, and the nearest train station is Town Hall two blocks away. We were on a mid-level floor (32nd floor) with a generous balcony that gave us a view down George Street. The apartment is a good size and nicely furnished, with a decent kitchenette. Heating and cooling are provided by separate split reverse cycle units in the bedroom and living area. The only downside is that the bathroom is not attached to the bedroom. There is a washer and dryer. The staff are helpful and pleasant. Parking is $30 per day and internet access (wired and WiFi) is extra.

Reviews.Title: “Good apartments”
Reviews.Author: Rubiru
Reviews.Content: We needed a two bed apartment, price good, rooms nothing flash but functional and clean. We found this apartment better than the one on Pitt Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay In Sydney I'd rate it Perfect”
Reviews.Author: travelopolos
Reviews.Content: Stayed Feb, 2011, for one week. 3 couples, 2 shared a 2 bed, 2 bath apartment. 3rd couple had a studio. We arrived 6 AM after a 16 hour flight from the US. To our surpise and delight they checked us into our rooms right away! Very accomodating staff. Lovely flat with balcony, city and harbor view, room for 6 of us to eat in the dining area. Very clean, everything we needed was there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay if You Enjoy Comfort without The Price Tag”
Reviews.Author: lackingdiscipline
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Meriton on a regular basis and I can't really fault them. Sure, it would be great to have a nice restaurant, bar and perhaps some conventional 5 star luxuries however their position always guarantees that you are not to far away from these amenities should you wish to splurge. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great for a family shopping break”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_NZ120
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on a short break in Sydney. We had a two bedroom apartment. Each bedroom had a king size bed (the sort that can be unzipped into two singles if required). One bedroom had a full ensuite bathroom, plus there was a full bathroom right outside the other bedroom. The apartment had a combined kitchen/living/dining room, with cable TV. A very comfortable room that suited our family or four but would have been equally good for two couples. Kitchen was adequately equipped (we only used it for breakfasts) with a microwave and a full oven and hob. The view from the 46th floor was great, to the southwest with views of Botany Bay. Location is fine: just near the corner of Kent and Liverpool streets (right at the Spanish quarter). Chinatown and Paddys Markets just two blocks to the south. Main Sydney shopping (QVB, Pitt St Mall) 2 blocks to the north. Town Hall Station is nearest (one and a half blocks to the north) but note that there are stairs to get out of the station if you have lots of luggage. 5 lifts servicing the apartments, so never too long a wait. We paid $A285 per night. Hard to get a double hotel room in Sydney for under $A200 so worked out fine for the 4 of us. Being able to self cater for breakfast also keeps the costs down. There are good supermarkets within two blocks walk (at Town Hall Station) so easy to stock up.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: dcp772000
Reviews.Content: Serviced apartments in a skyscraper in the middle of Sydney. The flats are not big (at least not the one we booked) but are of a high standard, with new, tasteful furniture decoration. The bathroom had a big shower and good toiletries. It was also nice to have good electricals, like a washing machine that would also effectively dry your clothes, and a normal hairdryer (not the usual lousy one attached to the wall). Dishes and washing soap is provided. This place has also a decently big pool (indoor) with sauna and whirpool and a small but complete gym. It does not provide breakfast or food of any kind (as far as I know), but in this area you will be spoiled for choice. Just be careful that the parking space might end up costing more than your room at 30AUS$ per day, but the prices are the same wherever you park in this are of Sydney. I would not even consider keeping a car in this city, public transport is good and will cost you nothing compared to the stress of one-way systems, toll roads and extorsionate parking.

Reviews.Title: “I keep going back all the time”
Reviews.Author: greenerie
Reviews.Content: I enjoy Meriton apartments very much, that's why I keep going back to stay. I travel once every 2 months to Sydney, and always put up at Meriton. Great location, excellent service, well maintained and clean apartments. Please keep up the great work! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but...”
Reviews.Author: ormiston62
Reviews.Content: Great location in Spanish quarter, next to Chinatown and nearby Darling Harbour. Beautiful modern apartment, with mirrored bedroom ceiling I would have once thought tacky, but a great decor affect. Although clean due to minimalist look no eye for cleaning detail, especially in kitchen. Problem was my partner became unwell and was hospitalised, it was disappointing the hotel charged us $60 for a 1pm late checkout, we were there for 3 nights and expected a little more compassion than this. especially in this economic climate Overall recommended.

Reviews.Title: “clean, central with nice facilities”
Reviews.Author: anhei
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a single bedroom apartment for a few weeks - the place is very central, which also has some effects on the sound level you have to endure. Tip: request high floor. The apartment had a well equipped kitchen, complete with dishwasher, microwave, oven, etc. Also provided was a washing machine and drier. The room itself was large enough in size with a table, 4 chairs, desk and a sofa. Good size flat screen TV, however very few channels and no DVD player. I resorted to my laptop to view some movies. Which leads to the internet, in my opinion too expensive. Typically people would stay longer in a place like this, so I think it would be a good advise for them to provide cheaper internet (I just bought a telstra modem for the time I was there). Bedroom with closet was simple and clean. The only thing noticeable is that the bed is mostly occupied by one person only, so if you're two you kinda slide towards the middle a bit. Bathroom with shower including amenities which were toped up daily. Sink was a bit of a disaster with water hardly flowing out thus leaving a bit of a mess behind. Balcony could not be used due to winter weather - also it is very noisy (stayed on the 20th floor) The place also features a large pool and a nice gym.

Reviews.Title: “Long stay ...”
Reviews.Author: Adventure_heart
Reviews.Content: We have relocated with my job, and have stayed at the Meriton on Kent for more than a month. If you are staying for a week, my observations wont matter, it is most probably a great stay for a week or weekend. Spacious rooms, good views in some apartments. Extremely clean (great cleaning!) and front staff is fairly efficient, I wont say friendly but they do their job. Easy walking distance to entertainment, restaurants, etc. Note - Don't stay, if you cant sleep with street noise, as George street is busy until 3-4am on weekends, and there is only single glassing, might not matter on the 50th floor but does on the 30th, but that is inner city living! However if you are have been allocated an apartment as part of relocation or you are a consultant for a long stay, go somewhere else. Internet is crap (and very expensive at least if you have to pay for it out of your own pocket), and extremely slow on the weekends when the place is full and working on the weekend has become a nightmare! From a corporate establishment I expect that internet is always available and high speed, and at $310 for 4 weeks, I think I am reasonable. Also, plan ahead if you have to be at a meeting at 9am, and add on at least 10mins for the lifts! There is suppose to be 5 lifts for guests and 1 for service, during the month that we stayed here I have ever only seen 4 lifts operating (inc service one)! There is at least 10 units on 37 floors, so rush hour applies every morning, weekdays 8.30 to 9.30am, weekends check out time is 10am so go out at 9am or wait till 11 ;)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property with excellent location and service.”
Reviews.Author: bchapman23
Reviews.Content: This property offers excellent service from staff that are always available to answer questions and is located close to darling harbour and China town which offers a huge selection of restaurants. The rooms are modern, clean, well maintained and fully equipped. Parking is available on site with the usual Sydney cost. The only frustration at Meriton is the long wait for lifts during peak periods. If you are flexible (other than bang on 10am) with your morning departure time this will not be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, clean, friendly, :-)”
Reviews.Author: DamoTassie
Reviews.Content: Stayed mid June 2011 for 2 nights. Location is 10 minute walk from Town Hall train station, Darling Harbour or Pitt St Mall. Front counter service at check in excellent and was offer free upgrade. ;-) Sky view outstanding, excellent heating / cooling options, outside seating area see photos (on 49 level). Room very clean, modern facilities decor Two bedroom, two bathroom apartment Very FAST lifts... excellent security Will stay again with children....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience, perfect for younge couple”
Reviews.Author: Teresita86
Reviews.Content: Great location on the verge of China Town. Only a 10 min stroll to Darling Harbour and close to all public transport including the monorail. We found it pretty easy to walk most places in the city from here and if u have a spare 40-60 min you can even walk up to circular quay and the harbour. The first thing that we noticed when we walked in was that the lobby smelt beautiful and fresh and clean everyday it was a nice touch. The room was great, we used the kitchen for our breakfast each morning and cooked a few meals in the evening, there were plenty of utensils to use. I was a bit surprised with the bed because it specified King but was actually 2 single beds pushed together but was comfortable none the less. The room was clean, the bathroom was not huge but just the right size for 2 people, we had a large TV and plenty of storage space. The view from our room on level 41 was of the city and the darling harbour and the pool, spa and sauna facilities were great too. The staff were helpful enough and overall the Meriton on Kent is great value for money, we would definitely go back and would recommend for anyone wanting comfort but not on a huge budget.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't like their extortionist deposit policy and we'll not go back”
Reviews.Author: YuriKAct
Reviews.Content: Location. Very good. Room. Good apartment. Views. Extremely good (55 floor) Rates. 350+ per Saturday night. Definitely not cheap. Problems. Deposit policy. Taking deposit, they get access to the guests' credit card and cover their expenses at the guests' account. In our case they took $70 for a toilet seat that cracked when it was in use. They refused to recognize that it was normal tear and wear and claimed money as if we broke it deliberately. So anyone staying at this property is strongly advised not to use anything in the apartment as it can break and the guest will be taken accountable. Or much better just don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good city base, no problems”
Reviews.Author: supamkee
Reviews.Content: Check-in more was more efficient than friendly (very busy at check-in/out times!). The usual apartment bond condition applies so make sure you've got a few extra dollars left on the credt card. Parking costs are high too, I'd leave car elsewhere next time or try and use public transport given the central location. Rate seemed to be on par with similar offerings in the cbd. We had a Studio which was great for a couple for a short stay - clean and comfortable, furnished in a typically corporate style, definitely apartment more than hotel. Bit annoyed you couldn't access the outside verandah but not a deal breaker on a short stay. Airconditioning did its job. Comfortable king bed which was good, managed to sleep pretty well even with the typical city street soundtrack outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Akkadian
Reviews.Content: Excellent accommodation choice. Very central to everything with train station just round the corner. No need for taxis or the bus as you're so close to the harbour, shopping and eateries. Great cheap meals just across the road. Room was spacious and very tidy. Price was cheaper than most hotels we looked at in Sydney and was a very nice place to stay. Recommended for a weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “ONLY ONE SMALL COMPLAINT!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dougalHorsham
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 3 nights at the Meriton Kent Street Apartments. Booked through the Meriton Website and all requests were met. Easy checkin by a lovely young receptionist and given our keys. Had difficutly locating room and then even more actually using the key to enter. This was remedied very quickly and we entered room 5004A. This room has been covered by a previous review so no need to go into any great depth but we were more than impressed. 50th Floor, great size and a great little balcony. Fully stocked kitchen, laundry, nice bathroom and then the bedroom. This is my little complaint. I am so not into mirrors above beds. Had actually considered staying in Kings Cross and at that point thought I was actually in Kings Cross. For the 3 nights that mirror totally freaked me out. Everything else was wonderful and would recommend these apartments to anyone that wanted, views (we had fabulous views), space, all the comforts of home for a pretty reasonable price. Very central to just about everywhere with an abundance of restaurants, supermarkets and pubs. No problems with staff, they were all very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great great location”
Reviews.Author: Sieumuoi
Reviews.Content: Definitely stay here again next time I am in Sydney. It's close to everything

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay !”
Reviews.Author: mamecchi
Reviews.Content: I normally write Japanese reviews, but this time I want to tell more people to share my pleasant stay in English. Forgive for my poor English... I stayed other serviced apartment chains in Sydney and Mel. before, but this chain(Meriton) is the best. Reception staff helped us a lot and tried to fix our room for the early check in. We were assigned 2 bed room( locked the second bed room) The property has free Wi-fi Hotspot at the lobby, but always ask for the password at the reception. (Kitchen) Well equipped kitchen. I loved a Tefron coated flying pan! (Laundry) has got detergents. (Bathroom) has got shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, body cream, soap. (Bed room) very clean and quiet. has got a safe in a closet ( you can put a laptop) (Verandah) has a simple chairs and a table with ash tray. (Location) Easy access to everywhere. Free CBD shuttle bus 555 runs from 9:30-15:30 (M,T,W,F) and extended hours in Th. and weekends. There is Coles supermarket in World square shopping complex in George and Liverpool St. or Woolworth in city hall area. I would highly recommend this property, more space and comfortable in a luxuary hotel price.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place...you will be disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter9978
Reviews.Content: As a family with 2 kids we wanted to stay in Sydney in a comfortable environment. We live in Sydney but recently became expats so were on our annual visit back home. Unfortunately the Meriton at Kent was a disaster! We were there for just over 2 weeks and every second day we had to call housekeeping just to get them to do their job. When they came the rooms were terribly serviced and were often still dirty. We complained and they did nothing. The rooms were dusty, the front-office staff were unhelpful and all they appeared interested in was hot extract more money out of us for anything and everything...internet costs are additional, parking is additional, breakfast not included! There is no concierge, no help and they get you to pay upfront for your apartment!!! The surrounding area is also horrible. We stayed on the 38th floor and could hear traffic down below and were regularly woken up by sirens because the windows in the apartment are not sound proofed. It tried to cook breakfast in the tiny kitchen and had to battle the fire alarm going off every 5 minutes with normal cooking smoke. Our visit was terrible and this was after I had complained a year ago to the manger about similar issues and he had assured me we would be looked after if we stayed again. Well we stayed again and hated it with a passion!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay, would stay here again and again...”
Reviews.Author: Mi33-Review
Reviews.Content: Booked a week before staying on the meriton website and was lucky to book the room I wanted it was a very special occasion for myself and my partner. So we decided to book a 1 bedroom sky view for one night. When it came to checking in they couldn't find my reservation but after asking other staff they soon found it. *Room 5004A on level 50 *Room was $205 + $60 for late check out at 1pm Lucky because a week later, when I looked the same room was $395 a night They were excited to tell us we had been given one of the nicest rooms within the hotel. Level 50 with sky views along with late checkout ($65 extra charge, which had already been asked for and was confirmed without any problems) along with a mirror on the ceiling which took up most of the ceiling over looking the king bed. Was lovely, along with everything else that was within that room. For Example: *Bathroom ~ separate bath, separate shower, rather large basin. *Kitchen ~ Full-size Kitchen, dishwasher, sink, stove and oven, microwave, kettle and all glasses and plates plus much more. *Lounge Area ~ 3 Seater-lounge and a single lounge along with a coffee table, flat screen television and plenty of ample space. *Dining Area ~ 4 seats and a table , with a wrap around window with lovely views looking the other way onto George Street etc. *Balcony ~ lovely views with 2 seats and a table *Laundry ~ Washing machine, dryer, sink, iron board and iron (all located in a closet in the hallway). *Along with plenty of cardboard space within the hallway of the room, the yellow-pages are also in one of these closets. *Bedroom ~ 1 king size bed (actually is two separate beds put together) but this didn't make the bed uncomfortable in anyway, the bed was really roomy and we both had a lovely sleep. Large wardrobe with mirrors on the outside, along with a large ceiling mirror overlooking the bed. *Bit cliche` but I had asked for it because I thought being a special occasion is was called for. Plenty of lighting in every room, opening windows. Only Faults ~ Would have to be the blinds within the bedroom were nice but when it came to early morning the sun really came in and we're shielded in it, as it bounced off the wardrobe mirror and the ceiling mirror. We had a bath but myself being a curvier women it was a bit of a tight squeeze it would of been nicer if the bath was that little bit wider as the depth of it was fine. The shower on the other hand was a good size, we could both fit in it but the only down-fall was that the head of the shower was very small and even when the knob was turned on full there wasn't much water that came out of it, maybe it's just me but when I have a shower at home its on full and heaps of water comes out. Other than those 2 small faults with the room, I'd stay here again. I've stayed here before once before and really enjoyed myself. It's within the CBD, world square. Plenty of places to party, drink and dine. 24 hour reception with a card swipe for entry at night that makes it a whole lot more safer then some other places. Along with 5 lifts, so you don't have to wait long to get to your room. Parking is $35 a night, but we ended up parking at Harbour-side carpark for $28 for 24hrs. As I personally think $35 a night for parking is quite expensive. I paid in cash when I arrived and left a $200 cash bond. As I didn't have a credit card.

Reviews.Title: “great all round”
Reviews.Author: bettyluvstravel
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 bedroom apartment for 1 night, check in efficient and friendly. We recieved an upgrade to the penthouse which was fabulous on the 56th floor spaning over 2 floors, very very happy and surprised as the hotel appeared quite busy. Although the manual for the appliances werent easy to find, they were found in the compendium, an unusual spot. The location was fantastic with chinatown and paddys markets 5-10 mins walk away. Monorail station across the road at meriton kent street's associate property 'world tower' allowing for easy access to darling harbour which was around 10mins walk to the cockle bay side of darling harbour. We would definately stay again, and having stayed at nearly every type of 3 bedroom apartment in the city, would highly recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit but not as good”
Reviews.Author: pinewoods
Reviews.Content: The apartments are in a good location and are ok if you can get a good rate but they are not worth the $400+ rate that is being asked. The 2 bedrooms are comfortable but the lounge furnishings are nothing special. Also the lounge areas of the corner apartments are much smaller but you do get a view. I will contradict myself in saying that because of the location I would stay again but only if we could get a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING-WILL STAY AGAIN :)”
Reviews.Author: Greeby
Reviews.Content: In Early December I took my 15 year old daughter to Sydney for 5 days and we were a bit concerned about our accommodation. The taxi pulled up outside the enterance and it was beautiful. A lovely marble enterance and friendly staff awaited us. Then the lady at the front desk gave us a free upgrade upon request to a room with a view of Darling Harbour on the 46th Floor! We had a King Studio room and it was amazing. VERY clean, spacious, and very modern. Every night we enjoyed looking out onto the harbour and city. The Hotel is very close to restaraunts and only a 10 minute walk to the city centre and Westfield, and a two minute walk to the monerail. On the last night they even had fire works on the harbour that we were able to watch from our room! The best Hotel experience I ahve had, will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “TOO EXPENSIVE AND GETTING TIRED !!!”
Reviews.Author: Exactlyhowitwas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton on Kent in February 2009 and my review of that stay was based on the fact that we paid $150 which at the time was less than Â£70 per night. I am the first to admit that we touched lucky and got a very good rate. I would have been equally satisfied if we had paid $300 a night for the two bedroom apartment. This time in February 2011 we didn't get so lucky! Firstly we got an awful exchange rate due to the weak pound. Secondly due to Sydney's understandable popularity everywhere has put their prices up considerably. The same two bedroom apartment cost over $450 which equated to Â£300 per night. There were only three of us so Â£100 per night for an apartment that whilst only a few years old is already starting to date and look tired. The furnishings are of very low end quality and their condition leaves a lot to be desired. These comments are based on the properties five star status and the very high prices that they command. The apartments are reasonably comfortable with an efficient AC system and a well equipped kitchen but they really aren't anything special and I certainly wouldn't stay their again unless we managed to get a much better rate. Meriton's pricing policy is a bit of a lottery and you have to be prepared to cancel and rebook several times to get a decent rate. They will try and charge $800 per night for a two bedroom apartment which is well over Â£500 if they can get away with it. For Travel Lodge/Premier Inn style of furnishings and comfort that is a very high price. Staff are ok. The swimming pool and leisure facilities are reasonable. The location is good. High floor views are amazing. Daily servicing of the apartments is of a high standard. Only stay if you can get a very good rate and don't expect five star quality or service because it isn't but that is just my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless in all respects”
Reviews.Author: Gnome G
Reviews.Content: The apartments are really well appointed, spotless and new - well located in on the edge of chinatown, easy parking if arranged through the front desk... I accidentally left a valuable gadget in the apartment when checking out, and the merit on staff quickly located the item and forwarded it to me back home by mail immediately - great service and honesty!

Reviews.Title: “Always happy”
Reviews.Author: smithbeachhouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton on kent Street for two nights to attend an expo at Darling harbour, It is always clean, the beds are comfortable and the staff are very friendly. It is a short walk to the exhibition buildings and nice and close to Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Great stop off”
Reviews.Author: Nataliedavis6
Reviews.Content: A little slow at the front counter with the availablity of rooms at check in time. Had to wait even though it was afer 2pm and after our estimated time of arrival. Room was clean and tidy, quiet location. We had a sky villa, worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Overated and overpriced with poor service”
Reviews.Author: nicnic024
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Meriton on Kent for six nights after booking several months in advance. It is clear that this is barely four star accommodation. The cleanliness needed to be brought up to standard and the kitchen (ie replacing broken items and fixing broken dishwasher after being informed in within five days). Fortunately I only had to deal with the staff on three out of the six days as they were the worst and most disinterested people I have ever stayed with (though the cleaning staff were very pleasant). After taking my money I was informed I was to be placed in a disability room as there were no others left and as it was late at night and a weekend it was not worth walking out just then. Despite assuring me I would be moved the following day I had to have strong words with the staff to be moved to a normal room (despite several being available). If you want five star go somewhere else, if it is a cheap deal and there are no cheap 4 star elsewhere then it is ok and avoid dealing with the reception staff as much as possible.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay when in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Maree19
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at The Meriton and would highly recommend to anyone-very clean -close to the city-excellent service. I wished we could have stayed longer, will definitely stay again......

Reviews.Title: “Very comfertable in the shopping district”
Reviews.Author: NickE2
Reviews.Content: Located just a little outside the tourist attractions, but in the middle of the shopping center. The apartments have a luxurious feel. They are high above street level and therefore very quiet. However, keep in mind that a 100 $ deposit is required.

Reviews.Title: “Best Apartment Hotel I've visited...lives up to its reviews”
Reviews.Author: totarapom
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I spent 4 nights at the Meriton Kent Street Apartments in a 2 bedroomed skyview apartment (5307) on floor 53. WOW...what a great apartment. Wonderful balcony to sit out and have meals while overlooking the city, very spacious, great beds and excellent seperate bathrooms for each room..one ensuite. kitchen well equiped and good sized. the location is ideal for business and leisure. We were attending a conference and the local enabled us to make the most of our free time because it is so central to Darling Harbour, close to trains, and because Sydney CBD is so walkable, you can shop, see the sights and then return to a fabulous well airconditioned apartment to relax and plan your next adventure. I have stayed in apartments around Australia and think this one was the best so far...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing second stay”
Reviews.Author: jakbird
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Meriton in Kent Street when it first opened, I was somewhat disappointed when my husband and I stayed for a second time this week: firstly, on arrival, we were informed that we were going to be upgraded from a one-bedroom to a two-bedroom apartment... seemingly good news, until we were then told that the second bedroom and bathroom in the apartment would be locked. (So, in actual fact, we weren't being upgraded at all, merely bumped to another apartment, likely so that the one-bedroom apartment we'd booked could be given to someone else!) Secondly, when we got to our apartment, we found that the couch was stained and torn and that no extra blankets or pillows had been provided, (as, I've found, is standard practice in Australian hotel rooms). Presumably, this was intended to prevent us from sneaking a third person into our apartment to sleep on the couch... surely no way to treat paying adult guests! While all of the points I've mentioned may seem minor, when you're anticipating 5-star service, you don't expect to be treated like a second-class guest, which is how I felt on my stay at hte Meriton!

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartments in a Awesome Location.”
Reviews.Author: dimsum8six
Reviews.Content: Booked a studio apartment for my girlfriends birthday. Pros: - Big, clean rooms - Good amenities - Good service - Great location (near the main strip of George St, World Square, Darling Harbour) Cons: - Check out is a bit slow around 10am - No free WiFi

Reviews.Title: “Everything was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: keds55
Reviews.Content: The Meriton Apts. Kent St. Sydney were much nicer than I expected. The apts. are very roomy and extremely clean. The service was excellent, the price was very reasonable. We had plenty of room for our family of 5, including 3 teens. We were in walking distance to great shopping on George St, the monorail and Circular Quay to see the Opera House and to catch a ferry to Manly (highly recommend). We also walked to Darling Harbor and Chinatown. Would highly recommend Meriton properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great views - variable price structure for rooms”
Reviews.Author: youngandfiftyish
Reviews.Content: Very spacious 1 bed apartment with great views over Darling harbour. Well equiped and comfortable and 5 mins walk to Darling harbour. Close to Museum and town Hall stations as well as the monorail. Many oriental eateries on the doorstep but probably Darling harbour for any variation. Pricing structure on this and other Meritons vary considerably so if you are flexible you could get a good bargain. Front desk sometimes chaotic and not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious apartment with amazing view!!”
Reviews.Author: breazey
Reviews.Content: I've traveled a lot around the world on a budget, and this has to be one of the most luxurious places I've stayed in at an affordable price!! ($150/night for a 2 bedroom apartment.) The apartment we stayed in was on the 37th floor, had two bedrooms (one with a king bed, one with two single beds), kitchen, living room, washer & dryer, and very nice bathrooms. There was also a balcony that had an amazing view of the city!! We were also happy that there was a fitness center and pool---included in the price!! We got a little workout in, that was really nice! Everything was VERY clean, new, and beautiful! It was extremely convenient to have a whole kitchen, cooking utensils, refrigerator, and dish washer, as we saved a lot of money by cooking/making our own meals! It was also very convenient to be able to wash our clothes, as we had been traveling for a long time and needed to do some laundry! We were very pleased with our 3 night stay, and it was a decent walking distance from shops, bars, and restaurants. . . although it was quite a far walk down to the opera house, bridge, etc. One downside was that parking was REALLY EXPENSIVE!!! Don't bring a car if you can help it. Oh yea, and wireless internet was really expesive too!!--$18 for 24 hours!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: angloT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights in early December in a 1 bedroom apartment with balcony on the 50th floor. As it's an apartment hotel, a kitchen and washing machine/dryer were included, very useful if you're there for a while. It worked well for us as we didn't want to have to eat out all the time, especially if we'd been out all day (and Sydney is expensive). The hotel is used by a lot of business people as well as tourists. It's only a few years old, and it's in very good condition. Room was an excellent size, good bathroom, comfortable bed, great closet space, very clean, and a great view over Darling Harbour. Practical, modern furniture. Check-in was very efficient, house keeping service was excellent and very accommodating. As we were there for 9 nights we were on the 'light refresh each day' plan which meant that beds were made each day, towels were replaced if requested, and laundry detergent, dish washing powder etc was restocked. A full clean, with fresh sheets etc was made after about a week. We broke a couple of glasses but there was no fuss about replacing them, and there was no charge. Some people have complained about noise - yes, there are the usual sounds, but let's face it, you're right in the middle of an incredibly busy city, and you're in a prime location. If you close the windows it's not bad at all - we had no problem sleeping - it might have been worse lower down than we were, but higher floors attract noise too. The hotel couldn't be in a better place for sightseeing, walking or taking the bus to the harbour or the beaches. It's very close to Coles, a major supermarket chain, where you can stock up with groceries for the apartment. Again, a word of warning - compared to the US, Sydney is expensive, even in supermarkets! When we come back to the city, we'd definitely stay here again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartments but poorest service in Oz?”
Reviews.Author: Brist0lians
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton Kent St at the end of our trip to Oz. Up till then, it seemed that everybody we met in Australia seemed pleased to see us. That came to an end at the Meriton. The apartment was fine, but it soon emerged that the air conditioning was faulty. I cannot recall how many times it failed during the first two nights, but we were basically without sleep both nights. We were moved to another apartment, without apology (or assistance), but with the duty manager's comment that he would waive the normal charge for moving rooms! As I recall his name was Lief. He was the most unpleasant and uncaring person we met in Oz by a mile. The other staff were clearly embarrassed by his attitude. Our stay at the Meriton marred our memories of Sydney and we would certainly not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: greatimes4ever
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton Kent Street for 2 nights on the weekend just gone. When we arrived at the hotel to checkin the reception area was packed with other people also trying to checkin. There were 4 very busy staff checking people in but in no time it was our turn. We were greated warmly with a smile and the process was completed swiftly. Our 2 bedroom apartment, like all Meriton's, was lovely, very clean, quite spacious. We had a balcony overlooking George Street which was a little noisy but quite bearable. The location is fantastic, just a 7 minute walk down to the Entertainment Centre, a few minutes walk to Town Hall for the trains and QVB for the buses.

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment”
Reviews.Author: keju
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Meriton on Kent for 5 nights and it was a really great apartment, very spacious, and everything we needed in the kitchen and also a laundry with washer/dryer...it was just great. We had a Studio with sky view 41st floor and the view was spectacular overlooking Darling Harbour.... The Monorail was just a block away and that takes you to Darling Harbour and the City Centre.... very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: david7745
Reviews.Content: Booked a Sky View Studio Appt on their web site for $170 a night and was given an Appt on the 53rd floor. I didn't expect a separate bedroom but that is what I got, and was pleasantly surprised. The views are stunning and the enclosed balcony makes one who suffers from a bit of vertigo feel quite at ease and able to enjoy the views. The bathroom, thought small, is adequate, modern and very clean. The kitchenette has everything you would need to cook and dine with, micro/convection oven, hotplates, fridge, dishwasher and a combination washing machine/dryer, also, the iron was new and clean as well as the ironing board cover. There is heaps of wardrobe space with ceiling to floor mirrored doors and a safe behind them and block out drapes for a good nights sleep on the comfy King size bed. The air-conditioning worked very well, with two units with separate controls for the living and sleeping areas. The 15th floor has a large indoor pool, spa and gym. I will definitely book here again when I come down to Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Just as good the second time around”
Reviews.Author: Nat1977
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Sydney and our second stay at the Meriton on Kent Street. For us, these apartments can't be faulted. Great location just off George Street with everything you could want on your doorstep. (Supermarkets, bottle shops, take aways, coffee shops, public transport, Darling Harbour etc.) Circular Quay is either a short ferry ride away or you can catch the free cat bus from George Street every 10 minutes. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment each time. The first time, the apartment was huge with two balconies and massive kitchen. This time, slightly smaller and with only one balcony, but still plenty of space. The beds are really comfortable (although after travelling for 28 hours from the UK I could have slept on a clothes line) and the pillows are wonderful. (And I'm fussy about pillows.) The aparments have everything you need including a washing machine, dryer, iron and ironing board, oven, hob, microwave, dishwasher and flatscreen TV with Foxtel. There's also plenty of wardrobe space and a safe as well. Everything is immaculately clean and the apartments are serviced daily with the dishwasher powder and laundry detergent replaced. They're also really quiet and you rarely hear another guest. A real bonus for those of us with noisy neighbours at home! And I know others have complained about the lifts but, on both of our stays, we never waited for more than a couplen of minutes for a lift and most of the time it was just a few seconds. I can highly recommend the Meriton and we'll definitely stay her again when we visit Sydney in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the money”
Reviews.Author: mkb4758
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Meriton Kent St for one night before a trip to New Zealand so therefore I only had 24 hours to see Sydney. This hotel was a great location from the sights. I was able to walk everywhere I wanted to go which was very nice. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Booked on wotif for $155 AUD. Great deal!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful !”
Reviews.Author: tassickerkerry
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from 3 nights staying at these apartments. I would like to say how much we enjoyed the stay and to commend the staff who were fantastic. On our arrival we were given a free upgrade and allowed to check in early. We loved the room and the view. It was clean and roomy and had everything in it we needed to make it a very comfortable stay. We left Sydney on a cruise and on our return had to fly out on the same day. However my elderly Aunt and Uncle were staying for one more night. My uncle had back pain and staff arranged for him to check in at 930 am which was great. They were also very happy to store our luggage during our 4 hour wait to fly out even though we were not staying there on our return trip. I will definitely be recommending the Kent St Meriton to others and am certainly looking forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Travelot80
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Sydney recently for 5 days with another couple and had a great time. We thoroughly searched for nice and affordable lodging in the city and the Meriton on Kent was a terrific find. We stayed in a two-bedroom, two-bath apartment the first two nights and then moved to studios for the remainder of our stay which cut down on cost. Both rooms were great - the first was on the 40th floor with beautiful views of the city. Both rooms had great amenities including washer and dryer. The Meriton isn't a luxury complex but it's extremely well-appointed and comfortable, the service staff are friendly and accommodating and we had a great experience. The lifts are smooth and fast and unlike some other reviewers, we found the washer/dryer easy to operate. There's a Cole's grocery store in a nearby mall and Pho, Mama's italian restaurant and the Sanctuary Hotel across the street offered great, affordable meals. It's located very conveniently near Chinatown and the Spanish Quarter and just a quick 10-minute walk to everything Darling Harbor has to offer including the 26th Pier where you can catch ferries to The Rocks area and see the Opera House or to the Taronga Zoo. We enjoyed the views from the ferries, a tour on the City Sightseeing bus and a trip to Manly where, when we go again, we'll spend a few more days. The Meriton was a great, convenient spot in Sydney and we'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home with great city and harbour views”
Reviews.Author: CanberraTourist
Reviews.Content: My partner and I (plus our car) stay at Meriton Kent Street for 2 nights and it was a wonderful experience. 1. Location. It is right in the middle of the CBD. It's only short stroll to China Town, George Street Cinemas, Darling Harbour, Hyde Park, Town Hall, Pitt Street Mall and only 15 min walk to Circular Quay 2. The room. We had a 1 bedrrom apartment with magnificant city view. You can also see ANZAC bridge, Darling Harbour and a little bit of Harbour Bridge. It is a spacious 1 bedroom apartment with full kitchen facility, LCD, DVD, Washing Machine and dryer. It's clean, it's spacious and it's comfortable. 3. Service. Friendly and efficient staff. 4. Parking. Our car sleeps at the secure basement for $30 per night, which is reasonable for Sydney CBD standard (in fact most hotels in the city charge $35-$55 per night). 5. There is a nice lap pool and a gym. This is probably the our best stay in Sydney. We don't need any room service and valet parking. It feels like living at home (or even better than home because of the view and location).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: judithaj
Reviews.Content: Excellent accommodation. Very light. Dishwashing and washing machine liquid available. Staff very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: snluker
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for a couple of nights in the Meriton apartments. We had a split level 3 bedroom apartment, and it took our breath away when we walked in. It was amazing value and absolutely gorgeous. There was loads of space and we had a 50" television! All the bedrooms were really nice and we had several balconies (on 56/57th floor - was a little scary). We were in walking distance of shopping and not too far from Sydney harbour - though Darling harbour was closer. The train station was really close so we used that several times. I really enjoyed my stay and would recommend it to other people going to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the Meriton on Kent St”
Reviews.Author: arose4lee
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Meriton serviced apartments on Kent St because I wanted to experience a serviced apartment and had read good things about this place. Overall, I'm very pleased. The price was reasonable. We chose a 1 bedroom apartment and not the studio apartment as the cost difference was minimal. The 1 bedroom apartment was well worth it. It was very clean and spacious. It was great to be able to get up and make toast and coffee and feel at home. Location was fantastic. Very close to Haymarket, Chinatown, Pitt St Mall, the QV Building and Darling Harbour. The staff was great. We reported that we couldnt locate the remote control for the airconditioning unit and they came with a replacement. They were friendly and prompt. Are there downsides? Not really. Our room had one of those old CRT TVs and on our last day there, they came and replaced it with a new Samsung LCD TV! If only they'd replaced it before we got there so we could enjoy it or after we left so we didnt know any different. But, oh well! Also the water in the pool was a bit too cold for my liking. The hot tub was nice though! I am glad we stayed here and we will def be staying either at this one or the other Meriton places when we are in Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartment, good location, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Ozerider
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton Kent Street apartments for 3 nights and found it to be a good experience all round. We were high up, 51st floor, so no noise issues at all. Comfortable bed, proper blinds as well as curtains so not too light at night for sleeping. The studio apartment was clean and spacious and this one had good views over Cockle Bay. Staff were pleasant and helpful. One tip, they do a flat taxi rate to the airport of $40 which we found out after we had shelled out $30 for the two of us for the train, which is not even a dedicated airport train, you have to take your chances with peak hour crowds etc. A complete rip-off. I will do the cab next time. We will definately stay there next Sydney trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and convenient for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: Shellbelle_75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week at the end of September on a vacation to see the sights of Sydney. We were very pleased with our 16th floor studio apartment. It was modern, clean, very quiet, and had all of the amenities we were promised and looking for (fully equipped kitchenette, clothes washer, updated furniture/bathroom, reasonable proximity to attractions/transportation/restaurants.) We never had any problems with staff or elevator waits. I preferred the serviced apartment set-up because the front desk doesn't monitor the ins and outs (I don't like to feel like I have to be social each time I come in and out of a hotel) but the front door is locked after dark and guests are given a key so it's relatively secure. They do arrange airport shuttles if requested for $14 AUD. We had our own thermostat for A/C and heat which worked well and windows that opened. The bed was comfy and the facilities very clean. I would certainly stay there again, as well as recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: gillynet1
Reviews.Content: There were five of us staying in a three bedroom apartment on the 56th floor of this hotel. By British standards, the apartment was absolutely fabulous and it worked out around Â£60 per head, which is fantastic value. Also we did not have to pay the bill upfront when booking, which we had to for a cheap rate on our Brisbane hotel. The hotel is about ten minutes walk from the nearest train station (two stops from Sydney harbour). You could also walk to the harbour in around half an hour. There are lots of restarants nearby and a reasonably priced room service, although the breakfast we ordered wasn't anything special. We found the staff to be perfectly friendly and helpful. There were several balconies in the apartment, including to the bedrooms, the latter of which I would have preferred to be less easy to unlock, as my daughter is prone to sleep walking! All in all, I would defintely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Penthouse Suite: Party like its 1999”
Reviews.Author: Genghis_Kwan
Reviews.Content: Going downstairs for a kebab I shared the elevator with a male erotic dancer from a Henâ€™s party, a female erotic dancer from a 21st party & an inebriated man in a womanâ€™s dress from where I donâ€™t know. Its not that Iâ€™m innocent myself of any unusual behaviour that night but this seems a good summary of the general happenings of the 56th Penthouse Floor. The Meriton Apartments on Kent Street is centrally located & is actually a skyscraper building. It is by no means an up market establishment as serviced apartments go, it meets all of the criteria & is comfortable enough for a big night out with your best mates, at $800 a night they would have to be pretty good friends. Weeknights prices drop to $500 as these rooms are mostly used for parties. Our 3 Bedroom Apartment Penthouse Suite was located on the 56th floor with views perfect for spit balling & water bombs, no-one can touch you! If you have been in an aircraft preparing to land at Sydney airport that is the sort of height we had, I could easily make out the Blue Mountains & the setting sun to the west. The apartment layout was divided into 3 levels with entertainment space on the first & third floors & the main bedrooms on the 2nd. The fully furnished apartment lacks the sort of boutique furniture which creates atmosphere & vibe so you will have to bring the party yourself. The apartment is carpeted so spillage will be a problem for spewers & wine spillers alike Another memorable feature of the master bedroom with ensuite was the ceiling mirrors fitted directly on top of the bed. This I would imagine would be quite a raunchy experience for those inclined, foolishly I got drunk & passed out on the couch. The room policy strictly stated no parties but we spoke to a few people who confirmed they were throwing celebrations themselves. Security eventually evicted 3 of these groups for noise complaints, one being the group of drunk women fighting in the hallway. The apartments are very much configured for parties especially the third level with the large balcony, mini kitchen/bar area & sweeping views of Sydney. Security doesnâ€™t screen people in the lobby so party goers would be ok to go up as long as groups of people donâ€™t arrive at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Good apartment choice”
Reviews.Author: CherryPuppy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week and had the 1 bedroom unit. Nicely laid out apartment with all necessary amenities including washing machine and dryer, and a kitchen. The apartment was well-maintained, though the sofas could do with a clean. Bedding was comfortable. I was on one of the higher floors, and the property has quite a few floors so getting an elevator usually means a queue - it could do with more elevators. The reception staff were courteous. There is no restaurant on-site, but since you are in the middle of Sydney a few minutes walk in any direction gives you a plethora of options. Or you can cook in your apartment. The location is quite convenient - 10 minutes walk to most places (Town Hall, Darling Harbour, Pitt St Mall). A Coles supermarket and liquor store can be found across the road at World Square, and Woolworths supermarket is up the road. The Rocks area is a brisk 20 minute walk, or a leisurely 25-30 minutes. Overall a good option if you are spending more than a few days in Sydney and want the conveniences that come with an apartment, or traveling with family.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value”
Reviews.Author: Memfan
Reviews.Content: This was perfect for a longer trip with an old buddy. We each had our own bedroom and bathroom (Mine ensuite). There was a full size kitchen and a large living and dining area. The kitchen contained a full size fridge, microwave, oven, range, and dishwasher, and call fully stocked with pots, pans, dishes, and utensils. This place was truly spacious, even by my "I like it Texas sized" American standards. This was an absolutely bargain! The washer and dryer (in a small separate washroom) was a huge plus! The furniture reminded me of college dorm room quality, but it really didn't matter. The maids came by daily as they would in a hotel, and everything else was hotel like. You'll hear complaints about the staff being snooty, and it's true. However, they respond to service request, and will provide useful information when asked. So who gives a flip if they aren't friendly? 1) You're not going to spend that much time interacting with them anyways. 2) The room size is awesome, and more than compensates for the staff's attitude. The Meriton World Tower is slightly more conveniently located, but you can't go wrong with any of the Meritons. We were blocks away from a large mall with a large supermarket inside of it. We were blocks away from the harbor and all sorts of dining. And if you're worried about fast food you recognize, Aussie's eat more fast food than anyone I've ever seen, so don't worry. You'll have your choice between McDonalds, Burger King (a close impersonator anyways), Denny's, KFC, Krispy Kreme, Pizza Hut, White Castle, etc. And, that's just on one block near the Meriton! Tip: If you stay here, there's a large just below ground souvenir shop (Sydney Souvenir Warehouse) just around the corner on Liverpool. This is the cheapest place in the Sydney area to buy your souvenirs. Go there on day 1 and at least see the pricing and selection so you're not tempted by the tourist traps. If you want to be in the heart of the nightlife, then you will want to stay in King's Cross. The Holiday Inn is your best bet there. You will hear people whine about how seedy and dangerous King's Cross is, but these are fuddy duddy grandparent types. Yes, it is the location of the red light district, but a fair comparison is that it's about as dangerous as New York's Time Square at night. Like Times Square, it's crowded and has a high police presence, so don't be a stupid fuddy duddy grandparent type (the type that pulls out their wallet in the middle of the street and counts their money aloud in loud Hicksville accents), and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed suites, great location, really fast lifts, amazing views from 55th floor.”
Reviews.Author: Robynk9
Reviews.Content: This apartment block is right in the middle of the city, only a couple of minutes from Darling Harbor,chinatown and the entire city is at your doorstep. We were lucky enough to get a studio room on the 55th floor, not for the faint hearted but the views were amazing. (make sure you pay a little extra and ask for a sky view room, worth every cent) The room was well appointed with a dishwasher, washing machine/dryer in the room, the bed was king size and very comfy. Very spacious apartment, comfy lounge, LCD tv, foxtel, it really is a good spot to stay, will definetly stay there again. The only negative was that the fridge was so noisy we had to turn it off to sleep at night, but on the whole i would highly recommend this as a great place to stay and the best rate was on their own site on the net, just look up Meriton Sydney, there is four all up in the city but this was the one of our choice because of where it is.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Cosmeston_13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in August - self, wife and two teenage daughters. Very clean, serviced daily, good sized kitchen, wash machine, tumble dryer. Nice pool and small gym. Wide range of TV channels. Good base for exploring Sydney. 20 minutes from circular quay, 5 minutes to nearest metro station. Recommend wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Cant ask for much more”
Reviews.Author: petroinsyd
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at a Meriton before and again they have met that high standard. Quality modern clean rooms. They always seem to be so much roomier than any other hotels I stay at. The view is awesome, the amenities are great and I look forward to staying here again. Easy recommendation as long as you can find a value price

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and clean”
Reviews.Author: Yorkie_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We did lots of research before deciding on here. There are a few other Meriton properties nearby, but this was the cheapest and got good reviews at the time of booking. We booked a studio for our week in Sydney as it seemed to have everything we needed. Upon arriving in Sydney we used the airport train to get to Museum station then about 5-10mins walk, Town Hall station is a little nearer but further on the train, next time I would get off at Town Hall though as itâ€™s nearer and easier.
