The train was efficient and didnâ€™t take long to get to the city. Check-in was easy and reception staff were friendly, no problems here. The room was big with plenty of hanging space for clothes, if a little short on hangers. The room had a washer/drier, safe, Smeg dishwasher and Smeg oven, kettle, pots and pans etc, pretty much everything you need for a short break. We couldnâ€™t find any instructions for the washer, but was fairly easy to work out. There were a few sachets of detergent to use too. The bathroom was clean, with a decent shower over the bath, towels were also clean and toiletries OK. The room was big enough with a large LCD TV and a table with a couple of chairs. The location was pretty good, close to Darling Harbour and walkable down to Circular Quay and the Rocks, there were always plenty of taxis about if you needed one. The train stations were nearby too, so you could use them to get to Bondi easily for example. It is more or less in the Chinatown area, so most of the shops and restaurants are geared that way. In summary, we were happy with our choice, but if returning, we would choose to stop somewhere else, probably nearer The Rocks / Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “I could not find fault with this accommadation”
Reviews.Author: SilverPerth
Reviews.Content: The Meriton on Kent Street was an excellent central location near many attractions ( Darling Harbour, China town) . The 2 bedroom appartment was clean comfortable quiet and spacious, the safe enclosed balcony was great and we could open windows for fresh air. We were on the 52nd floor which had a good view. We were close to many restaurants cafes and very close to Coles for food shopping. There was easy access to buses trains, and monorail. The indoor pool spa and sauna was very nice though the pool was a bit cold for winter and there wasn't anywhere suitable to sit to watch the kids when they were in the pool. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic haven right in the centre of sydney”
Reviews.Author: holidaydreamer066
Reviews.Content: I arrived in sydney with three teenagers [one from france] to show them this beautiful city. We were thrilled to find the hotel so close to town hall station and many of sydney's attractions. We were even more thrilled to find the apartment so well equipped and spacious and with a full kitchen that enabled us to prepare good meals using product from the two supermarkets close by. This allowed us to spend our $$$$'s on other things. On the nights we did want to at out meriton is well placed to access a huge range of eateries. The kids really loved being able to chill out after a hard days sightseeing by having a swim in the pool and a dip in the spa- again a real treat in the heart of the city. We found the staff at Meriton to be at all times helpful and courteous. For one night we had the great joy of being in the penthouse and this will remain a WOW experience ever etched in our minds! After this nobody wanted to leave our amazingly luxerious apartment and we did all our sightseeing from the incredible 56th floor. My thanks to all at Meriton for giving us all a wonderful Sydney experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for last minute bookings”
Reviews.Author: mg35
Reviews.Content: I love this place - it is very new , modern , and clean. I'm already planning on staying there again this weekend, and no I do not work for them but I have stayed in at least 20 different hotels in the Sydney area and this one is by far the best I've experienced. Sometimes they drop their rates significantly at the last minute so if you're flexible it can be an extremely great value. I think anyone who is disappointed either paid too much or did not do their homework. The name clearly states it is Serviced Apartments, not a full service hotel, meaning the staff are there more or less to book you into your room, not to cater to your every need. Also a quick glance at a picture of the building clearly shows it is a tall building in the CBD surrounded by other tall buildings, so guess what, your room might face other tall buildings....surprise!! If you are expecting a view, you have to book a room that specifies it has a view, or else there is no guarantee. That's how hotels work. Also, the first 10 floors of the place are offices, so there is no way that one could be very close to the street. If you can't handle street noise, then you should not ask to be on a lower floor. There are like 55 floors to this place and the lifts are extremely fast. The city is really not very noisy at night anyway, and I am a rather noise sensitive person. I had no problem operating the washer and dryer, in fact for the rate I paid (less than $100) I was quite thankful to have these amenities. It is not cheap at all to get laundry done in Sydney so I probably saved $20 right there. And yes heavy electric appliances do typically make noise, that's how they work. I do agree that the dryer was a bit slow, but it didn't bother me, and again I am very noise sensitive. Also it's a great location, tons of inexpensive Asian food and more to be had right outside the front door of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Booked months ago Never stay again. Great view of old buildings at back”
Reviews.Author: marshall98
Reviews.Content: Apartment booked several months before, requested not above 19th floor. Did not expect back apartment with no view at all. Meriton on list for Lions International Convention. I expected better treatment. Reception staff not helpful, Lounge seating very poor as it was a fold out bed. Noise from across the road meant poor sleeping. Considering the status of the Convention and the time booked definatley not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Tengak
Reviews.Content: The check-in experience was less than pleasant as we had pre-booked month's ago at a discounted rate but then told that the current rate is higher. We had to go & dig through our luggage to find the confirmation letter stating the lower rate before we could register. Then the car parking ticket issued to us had not been validated and had problems exiting the underground car park when we first used the ticket. However from the feedback we provided after our stay, we were contacted by their Management to assure us the issues will be addressed and we received a bit of a refund as a goodwill gesture. This was certainly appreciated indicating they take seriously customer concerns and act responsively. Other than that our stay was very enjoyable being so central to everything of interests in Sydney. One cannot ask for a better location in the CBD, easy walking distance to Darling Harbour, the Town Hall train station, shops, bars, restaurants, cinemas and just next to Chinatown and the Spanish quarters. The apartment had a covered balcony with good views. The rooms and bathrooms were bigger than most hotels. The kitchen was fitted well and the dining/lounge area comfortable. There was daily service to the apartment as well.

Reviews.Title: “spaceious, modernish”
Reviews.Author: SugSydney
Reviews.Content: nice big apartment, old CRT TV, stayed on election night (Saturday) allot of action from the balcony facing towards George Street at night, police, nightlife etc... which made sleeping a bit difficult for us. nice generous kitchen with modern appliances inc a oven, couldn't get the aircond quite right. pretty close to the CBD, room was quite high above the street not much of a view of the sydney harbour or Darling harbour

Reviews.Title: “not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: johnroberts1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights, rooms were great, we could access balcony, great views. Forget trying to use the washing machine/dryer, if you can work out how to use it, good luck. It is so loud, one cannot enjoy the tv due to the very annoying sound the machine makes, let alone getting the machine to simply dry one's clothing, the instructions are wrong and it will take hours to wash and dry your clothes if you are lucky. Rooms could do with a spring clean. Reception staff could do with some customer relation training, it is simply rude to ignore a guest when they are at the front counter. I do not know how they earnt a 5 star rating

Reviews.Title: “Go to World Tower - It's across the road.”
Reviews.Author: SydCityBoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a two bedroom apartment with friends for a function in the City. We've stayed in Meriton World Tower before, but decided to try the Kent Street property because we could see it had balconies, and was a bit cheaper. Upon arrival, the desk staff were less than nice, and a bit slow, but Meriton properties are Serviced Apartments, not hotels. You don't go to the butcher to buy milk. You get apartments for space, not necessarily service. The room was fantastic, large and modern. We motioned towards the balcony, and tried to open the door, then flicked the lock, and tried again. No luck. I rang the desk and said there was a problem with our door, to which I got a snappy reply "They're locked shut due to complaints. There is no way to open them." It sounded like he'd answered that question a few thousand times that day. I found it hard to believe, as there was a full outdoor dining set out there. No budging - our sole reason for choosing this property was taken away. ***Note: If you're going to stay here because of the balcony, check ahead - it really dampened our stay that we couldn't use it.*** It just got worse from there for me. In my bathroom, one of the soaps had been opened - not replaced. I then questioned the cleanliness of the rest of the apartment. If you want an apartment in Sydney, there are only two choices. Meriton World Tower and Quay West Suites. Forget Kent Street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location Great Apartment”
Reviews.Author: limerickros
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in the Meriton during February at the start of our trip to Australia. It was almost 10 pm when we checked in, very efficient check in. We booked a studio apartment and it was spacious, comfortable and it contained everything you would need, washer, drier, fridge, cooker etc. The view to Darling Harbour was excellent. Despite what some posters had said about the lifts we never waited more than one minute for a lift. There was no traffic noise. The proximity to Darling Harbour and George Street excellent. Overall you might get cheaper apartments in Sydney but the Meriton is well worth the price you pay

Reviews.Title: “So convenient. Stay there if you can.”
Reviews.Author: ThelameAustralia
Reviews.Content: I researched hotels/apartments for a month before I chose Meriton Kent Street apartments in Sydney. I made the right choice. Just catch a free green bus which takes you down George Street (with convenient stops) to Circular Quay, and then back up Pitt Street to Liverpool Street. If you get off at Circular Quay, which you should, take a lazy ferry trip to Manly and when you get back to Circular Quay check out the Rocks. Take a look around QVB just to see the magnificent interior. The shops were a bit pricey for me. The apartment itself, a studio apartment on the 39th Floor, had everything I needed plus. Spotless and no noise at all. You will like how the big flat screen TV swivels so you can watch it from dining table, your lounge chair, or your bed. You will also enjoy a Darling Harbour view, which at night is lovely. My tip - avoid the Darling Harbour restaurants unless you are cashed up. Smiling service at checkin and checkout. A hint: Check out at about 9,.45am and miss the crowds who all check out at 10am. Chinatown is close and the food in the area, predominantly Asian is reasonable and plentiful. I wish I had been able to stay a month at Meriton Kent Street apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located, helpful staff,well appointed self catering hotel”
Reviews.Author: BudgieFreo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in one bedroom apartment, spacious living area with small balcony, washing machine and dryer, microwave, toaster, big fridge. Nice clean bathroom, but no shelf/bench top for storing toiletries. Staff were helpful, though we paid for late check out, cleaners kept trying to clean the room at the earlier time. Located in Spanish quarter, walking distance to everything, loved the location. Would stay here again depending on the price.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous roomy apartment right in the centre of Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: aaceYork
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent choice as we had lots of room in our studio apartment. It was very well equipped for anyone who wanted to cook a meal and it was a nice touch that they provided dishwasher tablets and sachets of laundry liquid so we were able to do some washing. There are plenty of late convenience stores nearby so we were able to buy our breakfast as we returned back at night. There was a little noise from the street below but what can you expect from such a central city location? It is a bit of a walk to Circular Quay but very close to Darling Harbour and shopping areas. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good serviced apartment in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: ben_steph
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed there only one night last year to avoid driving back to the Western suburbs after a night out. The location is ideal, right in the city centre. The apartment was really spacious (1 separate bedroom) and clean! We definitely thought that it could be ideal to stay in Sydney for a longer period as the flat comes with a fully equipped kitchen, washing machine and dryer. This accommodation comes also cheaper than hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough but didn't work for me”
Reviews.Author: drmgeorge
Reviews.Content: So I picked this place based on the reviews I read here on TA. It sounded as if people had only good things to say about it. That would probably be true for me too, except for very specific problems I had. The studio rooms I was in were both nicely appointed and very clean. The bathrooms were gorgeous. My problem was with the "conveniences" in the apartment. Let me explain. First, when I checked in I was assigned to a lower floor (18th floor--but don't be deceived. The above ground floors begin on Floor 10). I was really hoping for a water view room, as water is really what Sydney is all about. I was told I could move to a higher floor with a water view, but would be charged a $40 moving fee. Huh? I did the moving, and it was extremely inconvenient as I had to stand in a long line to check out of my 18th floor room. Stand in a long line to store my bags for the day. Stand in a long line to check back in for my 36th floor room. When I got to that room it was lovely, but much smaller than my first room and had a view of about 1/4 inch of water (which the houseman and I found after 5 minutes of searching). Why was a houseman in my room, you might ask. Well, the main reason I chose this hotel was that I am traveling around Australia and am traveling lightly. Therefore, I need a washer/dryer and a kitchenette. The house man was in my room because the washer/dryer was actually just a washer and he was trying to fix it for me. After washing my clothes for a second three hour cycle (no exaggeration) with no rying, he came back to take the clothes to the hotel laundry to dry. They came back still damp, balled up in a bag, and smelling a little stale as they had clearly sat wet in the laundry for several hours. Also, the microwave burned everything. There were no directions for the w/d nor microwave and neither were like any appliance I have used in multiple other places in Australia. Needless to say, this whole thing frustrated me greatly. The hotel did return the $40 moving fee because of my bad experience. As for location, the place is perfect if you want to be near Darling Harbor or Hyde Park. It is actually not too bad a walk to the Botanic Garden, Opera House (1/2 hour) or Oxford Street (20 minutes). In other words, it was central, but not really next to anything but China Town. So I guess I would recommend these serviced apartments for people who do not need convenience or appliances. It really is a lovely place and the staff is fine, it was just not what I needed whilst in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in center of downtown.”
Reviews.Author: worldtravel2010
Reviews.Content: Good room. Not a lot of hall traffic to wake you up in the middle of the night. Clean. Staff was pleasant. Location was very convenient. Few blocks from Darling Harbour, Chinese town, and lots of shopping on George Street. Take the train from the airport and walk 1.5 blocks. Very happy with the choice, especially because it was so easy to get on a ferry to escape downtown whenever we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: IrelandGill
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Meriton Kent Street on my honeymoon and it was one of the highlights of our trip. I couldn't fault it at all. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise”
Reviews.Author: helsie57
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location in Sydney. Affordable, clean and secure

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: traveltortoise
Reviews.Content: brilliant, can't find one fault. Would recommend 100%

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: loopylou007
Reviews.Content: Stayed just 2 nights at the Meriton over Valentines weekend. Have been to Sydney a few times, and was not disappointed with this hotel. Great location, wide choice of bars and restaurants within close proximity, train station also very easy to get to. We stayed in a studio appt, which was well laid out, thank god for the tumble dryer (it was a very wet weekend!). Check in and out was smooth and quick, never had any problems waiting for the lifts (as mentioned in previous posts). Did not need to use the reception staff any further, but they looked quite helpful with other customers. Only a few negatives - Swimming pool, whilst empty and great for doing laps, it was freezing. Spa, was great though a guest commented that he had to ask for it to be cleaned the day before as it was foamy - apparently they only do it every 10 days! Lastly our television did not work, but had we been bothered to queue up and tell the staff I'm sure they would have fixed it. Overall great stay, would recommend and will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: beaut_stuff
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at last minute (a night before) and managed to get a studio room at a bargain price of $95.00 per night. The service at lobby was fantastic. There was a glitch with our online booking, but it was rectified with patience. The studio room we had was comfortable, modern and large. The bathroom was not "wow" but it was modern and pretty good. Parking (at extra cost) is available right next door. Very convenient. The only improvement I could suggest is for them to install a telephone at the lobby so guest could call you up in your room. It'd have been handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, Great location”
Reviews.Author: BenCharlie
Reviews.Content: This is a great place/location while in Sydney. The place was clean, serviced everyday. We were able to walk everywhere we needed to. The Circular Quay and Darling Harbors were very close. Can't say enough good about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: silton
Reviews.Content: Check in speedy in a one bed apartment, we arrived early and they did there best to accommodate us as soon as possible. Huge apartment well stocked with tea milk etc. Lots of towels. washer, dryer, lots of space and very comfy beds. It was aweekend but although very busy we were never disturbed by noise. Overall very good value for an excellant location in a city like Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, friendly service, very clean, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Polypep
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom apartment for 3 nights in Jan, 2010. Everything was clean and modern, and the room smelt fresh. Friendly helpful staff, excellent indoor pool. Close to supermarkets and transport - we used the monorail heaps, and caught a bus 5 minutes away that took us to the Rocks. Walking distance to Darling Harbour. Lots of restaurants, bar across the road with fantastic cheap food. Taxi rank right outside. Great location and service, will stay there on next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Supersmart apartments”
Reviews.Author: Jacquibabs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice whilst touring Australia for 3 nights and then 1 night. The location is great with plenty of restaurants, shops and transport nearby. 5 mins from Darling harbour and a short bus ride to the Rocks. The apartments are clean, modern, trendy and functional and comfortable...not often you get all of those! The pool area is good and an added attraction in the centre of Sydney. We had no trouble with lifts while we were there. The parking is expensive but we looked elsewhere and it's not a lot cheaper and it was worth it for the convenience. Staff were very helpful and efficient. All in all can't fault it and really enjoyed our stay. Just a good tip too..there's a small shopping centre downstairs and the Chinese restaurant has great food which you can just pop down to order and take back to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury appartments”
Reviews.Author: Alamire
Reviews.Content: The Meriton appartments are serviced, located at the very heart of the city. With gorgeous wiews from its terraces, it has fantastic extra services like the indoor swimming pool. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Studio was fantastic but the lifts are a joke!”
Reviews.Author: Mooeyitfc
Reviews.Content: We booked a studio apartment for 3 nights over New Years Eve. The location is fantastic, being only a short walk away from Darling Harbour and there is loads going on the minute you walk outside the building. The studio was very clean and had everything that we could have wanted. Also very clean. Air conditioning was very welcome as temps did get quite warm. Checkin and check out were swift however the lifts at the Meriton were a joke. 6 lifts serving 55 floors but on 2nd Jan when we checked out we had to wait almost 15 minutes for a lift as there were so many people using them. When you are on the 30th floor, the stairs are not really an option. Coles and Woolworths supermarket within a few minutes walk! Great value apartment in a central location. Cant beat this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: QueenslandMeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Meriton, Kent Street for 3 nights. We requested a high floor and we were pleased we did. The view was great. The room was also well equipped and met our needs. However, that was all we were happy with. As the previous guests had a late check out, we were kept waiting for the room to be cleaned. When we left, we could not get a late check out. Our room was never serviced and had to request this each night and even when it was done, it was appalling. The reception staff ere unfriendly and unhelpful. Very disappointing experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “My friends were amazed!”
Reviews.Author: imabroad
Reviews.Content: I hesitated booking at Meriton Kent because of the broad range of reviews but I decided to go ahead nonetheless. The place won points on all counts for all as it was - clean - spacious - well located - air conditioned in bedrooms and living room - cost effective and also provided access to the balcony. I found the service to be accommodating and professional. The room was on the 7th floor (meaning five floors from road level) and once the balcony door was closed - we could hardly hear a thing. Patrons should be aware of the bond policy. This wasn't a problem for me but I made sure that I (1) audited the rooms for damage when I arrived (2) asked staff to check the state of the rooms before I left. I would fully recommend this accommodation, and in fact my friends were so impressed they made a note of the place to recommend to others. I'm not sure why others had a bad experience but I'll be returning to the Meriton within the year and will post an update on my positive experience. I may have got lucky, and if that's the case then it's a matter of securing your needs (e.g open balcony). But I can certainly tell you that it's not all bad.

Reviews.Title: “Very Upscale for the Money”
Reviews.Author: JordanF
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in a two-bedroom unit. Great spaces, balcony, laundry in the apartment. It was a great base of operations for seeing Sydney. Sure, the Rocks is a better location, but A LOT more expensive. Very modern and nice. We paid $270/nt (Australian), and it seemed like a bargain! Five minutes from Chinatown, 25 minute walk from the Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “best bang for the dollar!!!”
Reviews.Author: iflynrvtoronto
Reviews.Content: We are in our 4 day here at the hotel now, it doesn't get any better for $125/nite, we are in a studio 46 floor great view super clean, great layout, comfie bed/linens, yes it is rated a 5 star, but its not by any stretch an fancy 5 star, the pool is small/ gym facalities are small / but this is one pricey city, the location is fantastic. We arrived at 10:00am we where offered a room on a lower floor, we opted to wait til 2 to have a room on a higher floor, would highly recommend this hotel. We paid an extra 100 for a week of wifi , we bought a net book for our trek. not sure how to indicaate this is a best value but thats how i would rate it

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: jbomb060
Reviews.Content: I decided to try out a serviced apartment as I liked the idea of having a kitchen and laundry facilities right in the room. The Meriton on Kent was perfect. Room was spacious, nicely decorated, and had a great view of Darling Harbour. The location was great being walking distance from Chinatown and Darling Harbour. There are also lots of shops (including a big souvenir shop down the street), and bars (Three Monkeys Pub is just on the other side of the building on George St.).

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good stay.”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeNick
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent as is the standard of the apartments. We stayed with another couple in a 2 bed apartment on the 45th floor. It was spacious with a big living and dining area and kitchen facilities including a proper oven, wasing machine, drier and even a dishwasher!. What let this place down was the details - little things that you just wouldn't expect in somwhere with 5*. The standard of some of the electrical gear was poor; the tv was not great and by the end of our stay we were on our 3rd toaster! The lifts are slow and were there was almost always a couple of them out of service. There was no offer of help with bags on arrival. All little things which would stop me giving this place an excellent rating. Still a very solid option for a stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect but........”
Reviews.Author: hotelinspector1960
Reviews.Content: This is my favourite place to stay at in Sydney. I have only 2 things of complaint.....after my last stay they took an extra $20 from my credit card. I have no idea why and can think of no reason for that either; had no time to call them to find out why to date. Secondly, they are hopeless at getting repairs done. The toilet was constantly flushing itself during my stay here. I notified the reception (duty manageress) yet nothing was done during my 3 night stay here. A dreadful waste of water and extremely annoying when you want to sleep as the noise was audible even with bathroom and bedroom doors closed. However, this was the only incident I have had here despite staying 15 or more time during the year, but regardless, it shouldn't have happened.

Reviews.Title: “great location...recommend”
Reviews.Author: visit10
Reviews.Content: really great location and great accomodation. apartments are so much better for a longer stay and this place was good. plenty of space and nice and clean. one minor fault was on one day they didn't clean the apartment and when i phoned up in the evening when i returned they weren't interested in sorting it out particuarly. and just bought up one clean towel! Reception and lifts were also quite slow and busy But overall, a good venue which i'd stay in again

Reviews.Title: “Good value, spacious, affordable”
Reviews.Author: aquablue21
Reviews.Content: Stayed the Meriton with my daughters while we went to see "Wicked" at the Capitol theatre. The location is excellent - close to the theatre, Darling Harbour, Pitt Street Mall. Rooms were spacious and good value. What does let these apartments down is the service - it does not match the 5 star rating. Reception staff were uninterested, we carried our own heavy bags, a big contrast to what you would expect (and usually receive from a 5 star hotel). Corridors were hot - air conditioning did not seem to be operating in these areas. Overall - a good place to stay for a larger group, clean, good facilities and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & deal”
Reviews.Author: Rockinjla
Reviews.Content: My husband, brother and I all stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath serviced apartment Nov. 21 - 26, 2009. It was great! The apartment had more then enough room for the three of us it was, clean, modern and the full kitchen and washer and dryer came in very handy. The staff was helpful - we flew from LAX to Sydney and arrived before check in. The front desk provided towels and a key to access the pool restroom which had a shower (very clean as well). We had a leak in the laundry room, called the front desk and they had a maintenance person up there within minutes who took care of the leak. The location was great too. The hotel was within an easy walk to Darling Harbour, restaurants, a huge shopping mall with grocery stores and a post office. I would totally recommend staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: girasol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 days. Found it very clean and comfortable. Glad we opted for a 1 bedroom on the 41st floor. The living area was quite spacious and comfortable. It include a desk, couch, large chair, table, ottoman, dining table w 4chairs. Windows all around which gives an open, spacious feeling. Our son was at the Hilton. He had 1/4 the space and no way to even heat water. The kitchen was quite adequate with oven, microwave, dishwasher, and a full size refrigerator and kettle (note that there is no coffee "brewer"--we brought some ground coffee with us for nought!). Teas, instant coffee, and sugar are provided. The oven controls were a bit different than we were used to, but easily learned. Washer and dryer were great, and pretty quiet. All soaps for dishes, laundry, and dishwasher were provided and replenished daily. They provide a hair dryer and iron w/board as well. Tub & separate shower also. We were impressed with its level of cleanliness. Ask for a high floor, as street noise can be a small issue, most especially on Saturday nights. The pubs go until 4 or so. Looking down on George St, it's like a sea of ants at that hour. Most other nights were much more peaceful. There are windows that open, which was lent a refreshing change from air conditioning (which it has). Good view of Darling Harbor. Nice central location. Walk to Chinatown, Darling Harbor, Pyrmont Bridge, and even Circular Quay. Foodstuffs can be had at Coles and Woolworth's, which we preferred slightly. In both cases, you take an escalator downstairs, where we least expected to find them. It's great if you want a meal at "home", since eating out in Sydney is quite pricey. One minor caveat, phone calls, even local ones, are $1.30/call, even for toll free calls. Reception desk is much too high, as noted by others, but it's marble, so I guess it's there to stay. Indoor pool & Jacuzzi plus a sauna and fitness center. Serviceable, but not all that inviting. All in all, we were quite satisfied with our stay and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Appartments as they should be,a warning to hotels.”
Reviews.Author: f2s
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights in a high floor one bedroom appartment and were very impressed. Odd shape building so odd room shapes.Small bathroom.Very smart decor. Expected the high floor to be quiet of traffic noise but it bounces up from other buildings. The view we had was over Darling harbour and from another direction a little of the view up the Sydney harbour and to our surprise the balcony was unlocked for our stay.(Due to trouble from previous guests,which is not tollerated by Meriton management,I expected not to get access to the balcony) Similarly I was surprised when we were fully serviced every day ,cleaning,fresh towells and bath products. One water glass was missing,otherwise perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: advocate_of_truth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this apartment hotel with my Boyfriend. We really liked these apartments, it was nice and quiet. We got a room on the 51st floor. Pros: - Great positioning - Quiet - nice modern apartments with plenty of space - great views Cons: - The lifts are slow at times. At once instance there was along line for everyone waiting to go into the lifts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent concept, great location, luxury feel. Service lacking.”
Reviews.Author: Dipshamps
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a couple at Meriton Kent st. Having been to Bondi and had minor gripes about access, but very pleased with concept we went for a 2 bed. Got on the 39th floor (29th actually, its one of those places where 1st floor is 10th...guess they like to advertise 50+floors!). Apartment as expected - terrifc views, blacony with room for samll party (not allowed!) and ample living space with decent kitchen and dining table etc. Very confortable. Rooms just as impressive, 1 had en suite, bath and shower etc, both were genuine doubles. On the price front - expensive for fri-sun as all hotels in CBT are, but otherwise worked out less than hotel room at 3* to stay in 5* accomodation - cant knock it. Here's the rub; It appears the concept is a winner, and they are always pretty busy or fully booked at weekends. Good news, well done, congratulations. This however appears to have lent itself to an air of arrogance amongst staff. They know its good, so dont make the extra (or even acceptable) effort to make the stay top drawer. Check in is sloppy, with regular exuses being 'we're fully booked' - er yeah, thats a good thing - i still want to be in my room at 2pm like you said... The gym here was woeful - small and but nice, except 3 of the 7 peices of equipment were faulty. The sauna didn;t work either so you couldn;t even cheat for a good sweat. Balcony needed cleaning and the wifi was mental - you could use it as wifi, but first you had to plug in the wired internet to register. Well thats helpful for an Ipod user.. Anyway - if they buck up their ideas on service, this place is a winner. Actually, given its self catering style, even with the arrogance and low standards, its still worth a stay, just dont expect much help. I figure its the same for all of them - i found Bondi staff to be just as 'whatever' about the customers, but cant speak for Pitt, world tower etc etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic apartments, great location!”
Reviews.Author: JessieS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a 5 night stay here on our arrival from the UK. As we were staying in hostels for the rest of our trip this was our one treat to stay in a nice place, and a treat it was. The location is fantastic you are literally a stones throw away from darling harbour and about a 15 min walk to circular quay, harbour bridge & the opera house. The walk down is easy and there are many shops along the way. The apartments are very luxourious and decorated to a high spec. The reception area is very large and well staffed. The rooms come with washer/dryer and basic kitchen. The bed is very large and spacious and one of the most comfortable i have slept in. This is a great place to stay in Sydney, sadly we had to cut our trip short and return home but if we were to return i would not think twice about booking this place.

Reviews.Title: “Views, location, modern living space that can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: cerenikov
Reviews.Content: Meriton on Kent Street is centrally located near Town Hall train station. It offers great views and accommodating customer service. I asked for a higher floor and got the most perfect city views. The laundry machines and kitchen were a plus. I got a great deal on their website A$90/nt, which includes maid/cleaning service every 7 days. No problem. It's across the street from world renowned Tetsuya's and a short stroll to the ethnic neighborhoods. I travelled with another girl and we never felt unsafe walking at night. I love Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JamiePerth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a week in the Meriton on the 53rd floor with a great view overlooking Darling Harbour. These apartments are in a very good location close to trains and buses. They are very well kept and serviced daily although you are responsible for washing your own dishes and rubish disposal which has a trash shutte on each floor. They are excellent value for money, we didn't have any hassles with staff and as matter of fact they could't do enough to help us. There is a coles and woolworths close by for grocery shopping if required, we stayed in a couple of nights and cooked our meals in the more than well out fitted kitchen. We had been looking for a SAydney base for some time and we will be staying at the Meriton Kent Street for future trips and holidays to Sydney - highlt recommended. By the way - the balcony doors do open, but it is a bit uncomfortable sitting out there if the air conditioner is running. Jamie & Anne Perth Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great apartment. Best Value in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Diggy21
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Meriton Kent St for 2 nights at the end of our honeymoon. This place was outstanding. The location is ideal, right near chinatown, the CBD, Darling harbor, and most importantly the Town Hall rail station. You can get anywhere in the city from the town hall station. The staff was great at check in and check out. The apartment buidling is huge, but we didn't mind. Our room was great, everything an apartment should have, including a big balcony to hang out on. Bathroom was nice and clean. They have a small gym and pool, but nothing special, just adequate. They really do a nice job though. Sydney is like most cities, expensive. We got a one bedroom direct for around $140/night. Best value for a city. Sydney is a great city, make sure you take a trip out to Bondi park and walk to Bente Beach. Go to the Sydney Fish Market and get fresh fish for lunch (best lunch of our trip). Had one big dinner in Sydney at the Rockpool Bar and Grill, fantastic meal, just really expensive. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Met our requirements very well”
Reviews.Author: sandrajc
Reviews.Content: We had a two bedroom apartment for a week in July. The Meriton Kent St was a great location for us - near Darling Harbour, near the shopping and close to transport links. I loved having the washing machine and was surprised to find that the washing powder is replaced daily. I knew that the balcony doors wouldn't open from reading on Tripadvisor about Meriton Kent St prior to booking. We mainly ate out except for breakfast so didnt fully utilise the kitchen. We also did not use the swimming pool - too busy. Service was prompt - although we were not demanding in this respect because the apartment contained all we required.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - no complaints at all”
Reviews.Author: Penny71
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in a studio apartment on a very high floor with no balcony so no need to worry about not being able to access it! The apartments are in a brilliant location and well equipped and maintained. We had an interesting view from ours. Our check in was quick although we did often see queues at the reception desk. Service was fine. I'm not giving 5 stars because I guess it was all pretty standard and didn't have that extra personal something, but I'm going back next month and don't see any reason to stay anywhere else on future trips to Sydney. We were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, excellent facilities, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: PolarisUK
Reviews.Content: This accommodation was beyond what we could have hoped for. The location is excellent, next to Darling Harbour (where a multitude of restaurants are) and Chinatown and within walking distance of the Opera House and Rocks. The standard of accommodation was excellent and the staff very attentive, helpful and friendly. If you consider that you get a tumble dryer, washer, dishwasher, oven, microwave... it just gives that added flexibility compared to a hotel - and is cheaper! Heartily recommended and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for five weeks - excellent, comfortable and spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: pennyblackAlnwick
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for us in central Sydney, only a short walk from Darling Harbour and most attractions. We stayed here whilst visiting our son and his Aussie partner who live in Rose Bay. Have stayed in Sydney on a number of occasions now and this has been the best for us. Will stay here when we return in the next year. We love sydney and we were impressed with these appartments. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and the booking clerk girl was a pleasure to deal with. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Wish there was more hotels like this”
Reviews.Author: jewellj
Reviews.Content: We had a great 2 room apartment. Each room had a bathroom. Central living space. Kitchen and even a washer & dryer. Great location. Close to Darling Harbor and walking distance to Circular Quay (maybe about a mile - easy walk). Great space to share with another couple. Enough privacy for each couple, but nice to be able to hang out and cook (and an additional plus to do laundry). Food in Sydney was pricey so we enjoyed the use of the kitchen to save some money. Also, nice view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room with only a few minor hitches.”
Reviews.Author: chodoboy69
Reviews.Content: To start of with this place is in a fantastic location and the rooms are very spacious For sydney standards. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment which had a gigantic bathroom, fully functional kitchen and laundry, with a living/dining room and large bedroom (with mirror over the top if u like that kind of stuff) The views were fantastic, however, the balcony was locked as a few other people have stated, nothing major just a bit of a pain (no need to give the place 1 star over this). The other hitch i also had was the card didnt work the first time i used it, but the staff easily fixed this up in a friendly manner - also a small hitch (and no need to give it 1 star over). The value of this place is excellent considering its size and location and i have no problems recommending this place and for that matter sydney to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A Few Problems”
Reviews.Author: Member From Shellharbour Australia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2 bedroom appartment for 4 days. The location is very good and while the bedrooms were not very big, they are quite nice. However, every day we stayed we found more problems, all be it minor ones but things added up to lower our impression of the place. These were mostly little things, ie insufficient cutlery, glasses etc, missing iron, missing TV remote, non functional DVD player, non functional dishwasher. Having said that, when we found a problem and reported it to the front desk, it was attended to very quickly (except the dishwasher and DVD player which we found not to work on our last night there). For the price paid (which is pretty reasonable for the area) I still would have expected that the rooms would have been prepared a little more thoroughly and checked for missing or non functioning items. So on that basis we were a bit disappointed with what we got. I did not use or see the pool or fitness area so can not comment on them. The studio and 1 bedroom prices seem to be pretty reasonable in general, but if you are looking for a 2 bedroom appt, then you may wish to check out the Meriton World Tower which is a sister property 1 block away. You can sometimes get a rate within $20 or so of the Kent. We have stayed there in the past and found the little bit extra is well worth it as the location is even better and the rooms are much better appointed (spa, TV in master bedroom etc) For a 2 bedroom place we would try the Meriton World Tower first, but would settle for the Meriton Kent Street if we had to.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in great location”
Reviews.Author: Funky_Fifi
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have stayed here. Last time we had a fabulous 2 bed suite this time just a studio. When we arrived the balcony door was not shut properly and the wind howled through the gap (the doors are screwed shut). When we complained it was fixed immediately. The studio showed some signs of wear (eg clunky shower door but at least it wasn't a curtain) but it was very very clean and serviced daily.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: IainMadrid
Reviews.Content: These apartments offer super value for money compared to the expensive hotels around Circular Quay. Very comfortable fully equipped rooms, much cheaper, and only a few minutes walk to Darling Harbour and Sydney Harbour . Our only gripes were that the balcony doors cannot be opened (owing to previous problems with items falling in to the streets below from great heights) and that the lifts can be slow to arrive in the foyer. Otherwise this place is spot on.

Reviews.Title: “If I returned - would not look to stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: WorldRoamer59
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my niece for 3 nights at the beginning of August. We had a 1 bed apartment loacted on the 23rd floor which had a massive king size bed. The whole apartment was very clean and well presented with all the furniture and wardrobe space you could wish for. The bathroom had a great shower; there was a hairdryer in the drawer and toiletries were laid out. The washer/dryer unit which was tastefully hidden in the hall of the apartment was a real bonus and they provide enough washing fluid for 1 wash - also there is an iron and ironing board. The kitchen area is lovely and equipped with a dishwasher, double bowl sink, full electric oven/grill, 4 gas ring hob, microwave, toaster, kettle and enough crockery, glasses and cutlery for 4 people. It was a bit strange that only 1 large saucepan and 1 small saucepan were provided - no frying pan, but for our short stay this was not a problem as we used the grill. The desk staff were always very friendly & helpful - we arrived at 7am on a Saturday and although there was no room available they were more than willing to store our luggage and take our mobile number to contact us as soon as a room was ready, assuring us that we would be top of the list to be roomed - our room was ready for us at midday so that we could move in and relax a bit after our travels. There is no wi-fi in the rooms - internet is available and a price through hard wire to your PC but there are a number of cafe's around which offer free internet for patrons. The location is perfect - across the road from the monorail although it is not really necessary to use it as Darling Harbour, Paddy's market, China Town and most of the monorail stations are within comfortable walking distance. There is an abundance of restaurants around although for our 3 nights in we did not try any as we were more than happy to eat in (after having travelled for nearly 2 weeks already and eating out all the time). We bought filet steak from Paddy's market - very cheap - which was deliciuos and also loads of fresh vegetables. The metro is very nearby - you have a choice of Town Hall or Museum stations. By Town Hall station you have Woolworths which is the local supermarket - the food court is on the lower level. We went by train from the airport to Museum station and the Meriton was just under a 10 minute stroll away. We really enjoyed our stay here and would have no hesitation in returning or recommending this place if what you are looking for is a serviced apartment and not a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: buba09
Reviews.Content: We stayed 11 nights with a young boy. They gave us a high floor (54), as weÂ´ve requested. Functional kitchen and dining area. Spacious bathrooms. Very well located, as we had lots of shops and markets very close. We could get to main attractions just walking. Two things to keep in mind: thereÂ´s no wi fi. Internet connection and car parking are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “never staying there again......”
Reviews.Author: sarah1115
Reviews.Content: my sister and I got our expensive clothes stolen from our room I have stayed in many hotels and never had anything stolen. Will never stay at this place again. Make sure lock all your things as there is a thief around.........

Reviews.Title: “Way above our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Smilingnik
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week in early August (last week) and it was lush! We booked a studio apartment which was really big considering (booked direct on the Meriton website - go there to get the cheapest rates) and at $90.00 per night it was not just a bargain but a beautiful one. To start with the room was immaculately presented, very clean, modern, comfy king size bed with soft pillows, air con (reverse cycle), big fluffy towels, great kitchen with everything you need to be happy and washer/dryer. The pool and spa is wonderful and there is also a fully equipped gym which we loved as well. For people who have criticised the service here, this property is a serviced apartment (with a 5* rating) so there is no room service, no restaurant - but we still received great service when required (ala additional towels), always prompt and with a smile. The staff are also very helpful and the house staff will all say hello to you as they go about their duties. The location is perfect - you can walk to anywhere in Sydney (even the fish markets if you dare!) and it has loads of restaurants and shops around it. Even tho it was in the centre of the city, our apartment was really quiet (we were on the 27th floor facing George street) which was a surprise as well. We won't hesitate to stay here again when we return to Sydney again and we recommend it wholeheartedly - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location in the center of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TheHanoian
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2-bedroom apartment through wotif.com. Nice, spacious apartment, very clean. Absolutely fantastic location to explore Sydney as you can walk to most of the interesting places. Lots of restaurants, a couple of small supermarkets etc. very near by.

Reviews.Title: “Why have a balcony if you can't use it”
Reviews.Author: UnholyTrinity
Reviews.Content: Ver comfortable rooms, great beds and pillows, excellent location, value for money, tidied daily... sounds perfect right? All except one little thing, no balcony access! There was a lovely balcony view from our 42nd floor apartment complete with nice balcony furniture, but it only served to tease you more as they are locked and "not opened for anyone". Aparently there has been some parties with things launched off the balcony but should this drive a policy that every guest will do the same? One of the main reasons i chose this hotel was for the views and the balcony. At least be up fron Meriton and remove the pictures of people on balconys and advertise that you cannot go outside.

Reviews.Title: “A great apartment choice in inner Sydney”
Reviews.Author: pennae
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I were presenting at 3 conferences over a week and a half and needed somewhere to stay where we wouldn't be on top of each other! We were both still madly preparing for our presentations and this apartment was perfect for our needs. We stayed on the 39th floor in a 2-bedroom apartment which had 2 good-sized bedrooms with king-sized beds, one with an en-suite bathroom with bath and the other with the bathroom next door; a good-sized living area with a table AND a desk (perfect for us!); a full kitchen; and a mini laundry tucked into a cupboard. The apartment was tidied daily and we had 2 major cleans while we were there. The "major clean" was far more than we expected - they even tidied up all the pens and highlighters that were strewn around by putting them back in their cases! Over the top! Yes, the balcony was locked and this is a pity because the balcony would extend the living space so much more. We were also lucky in being on a relatively high floor - the traffic noise in Sydney is shocking. Even being that high up we were entertained by sirens most nights. I'd hate to have been on a low floor! In all, a fantastic stay for independent people (don't expect much help from the front desk - they're just way too busy) and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: meeya79
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days during our trip to Sydney in July. We had a 1 bedroom w/ a king sized bed on the 53rd floor. Very nice view. Nice decor. The room was spacious. Very clean. The kitchen had a microwave/oven, washer, dryer, dishwasher, stove. The kitchen had utensils, cutlery, dishes, pots etc. If we ever returned to Sydney we will definitely stay here again. There is a pool and sauna in the building. There was also a TV, stereo/CD player, and a DVD player. The normal rate quite be expensive. But we had a discount rate of $99/day.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal; nice modern rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ACYSingapore
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week here in a one-bedroom that rented for about $145/night (the price went higher on the weekend). We were very happy with the rooms, which were clean and modern, with a comfortable bed. Everything was in good condition and seemed intelligently designed and laid out. The kitchen and washing machine/dryer were handy. I used the pool to swim laps every day. It was always being used by other guests, but everyone played nice. The sauna was lovely too. I'm glad I took the advice of other reviewers and stayed here. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good but is a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: OzTravellerBrisbane
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit but our first in a 2 bedroom. The apartment was very large and kept in very good condition. Nice firm bed (but not too hard) soft pillows and quite a well stocked kitchen. Whilst the check-in was efficient, we didn't get an early room. Not too fussed as we had things to do. The area around there gets quite noisy on a Saturday night but Sunday night wasn't as bad. Very handy spot for trains, buses and the monorail station. Would stay again for the convenience but not for a quiet location. Pick the Sheraton on the Park for that but the normal rooms there have no view.

Reviews.Title: “stunning views”
Reviews.Author: KIRY
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, clean big rooms, friendly staff ,our appartment on 54th floor had stunning views of Sydney, absolutely amazing @ night, cant wait to go back again

Reviews.Title: “Some comments, but overall still a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: BA-traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2-room apartment for our stay in Sydney direct with Meriton apartments. Before our arrival I asked some questions by e-mail and they were answered prompt and friendly. At the airport we took the door-to-door van service (ask at the tourist office in the terminal), a bus for about 20 people with behind a luggage car. It costs 13 AUD p.p. one way or 22 AUD p.p. for a return. In the lobby the employees are behind a huge front as if they have something to hide. They have to stand to see you and loop down upon you, not very client friendly. Some staff is forthcoming but some of them are not really suited for the hospitality business. I had to sign a form to agree with the no-party and no-noise policy (great, it will give us a quiet stay) but also I had to give a 100 AUD deposit. (In the apartment is a list with all the kitchen items and the price of it in case something is broking or missing. During our stay I noticed that not everything was with 4 pieces as on the list. So I was a little worried that they would charge me the lost items and if I would mentioned it wouldnâ€™t that make them suspicious? Fortunately I received my whole deposit back!) In the living room there were only lighting ornaments in the ceiling, so in the evening it was not possible to create a cozier atmosphere. The apartment had a living room with open (full) kitchen area, a small bedroom with a wardrobe and a tiny bathroom. The latter was bad designed; it was not easy to get in, the door had to be wide open to enter due to the place of the washbasin. There was also a washer and dryer. Very strange that the washer could only be set on two temperatures, cold or 50 Celsius (= 122 F), so the laundry would not be clean or shrink! When I tried the hot temperature I noticed that it didnâ€™t worked at all, the water stayed cold. They offer laundry and dry cleaning service, we used to dry cleaning for a suit, it was reasonable priced and ready within 2 days (but only just in time for our visit to the Opera that evening!) . From here we could easily walk to Coles supermarket and we made our own dinner during our 4-day stay, which was fantastic (we were on a round-the-world tour and mostly in hotels). Also it was a 5-10 minute walk to catch a train to Circulair Quay, we always bought the day-tripper of 16 AUD p.p with unlimited access to public transport including ferries. The business center was expensive but just around the corner (on the way to Coles) in Liverpool Street is a Korean Internet cafÃ©. Donâ€™t let the very worn stairs scare you, is it cheap, the staff is friendly and they have very fast computers with big screens.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great service, great value, wonderful view, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: PAB048
Reviews.Content: Just had our second stay at these apartments. Both times the front desk staff have been exceptional - nothing is too much trouble - anything we wanted happened straight away. We were given an aprtment on the 55th Floor and the views were incredible. It also helped when staff explained why the balcony doors are now locked - unbelivevable that guests would throw bottles and other missiles off the balconies - apparently the massive glass roof of the reception area has been shattered twice! Wopuld not stay anywhere esle in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Apartment, Convenient Location, Safe”
Reviews.Author: ezekiel19
Reviews.Content: 1st time in Sydney. Booked the hotel based solely on the comments from Trip Advisor. Booked thru the hotel's web site, got pretty decent rate except for one Saturday night. Stayed a total of 2+2, total 4 nights, on 47th and the 51st floor. We got a 2-bedroom apartment. There is also a sofa in the living room, which could sleep a child. Apartment was clean. It comes with cooking facilities, as well as washing machine/dryer. Excellent view outside but as per previous comments, the balcony was locked. The location was excellent, there was a Cole Supermarket across the road. Walkable to Chinatown as well. We could get groceries and cook dinner, especially since we have kids with us. One set back was that the cooking smell lingers in the room, since the balcony cannot be opened. The windows are in the rooms, thus the room also smell of cooking when we were sleeping. Car park is expensive at A$35/day. Overall, a hassle free stay, great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, location was great for what we wanted, beds great”
Reviews.Author: leone07
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. We usually stay at Fraser just up the road, but couldn't get in. we had a studio apartment that was a great size and perfect for what we needed. Fridge was making funny noices so we just turned it off. Fabulous beds, professional service from staff, rooms furnished very nicely for a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and value!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewMichaelZ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Oaks for 4 nights during May and enjoyed our stay at the Meriton. At just a few blocks from Darling Harbour, the location can't be beat. The hotel staff was really helpful and our 40th studio was clean and spacious, and had excellent views to the Harbour. Faith Cafe on the corner of Kent street has a great breakfast and free internet, check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Pratt
Reviews.Content: I booked a one bedroom apartment here for one night in June 09. The hotel itself is mixed residential/business/short term but doesn't have the run down feeling that these establishments seem to often take on. Service is bland but efficient. Problems with internet were dealt with quickly and efficiently. The rooms are very well presented, though money has been saved by buying cheaper appliances and furniture than you may expect. Best of all, the one bedroom apartments have the luxury of some serious space. Very nice in a big city. Strongly recommend this hotel, particularly for a longer stay when the waching machine and kitchen would be very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value can't wait to return in January 2010”
Reviews.Author: Duck-Feet-67
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2009 and it was perfect. The apartments are large and well equipped with everything you could need. There are private balconies behind glass so little sun traps which was fantastic. We were in room 5102B which was the 51st floor and the views over Darling Harbour were great. We booked with wotif.com and paid $100 per night which was brilliant value. Rooms are nicely furnished, and the location is near perfect for tourists. Kent St. is parallel to Georges, so access to transportation was never a problem. It is also less than 10 minutes walk from Darling Harbour. Lot's of malls, shops and eating establishments around too. Rooms have all the amenities for cooking, washing and drying clothes, etc.& are serviced everyday with top ups to tea/coffee/sugar and in the bathroom top ups to soap/shampoo & conditioner /hand lotion & shaving cream. Overall a great experience and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: 23angeles
Reviews.Content: Rooms are great, nicely furnished, and the location is near perfect for tourists. Kent St. is parallel to Georges, so access to transportation was never a problem. It is also less than 10 minutes walk from Darling Harbour. Lot's of malls, shops and eating establishments around too. This is a serviced apartment establishment, so the rooms have all the amenities for cooking, washing and drying clothes, etc. Room is also cleaned everyday. First time in Australia. We spent first six days in Gold Coast and then last 3 days in Sydney. After experiencing the warm, friendly, and helpful Staff of where we stayed in Gold Coast, the Staff here in Meriton was almost the exact opposite. They weren't rude or anything like that, but just not as "welcoming" and "helpful". The level of hospitality should match or if not even exceed the physical structure and amenities of the establishment -- just my opinion. I would have given this place the highest marks if it were not for the Front Desk Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tdotrep
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in a chic, modern, studio apartment, and didn't want to leave. Great staff, great room, great facilities (the pool area was gorgeous), great location (right in the heart of the CBD - we walked everywhere). Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great views from the balcony”
Reviews.Author: daveraynejames
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, interiors and value. Stayed in the 2 bed apartment for 6 nights, Sat-Thurs and was very happy. Family loved it (a bath, thank god). Website booking v. easy. Dead batteries in TV remote- housekeeping came up within 15 mins, changed them and said "shall I unlock the balcony sir". Lovely views of the Anzac bridge for breakfast and supper.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, location & value for money for all ages”
Reviews.Author: jane_oz
Reviews.Content: We were alocated a 2brm apartment on L43. Mum & Dad got a QS bed with their own bathroom and hubby and I got the KS room with a clean, modern bathroom with bath and wait for it........a mirror on the ceiling of our bedroom. Guess that's why the oldies chose the other room? Views were spectacular. Balcony door opened no probs, with furniture outside to enjoy the city. Great views to Darling Harbour. Large family sized stainless steel fridge, dishwasher. Not much cooking gear but when you have the lovely French restaurant next door, this wasn't an issue. Cafe downstairs with decent coffee, supermarket up on the corner. Cable on the plasma telly. Serviced daily. Spotlessly clean. OK to leave luggage if you check out early. Shuttle bus to airport. Only brickbat was that it was full of teenagers who were partying hard in the city for the weekend, taking eskys up and down in the lifts to refill. When they smashed a stubbie in the lift, security responsed straight away. As an employee of a 5* iconic hotel brand , I definately recommend this property to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but staff was not helpful”
Reviews.Author: April162008
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 5 families, consisting of 10 adults, 7 teenagers and 5 kids. We just came from the Gold Coast where we had a wonderful stay there, especially because the staff at our hotel were very helpful and accomodating. We booked 5 two bedroom apartments for 2 nights at the Meriton Kent in Sydney. The room was very nice, it had all the amenities to make the stay comfortable. However, the reception staff was not very helpful. They were abrupt and they just wanted to get over with our check in process. Also, they had so many rules posted on the elevators and the rooms. You really feel unwelcome. Since we are a large group, we were hoping that some of us would be booked on the same floor. We have advised them of this in advance when we were booking more than a month ago. This did not happen, and they did not even try to expalin to us. It is a nice hotel but if you are looking for a little extra help especially if this is your first visit to Sydney, then look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: SandBTasmania
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for seven nights, in a studio apartment, after booking on Wotif. However do check their web site as this is usually cheaper. Great value at $99 during the week. Very clean and roomy with everything you could want including cooking facilities. Are apartment was on the 49th floor, but the lifts very very good, a little bit of a wait at peak times. The Sanctuary Hotel across the road has very good well priced meals, with inside or outside dining, great for people watching. Easy walking distance to Darling Harbour, Chinatown, and even Circular Quay and look for free CBD shuttle bus No. 555 that travels from Central Station to Circular Quay. Overall a great experience and would not hesitate to stay here again. P.S Yes you can here sirens at night even from the 49th Floor but I am sure it would be worse in other places. Would definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and View”
Reviews.Author: harrysmothernz
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed here for 4 nights last week we were very pleased, our serviced apartment was better than the photos on here! I requested a room on a high floor , with a view and away from the lifts, and that's exactly what we got. We were on the 50th floor with fantastic views, the location is wonderful just off George Street with the buses running every few minutes including the free shuttle and 2 blocks from the Town Hall train station. We had a one bedroom apartment with 2 very comfortable clean single beds. Every day the cleaners came in changed the towels, and sometimes the bed linen and even vacuumed. Far more than what we expected. The unit was very clean and ultra modern, the kitchen was fabulous with a full size fridge and freezer and dishwasher. The bathroom was great with a large shower with great pressure and a full size bath. I used the swimming pool and spa facilities they were very good and very quiet around 9pm at night. We found there to be no noise at all from others in the hotel and very little noise from the street just the odd car noises etc but nothing to keep us awake at nights. We didn't use room service but I did call down to reception a few times and they were very helpful and pleasant enough, and like mentioned in other reviews the lifts were a little slow at times. But that didn't bother us too much at all. The security is great, you have to swipe a card to access the lifts and then another pass to get in to your room, so we felt very safe. There is a huge selection of eating places around the hotel on George and Liverpool Streets, there's a Coles food supermarket in World Square shopping centre a few minutes walk from the hotel. Including restaurants, food court, pharmacy, bottle store and other stores. We found it to be a great handy stop for everything we needed. I wouldn't hesitate in booking in again if I had the chance to go to Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and luxury accomodations”
Reviews.Author: TheCooksSaltLakeCity
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in this condo-apartment facility. We chose a two bedroom unit since it was not much more than a one bedroom. It wasn't until the second night that we discovered a second bathroom adjoining the bedroom we thought was a closet!! Everything is ultra modern and the kitchen was top notich; it had a washer and drier which helped to bring our clothes back to wearable condition. The location is about 5 blocks from the Darling Sydney Harbor and there are many restaurants in the area. The AUD was about .70 of the US dollar at the time. This made the unit a real deal. If the US dollar continues to weaken the place will not be such a bargain but still worth staying.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great views”
Reviews.Author: daisycutter
Reviews.Content: We had a 54th floor room with great views of Darling Harbour, Pyrmont Bridge and even able to see Fort Denison on Sydney Harbour. The staff were effficient, very pleasant and most helpful. The spacious apartment was well equipped if you wanted to self cater. The price was extremely good and booked through WOTIF. It is situated in what is known as the Spanish Quarter (apparently) and we enjoyed what was overall a very good meal at MIRO which is just around the corner in Liverpool St. Of the several dishes we had only the calamari disappointed. The staff at this restaurant are very capable and friendly without being intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Price you Pay!”
Reviews.Author: FITCHICK711
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a 2-bedroom apartment to attend a 3-day convention at Darling Harbour. My husband's parents also stayed at a Studio apartment on the same floor. The apartments were excellent, spotless, lots of room and everything looked new. We booked in the Meriton website because of their excellent 24-hr cancellation policy and they also have the cheapest price on the net. As mentioned by the previous reviewer, they will not charge you if you cancel 24-hrs prior to arrival. They do a quick touch up to the apartment everyday - change the towels, make the beds, etc. which I did not expect so it was good. This apartment is about a 5-10 minute walk to Darling Harbour. We did get woken up a couple of times on a Saturday night (about 3am) by sirens and people screaming from down the streets so be prepared for this if you are staying over the weekend. Also, do not expect to get checked-in right at 2pm as from experience and by the number of people waiting in the lobby this is not the case. We were able to check in at 3pm. The only time the lifts were slow was during check-out so allow a lot of time for this. I found the Reception staff okay and helpful but not really great but then again this is no 5-star hotel. We have stayed at the 3 Meriton Apartments in the Sydney CBD now and I think this is the best value for money out of the 3. We will be back there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: aussiekpn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Meriton Kent Street for 4 nights over Easter. The location couldn't be better - right in the heart of Sydney and close to everything. Our studio apartment was a good size and spotlessly clean. Staff were efficient and helpful, but remember this is not a hotel, so doesn't offer the full range of hotel services. Parking was expensive but as expected in this part of town. The only downside is the very slow elevators (not enough for the number of floors) and the outside noise - sirens etc. We recommend earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay whilst exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: fsba20
Reviews.Content: Loved it here, we had a studio apartment which was clean and well kitted out. We were able to catch up on our washing and do some cooking which was great. The pool here is also lovely. It was also a really good price considering where you are in this lovely city, would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value - Very High Quality - Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Exactlyhowitwas
Reviews.Content: The Meriton tend to reduce prices if they are not busy so it is worth keeping an eye on their website as they have a no deposit 24 cancellation policy, which makes it very easy to cancel and rebook to take advantage of the best rates available. The apartments are superbly equipped and very comfortable. They are ideally situated for sightseeing. We found the staff to be helpful,polite and friendly. We certainly did not expect five star concierge service as it is not that sort of a place. The daily apartment servicing was also excellent. I understand the frustrations of a previous reviewer in respect of the locked balconies but safety must come first - WE WERE ON THE 43RD FLOOR AND IT WAS A LONG WAY DOWN!. Personally I would not have found it very pleasant anyway sitting on the balcony with people smoking on the next floor down.The locked balconies were not an issue as far as we were concerned and did not spoil our enjoyment in the least. The air conditioning was very good so the apartment was always comfortable. Would highly recommend the Meriton on Kent and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value in a city”
Reviews.Author: pinewoods
Reviews.Content: I must admit that because we got such a good rate( $159) for a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom city centre apartment we were a bit worried before we arrived . Our worries disappeared as soon as we walked through the door.The apartment was fabulous - modern, clean,a good size and very well equipped. We were not far from Darling harbour and these apartments made a great base for our 3 night stay and exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff. Great location but NO BALCONY ACCESS”
Reviews.Author: PlaneHopperWA
Reviews.Content: After a long flight we were greeted by an exceptionally rude staff member. When we got to the room we realised that although we had a great view, the balcony door was sealed shut. The windows only opened slightly. So while the balcony had a very inviting table and chairs (and it was a warm night) we were advised that due to "circumstances" the balcony could not be opened NO EXCEPTIONS. When I said it wasnt on the website, another rude staff member said "Yes it is. It's been stated there for months". Really? Not when we booked & when I recently checked. To all non-smokers- you can not enjoy a warm evening overlooking Sydney. To all smokers- good luck travelling down 30 flights (past business people) to stand on the street.

Reviews.Title: “great experience!”
Reviews.Author: ukcnsg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Meriton on Kent for 4 nights in a two bedroom apartment on 36th floors. The apartment is really nice with modern furniture and amenity. It is a real pity that the balcony is locked and we cannot enjoy the great view. The apartment has two bathrooms, both are very nice except the shower was really annoying. It has very small water...and it goes all over the place! But overall it is a great place to stay for its central location, modern furnishing, clean environment and many many more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place if you don't have to talk to the staff”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravelsQld
Reviews.Content: Well presented in a good location - but as always this will not make up for rude and inconsiderate staff. For a room of 4 people there was a maximum of 2 keys (a policy that changed from our first day to our second). They have also locked out access to their balconies without warning or compensation for the trouble. And the solution to the air-conditioners cutting out (a critical thing if you have your balcony shut) was to turn off the power through the fuse box & go again. Finally when one person went to depart for the airport a few days early, our transportation was told that we weren't checking out - not even a call to check with us in the room. So I would recommend the hotel, but only if you can go there without interacting with their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Like a new modern home !”
Reviews.Author: Jono_Melbourne
Reviews.Content: The lobby is extremely modern and spacious, the elevators, the fittings - everything seems like its less than 1 year old. The rooms are huge, with modern kitchenette and hidden laundry room with washing machine, dryer and ironing board and iron. Every accessory and kitchen utensil is already there - soaps, sponges, pots, pans, plates, glasses, wine glasses, bowls, tea towels. The bathroom is modern and clean, lots of soaps and shampoos, the only bother is that the white towel had a small brown stain or two and the bathroom fan didn't work. King Bed is very large and comfortable. Lots of storage space and sliding door wardrobe. LCD TV is great, 2 air conditioning units as well ! And the Pool and gym are *very* good by any hotels standard.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: sueash
Reviews.Content: We were new to Sydney and we found the front desk staff able to supply us with all the knowledge we needed to get around. They were very friendly but very busy. You certainly had to wait your turn. The 2 bedroom apartment was on the 41st floor and was exceptionally clean and well laid out. We liked the close proximity to the city center and the major attractions. The only thing wrong is that our DVD remote didn't work and even though we asked for batteries, none were supplied. Other than this small problem everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: DoBee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 BR spotless unit, surrounded with natural light from windows.
