It was perfect for us with kitchenette, shower and separate tub in bath, mirrors in bedroom and livingroom so makeup application did not require the bath being occupied, safe in the closet large enough for laptop, elevators required room key swipe (so great for security), very comfortable king bed (two twins pushed together, but you would never know without investigating), balcony with table and chairs, work desk in living room, flatscreen TV. The unit was very quiet, which we appreciate as being light sleepers. Great location with public transportation 2 blocks away. Restaurants very close. The only downside was obnoxious air deodorizer on check-in which aired out quickly and charge for internet service, which seems to be common in Australia. We would stay here again, roomy, extremely comfortable and an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it so much I'm going back...”
Reviews.Author: bris989
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights just after New Years. We initially booked this hotel because it had very cheap on-line rates for that period, and I was in a hurry. Check - In OK very busy due to the heavily discounted post New Years Eve room rates for the week ($78 a Night), but we mananged to get checked in under 10mins so no complaints. We took our own bags up to our room but again no dramas, they had a guy do it if need be. The lifts were busy 55 floors and four lifts can lead to delays as the maintenance/maids use th same lifts and it can slow things down. So don't be in a hurry. The Room As we had spent the last few nights crashing on a fold-up bed at a friends place over New Years I was ready to settle for anything as we had only paid such a cheap rate I thought there must be a catch, but when we walked into the apartment we were not disappointed. We had a studio which was quite large, it had a shared lobby with another apartment (Dual Key) but didn't hear any noise from them. No balcony in studios but they lock all balconies anyway, presumably to stop Yobbos from throwing stubbies or furniture off the balconies. Other than that, Flat Screen TV, Kitchenette and very clean. Check Out No problems they stored our bags for a few hours before our flight, no dramas with the bill, then or afterwards. Verdict Like the title says I'm hitting the big Four O in June and have decided to hang out in Sydney for a month, just booked my Hotel last night, yep can't go past it Meriton Kent Street it was. PS. No I didn't get it for $78 a night but it's still great value on long stay rates and the kitchenette will save you heaps...

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartment, lousy lifts!”
Reviews.Author: wahcow
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Meriton for a night. Booked a 2-bedroom apartment. Rates was very good considering it's location. The apartment was spacious and fully-serviced. The balcony was locked though. Located between Chinatown and QVB. Tends to have lots of people around the hotel as there's an education center opposite the hotel. The programming for the lifts can use improvement. The waiting time for the lifts can be as long as 5 minutes especially during busy periods. There's 5 lifts, but the impression is that the lifts are not efficient or optimised properly - they are either up to the highest floors or to the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, absolutely.”
Reviews.Author: MarittaC
Reviews.Content: I booked this apartment for five nights because of the good reviews, and even though it was a little higher than I usually am willing to pay, it was still a good rate for city center with kitchenette. I was so pleased with the apartment - it was roomy and immaculate. The only complaint with the kitchen was no microwave, but all other tools, utensils etc were available. I also liked the washer/dryer in the room, that was incredibly convenient. I liked the security - had to swipe room keys to use elevators, so you knew people who didn't belong on your floor wouldn't be wandering about. It was a very busy place with lots of guests. Staff of every type were helpful in every way, and when I ever needed any level of service it was given promptly and professionally. I had wireless internet in the room at a slightly high rate, but not out of line with other hotels. The sauna was surprisingly hot, as a sauna should be and usually isn't. Pool was nice too, not really a "fun" pool but good for laps. I didn't use the jacuzzi or fitness room. These facilities felt a little small, but when I used them they were not at all overcrowded, so apparently adequate. It was an easy walk from both Town Center and Museum train stations. There is a taxi stand right outside the front. It's an easy walk to the Circular Quay waterfront area, where you can see the opera house, the bridge, etc. I was on the 33rd floor, the view of George St. was fantastic. I would stay here again or at any Meriton in a heartbeat and would heartily recommend it to any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: Kriddy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Meriton, in a 1 Bed apartment with my girlfriend for 2 nights over the Valentines day weekend. We were on the 50th Level, and had amazing views of the city and darling harbour. The rooms were modern and clean and pretty large, the bedroom was really good aswell. It had all you want in a apartment, stainless steel fridge, dishwasher, microwave, CD player, DVD player, Plasma TV, washing machine and dryer. We found it really good value for money too, for only $159 per night. When booking here, request for a high room, it's a awesome view! The only downer would be you couldn't open the windows on the encolsed balcony! But other then that it was a awesome place to stay and I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat guest”
Reviews.Author: Travelman2500
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in a studio room for the 3rd cricket test Aust vs South Africa early January 2009 (yes I walked to the SCG every day). I have stayed here previously twice before, for one night at a time, and found it wonderful and relaxing. This time was pretty much the same, However house cleaning only turned up once (for fresh towel and linen) that was after the 1st night. Luckily there were extra towels in the cupboard, and I was a solo traveller and only used the room to sleep and relax, so not too much of a worry The only bad thing is when in a studio room, The main door from the hallway leads into a small hallway of which your studio room is either (a) or (b) room. And of course another door to enter your room. These two doors offer a loud *clang*, when opening and closing. Its sound like your own door is being opened and closed, when its actually the studio next door. If you have a nightowl person using the studio opposite you, then expect to be woken up suddenly, it is quite loud Overall though, intend to stay again. Location is great, Units are clean and spacious

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Apartments”
Reviews.Author: ClaireAndSteve2008
Reviews.Content: The room itself was huge on the 31st floor and great view of the Anzac bridge. Bathroom was spotless with a massive walk in shower! The bed was extremely comfortable - the only downside in the bedoom was the blinds. They were paper thin and white - letting ALL the light in at 6:30am! Not good if you fancied a lie in some days. Apart from that it was really quite and you cannot hear a thing from any other room, above, below or to the side. Kitchen was fab. We did have an issue one morning when we tried to make toast and the toaster blew the fuse and tripped out all the electric! After calling reception they sent a maintainace guy straight away and he swapped for a brand new toaster. Great service. All the staff were extremley pleasant and would smile/say hello if they saw you in the corridor. All in all this apartment is a great base for seeing sydney with everything in easy walking distance. We would re-book should we happen to be lucky enough to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay in the centre of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: leafygreen
Reviews.Content: Just back from at four night stay at the Meriton on Kent. Booked a two bedroom, two bathroom apartment via Wotif.com. Check-in, kitchen and laundry great. Spacious carparking bays :) We were on the 41st floor and although the balcony was locked shut "for security purposes" that was ok with me as we have young children. No street noise on that level or noise from adjoining apartments or lift. Really beautiful indoor pool, also spa, sauna and gym. Lots of family friendly places to eat at nearby. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: furbynz
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying 5 nights at the Meriton kent St. It exceeded our expectations. As we booked it directly with them, we knew they couldn't guarantee us a view etc but we had our fingers crossed. On arrival, we ended up in 3902A - a fab view of Darling Harbour and panaramic views round the city as well. We couldn't have asked for more! The one bedroom apartment was also much bigger than the one shown on their website Very central location but incredibly quiet (couldn't even hear the people in the neighbouring apartment apart when they left their room. We will certainy return. Great front desk assistance at all times. Thank you Meriton Kent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view!”
Reviews.Author: slmat22
Reviews.Content: We loved the Meriton Kent Street! This time last year I stayed at the Meriton Pitt Street and really enjoyed my stay in a studio appartment. This year I was able to get a better deal on wotif.com.au for the Kent St. appartments $89 a night for a mystery room which turned out to be a one bedroom appartment, great value. We looked out all over Sydney from the airport to blue mountains and looking down onto darling harbour. Loved seeing all of the planes flying over Sydney on their way to land. Great facilities including all the mod. cons and full kitchen and laundry, which we used. Great restaurants close by and also a coles supermarked in the world square close by. We used the pool and spa which were great. Staff were really helpful and lifts were fast. We stayed on 39th floor (which is actually 29th floor as reception is on floor 10 even though it's the groud floor). Loved this appartment and would love to live here!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: travellingMummy0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Meriton Kent Street in a studio apartment with our 11 month old after looking for a place in Sydney with some "crawling room" for our baby. Well, from the moment we arrived we loved every part of it! We were given a room on level 50 (actually 40th floor) with a view of the habour entrance and the city. The studio room was huge with plenty of room for our babies' cot and play room. All features of the room seemed new and very clean, with a huge plasma. We paid extra to park our car in the car park but it was well worth the money having our own car park in the middle of Sydney! The location is good with the main shopping area only a few blocks walk, as was Darling habour and Chinatown. The room was exceptionally quiet and the bed very comfortable. The toiletries supplied (Meriton brand) smelled divine. Our only problem was we didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough”
Reviews.Author: Ray Goldberg
Reviews.Content: Check in clerk was totally uninterested. Supposidly,this is a 5 star facility. Someone can't count. It would be 4 star at best. Screaming sirens at night due to single glaze windows. It's extremely noisy, even on the 25th floor. The balcony door is locked shut and no, they will not open it. The kitchen appears to be well stocked with cooking appliances until you start to use them. They lack bare essentials. The shower is that badly built that water leaks all over the bathroom floor but get this: $35 A NIGHT TO PARK YOUR CAR Never ever again for us.

Reviews.Title: “good base in CBD”
Reviews.Author: canberrakiwi
Reviews.Content: good base in CBD, gets better the on upper levels. have stayed a number of times as it is good value and comfortable. some good places to eat near by so don't need inhouse diner.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: melbxyxyx
Reviews.Content: Overall the apartment is excellent. But beware all the balcony doors are now permamnently locked. Last time I stayed they were open and I enjoyed sitting out there. Really annoying. The lounge/dining/kitchen area therefore had no opening windows and we could see the balcony with all its furniture still on, looking very enticing. A really daft policy of theirs which would stop me returning despite the great facilities and location

Reviews.Title: “Great value top Sydney accomodation”
Reviews.Author: satisfiedsouthland
Reviews.Content: Meriton Kent St was great value for our families holiday to Sydney. Great location. The rooms were very well appointed with plenty of room for our five day stay. We took our two small children and it had excellent facilities for them. Located close to the monorail it made for not too much walking for the littlies.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: SydneyBella22
Reviews.Content: This apartment has a nice layout, nice furniture, nice kitchen and I stayed at Level 52 and got a very nice view. Likes : The apartment is very clean, location is great, close to shop, train station, Darling Harbour Dislikes: The reception, Nerie, she work efficient and not friendly to guest. Not like other 5 star hotels, the reception is very welcome. Stay in a hotel not just to relax but we need to feel we are welcome by the hotel. I called reception to complaint that the TV was not working, 1 hour already pass, no one come to fix and have a look, after 2 hours I called back then reception, then after that one guy came have a look the problem. 2 hours waiting was too long for 5 star accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Fanastic Hotel with a Great Location, Reception was rude and uncaring.”
Reviews.Author: dandemum
Reviews.Content: Checking into this hotel was a nightmare, the security gate to the car park would not open, after we buzzed for 5 minutes to Reception someone magically opened the gate. After parking and dragging our luggage, ourselves and our 2 tired children to Reception we waited for another 5 minutes for the Reception Staff to wrap up their private conversation before reluctantly Checking us into the hotel. Our apartment was spacious and very clean. The bedrooms were large and both bathrooms were spotless, very nice. The kitchen was functional, only there are no instructions on how to get the oven going. The sink tap had somehow become unstuck, a call to Reception seemed fruitless, we were told there is no maintenance person available on the weekends, how odd. We could not get the Balcony doors open, yet another call to Reception was no good, an abrupt Receptionist (maybe we interrupted yet another important social conversation) told us that the Balcony Doors were ALL locked because people were throwing things off them. All in all the apartment was fine, we felt the Receptionists were both rude and uncaring. We were glad we were rushed through Check Out. * We were not charge the $35 Per Day Car Parking Fee, it's been over 2 weeks since we went on our trip and there have been no extra charges to our Credit Card, yah!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Traveller3333
Reviews.Content: Excellent apartment in a prime location only 3 minutes walk from the train station. It is only 2 blocks from Chinatown. The apartments are fairly new, and the facilities top class. The bedroom and bathrooms are clean, and the air-conditioner unit cools the room instantaneously. Excellent value for money. Would stay there for all future Sydney trips! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need at the Meriton!”
Reviews.Author: chrissyy71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton on Kent St for 4 nights in November. We had a two bedroom apartment on the 31st floor. My husband and I were travelling with our 3 year old daughter and were apprehensive of the usual style of hotel rooms. The Meriton was the perfect solution for us. The two bedrooms were a good size and both had a king size bed. Lounge room was not overly large but was more than adequate and the dining facilities and kitchen were both excellent. The apartment also has two bathrooms which were both well appointed and one was particularly spacious with a huge tub. We arrived late on our first night carrying probably far too many luggage and 3 year old who had finally succumbed to sleep after a 5 hour flight. The staff on duty were not overly helpful and my husband ended up using their porters trolley to carry all our bags up to the apartmen himself, and then of course had to return it back down to reception straight away. This was the only bad experience of our stay. Every other time we approached the reception staff they were friendly and very helpful. We were even able to get a later check out just by asking! Another slight negative is that we found that the rooms were at times a bit noisey. Not to a point of it being a problem and I suspect it may have more to do with just the noise of a big city which we are certainly not used to. The location is fantastic being very close to Darling Harbour, China town, Chinese gardens and Pitt St Mall. The monorail is very close and makes getting anywhere a breeze. Lots of good places for breakfast and to eat and explore all very close by. All in all I would say the Meriton on Kent is an excellent place to stay, particularly if you are travelling with children. And for one last tip book on-line with the Meritons own website for the best deals!

Reviews.Title: “Studio apartment OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: artsyfarsty
Reviews.Content: We wanted a low budget Christmas getaway so we booked a studio apartment at Meriton Kent St. The prices at wotif were around $150 a night and we pretty much got what we paid for. The room was very compact and our view was of the back of a building. There was some construction going on and it was quite noisy. It was a clean room and the people at the front desk were friendly and courteous, but we are unlikely to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware! Nice balkonies but they are locked!”
Reviews.Author: sydney12345
Reviews.Content: Overall: Apartement very nice, clean and furnishings are very new but the pictures in tripadvisor may mislead a little bit since some pictures show a big balcony. The problem is: you can't go out and have a smoke on your beautiful balcony since the hotel management has closed all the balconies! Therefore the hotel is an absolute no-go for smoking persons... In my opinion they should clearly state it on their Internet site....

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic apartments.”
Reviews.Author: Rurid
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Meriton Kent Street Apartments just recently and were thoroughly impressed with the location, condition and facilities of the building. We arrived at around 3pm and were promptly checked in at the front desk by a young man around our own age, who was very efficent at the process but not overly welcoming or warm to us. However we didn't particularly mind and were very happy when he informed us that we would be staying on the 54th floor. After actually getting into our room, all I can say is wow. When we got in we realised we had been upgraded from a 1-bedroom apartment (which we had payed for) to a 2-bedroom apartment, which meant we had an extra bedroom and bathroom, plus a full walk-in kitchen and extra living space to really stretch out in! The room was wonderful; it was furnished with good-quality furniture (including marble tops to the dining table and side tables) a flat-screen tv with dvd player and a full kitchen with all the cooking facilities and dishes we needed. We also found the beds very comfortable. Some other reviewers have complained that they found the beds uncomfortable because they have a slight 'split' in the middle as they are actually two singles zipped together, but I didn't feel the split at all. On top of this, the view from our big balcony was just wonderful. We were facing Chinatown/Darling Harbour and the lights at night time were breathtaking. We could really only see part of Darling Harbour as we were facing the other way, but the view overall was just amazing to come home to. The overall noise of the city wasn't too bad as we were very high up, however I won't lie and say we couldn't hear anything at all. Some nights there were several sirens going off, and we definitely heard the recycling van tipping bottles into a truck in the early morning several times. However, the noise wasn't overwhelming and was only slightly annoying on Saturday night, when there was a lot of traffic and beeping along with the sirens. The location of the apartment was also great. There was a Coles supermarket across the road and a Woolworths a 10-minute walk away. Darling Harbour was only a 5-minute walk, along with other great sights like the Powerhouse Museum, the Aquarium and Wildlife World. Sydney Tower was a 10-15 minute walk away (and very easy to get to) and Circular Quay is still within comfortable walking distance, about a 30-minute walk at a moderate pace. We walked absolutely everywhere and didn't feel any need to catch public transport as we were in a prime position to access everything. However, if you wanted to, the monorail station is extremely close, as well as Town Hall railway station and local bus access. The apartments were touched up every day, which included straightening the bathrooms, replacing towels and amenities (toilet paper, shampoo/conditioner, dishwashing powder) and making the beds. There were times when we came home and the housekeeping team had even turned on the dishwasher for us or folded clothing, which was very nice of them. The only complaint we had about the housekeeping team is that once we forgot to leave the 'do not disturb' sign on the door before we went to bed and housekeeping let themself in at 9am on the dot, when we were still asleep in bed. We thought this was a little bit too early to be servicing rooms, particularly because a lot of guests are on holidays and could be sleeping in. Apart from that very small complaint, we had a great time in the Kent Street Apartments and would recommend them to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: lingamair
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Meriton Kent Street on 2 seperate occasions. Good location, just a stone throw's away from World Square and Darling Harbour while a slight walk to Chinatown. Both occasions were studio rooms which came with a king bed. Modern amenities with a washer/dryer and ironing facilities in each room. Shower on the 19th floor room was abit dodgy as the water pressure was a little low. Maintenance guy was rude and some cooking utensils need to be changed. Otherwise a fabulous stay, and at $99 a night, a steal!

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: DLR60
Reviews.Content: Was up in Sydney for a 4 day conference and stayed at the Meriton as it was located a nice 5 minute stroll from the venue at Darling Harbour. The room I was given was on one of the upper floors and the view from the room was spectacular. The room was a good size and clean with only problems I had were how to use the washer/dryer combo (easy when I located the instructions stuck on the wall), the complete lack of water pressure in the bathroom basin (shower was nice and strong though) and the noisy fridge (turned it off at night). Aside from that, the staff were polite and courteous and my overall stay was a very positive one.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love this place!”
Reviews.Author: LiffordKat
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise this hotel enough - from the extremely helpful staff to the well appointed rooms. The staff were always willing to help, provide directions or advice. On arrival, although we'd booked a single room apartment, we were upgraded to a two bed apartment. This being the last leg of a 3 week tour of Australia, the sheer luxury of finally having a room to myself was fantastic! The apartment itself was spacious, clean, quiet and, most important, comfortable. The views across Sydney were great and the sunsets amazing (admittedly, that's not down the hotel!). All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to just about anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: 123free
Reviews.Content: Fantastic property!! Modern, clean, spacious and very central to everything!! Great value for money - we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: suepnz
Reviews.Content: When booking I requested a room with a view over Darling Harbour and was vrey disappointed when, on arrival, we were allocated a room on level 22 which looked out at other buildings. I was told we could be given a north facing room on level 53 but not until Sunday. We accepted this offer. Our first apartment was lovely (except for the outlook) First night was very quiet, second night not so but a call to security had them up to the apartment next door and guests were told if there was another complaint they would be evicted. Partying and loud music ceased immediately. There are numerous notices advising guests that partying and noise are not permitted. Response was excellent.. On Sunday we duly checked out of our room and went off to see the sites. On return at 2pm we went up to level 53 and all I can say is wow. Amazing views, much bigger apartment just fabulous. All and all a great place to stay, handy to everything and walking distance to anything in the CBD. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: rallymomma
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 year old and I stayed in a one bedroom apartment at the Meriton Kent Street for 4 nights. It was a wonderful experience. The hotel is located in a great location. Easy walk to Darling Harbor, close to train stations, all types of food nearby. The room layout was spacious and very clean. The staff went above and beyond to help us out. We arrived at 6 am from the US after traveling for 24 hours and even though check in was not until 2 pm they arranged for us to have a large corner room on the 23rd floor by 10 am. When we discovered the room did not have any pots or pans they located some for us to use. We asked about the $100 cleaning deposit since other reviewers had mentioned it and they said as long as the dishes were clean it did not matter if we put them away before checking out. They said the deposit was primarily for those that came to party and left the apartment in a mess. Our only minor complaints would be that the coffee table was unstable, the tv tended to go from color to black and white and the kitchen had limited dishes. However whenever we brought a problem to the attention of the front desk they worked very hard to resolve it for us. I would highly recommend the Meriton Kent Street. It was a wonderful place to stay with a three year old and my husband (who travels monthly on business trips) made the comment that he wished all of the places he stayed were as comfortable and happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: chelle007
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a studio apartment for $165 a night. This is a great place to stay. The location is perfect, with cinemas, restaurants and shopping on your doorstep. It is very central. The studio apartment I stayed in was spacious and clean. Modern furnishings, with good size TV. Staff are pleasant. This place is great value for money. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Easy clean comfort”
Reviews.Author: amaunette
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Meriton on Kent Street in Sydney's CBD for every weekend for a month now for business. I have stayed in a studio apartment with a king bed and self contained facilities, including a washer/dryer and stove top. Having frequented a lot of Sydney hotels this year, I choose to stay at the Meriton every time I visit now. The hotel rooms are always clean, well laid out and comfortable. The location of the Kent Street hotel is very central to the CBD's main attractions and the reception staff are friendly and informative on places to visit. The rooms come equiped with foxtel and the self-contained kitchen has all the utensils you could need to really cook like you do in your own home. I would highly recommend this hotel for people who visit on business or are holidaying and would like to have the luxury of being able to cook in your unit and save some money on restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous studio room”
Reviews.Author: bubble24
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights in July-August 2008 by myself in a studio apartment and loved it. Very clean and new fittings, serviced daily. Great views of the city (i didnt see any water from my room though). I got a room with a balcony which was lovely for more space. I found it spacious and perfect for my purposes. Very convenient location, just off a main street. Great bed, full door mirrors, cd player, full kitchen facilities. I felt i could live there very comfortably for a fair while. Beautiful pool. I thoroughly enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Recommend to All”
Reviews.Author: AhuBucket
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a discount card website that we had bought (which saved us heaps off the rack rate). We stayed three nights,and really enjoyed our time at the Meriton. We travelled with our nine month old son, and were a little disappointed that they did not have a portacot available- but were able to make do.When we arrived and both beds were made up in king-bed configuration, a simple call to reception resulted in very prompt service from housekeeping to make up the second room in single configuration. The facilities were excellent- although not all rooms (my parents had another apartment at the same time) had the numbers of glasses/cutlery you would expect for their size. Also- no dessert/cereal bowls were provided (minor things really) The biggest problem over the weekend was the lifts with queues stretching back to the reception area at peak times. Sometimes there were only two out of a possible 6 lifts operating, which caused frustration amongst waiting guests. The mirror above the main bed was disturbing. We did not use any of the leisure facilities provided. Hotel was in an excellent location- 5 minutes to Darling Harbour, 20 minutes walk to Circular Quay. Wwe were on the 47th floor with glimpses of water and little noise to be heard. It was a shame we couldn't open the balcony door though. All in all, I would stay here again and would definitely recommend to others travelling to Sydney (especially if you can get it for a discounted rate like we did)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location from which to explore”
Reviews.Author: CapeTown78
Reviews.Content: I travelled by myself. Had immaculate studio, really high up with a fab view! Reception were very helpful when I turned up sans suitcase as a german lady had helped herself to my handluggage on the shuttle! Pool is tiny but very refreshing and when I was using it I was the only one! Nice facilities in your room, high specs and there is a supermarket close by. I was travelling for months so it was lovely to be able to cook my own food for a few days. I also had a lovely day trip to the blue mountains with breakfast at a wildlife park - for less than the money to climb the Sydney Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Location Plus”
Reviews.Author: timmye
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here over a weekend. Location is probably the biggest plus for this place. The studio apartment room we had was adequate. Actually the facilities such as fridge, washing machine and tv were all brand new and of good quality. I would maybe suggest getting at least a one bedroom apartment. The view was a bit bland, but we were on a lower level and facing the wrong way. Also the pool was ice cold while the spa was lukewarm. Place is right on the doorstep of a shopping arcade, Town Hall station and a really overpriced Vietnam restaurant (much cheaper elsewhere). Only a couple of blocks to Darling harbour and it is worth checking out the Chinese Gardens which are gorgeous. For the price (around 180 a night) there is probably better out there, but there is no reason why we wouldnt stay there again. The other Meritons on World Tower and Pitt Street might offer more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - If this is what you're after...”
Reviews.Author: backpaqer
Reviews.Content: First thing I have to say is that I was very impressed with this accomodation overall, it is clean, very very very clean! We had a 1 bedroom apartment and the layout was good and facilities superb. The pool, spa and gym had me running around town trying to find some gym gear and bathers (I had not brought my own). The staff on the front desk are super-efficient, we didn't have to linger longer than 5 minutes to have everything taken care of including return airport shuttle for our checkout and the room key in hand. At this point I have to admit, this is probably my first stay in a serviced apartment vs a hotel. This is a great cheaper option than many 5 star hotels in the area, but I did find myself missing those extra hotel benefits...the bathroom amenities are the usual bar of soap, shampoo, conditioner, bath gel, bubble bath...but we found we missed the few extra things hotels include like shower cap, cotton buds/balls. Small niggle - but we ended up making the run to the local chemist to get them. The other major difference is that this does tend to feel like a home away from home, or someone else's place. It doesn't have the romance of a hotel, there isn't the connection with the property or the people who work there. There's no inhouse restaurant, no central lounge area to swap travel stories with strangers (apart from the hot tub). At around the $250 we paid for the 1 bedroom apartment...for a mere $50 extra, gets us into The Intercontinental, the Westin, Marriott or a host of others which are more geared to the service aspect - anything you need etc...but that's just us. The location is convenient for many things; trains, monorail, buses, Chinatown, Central CBD, Capital Theatre (we were here to see Billy Elliot), Chinese Gardens, Paddy's Market, Darling Harbour...everything really. If you have kids and want to contain costs by cooking yourself, being able to do your own laundry. This place is great, it will do it. My one key piece of advice on this hotel is DO NOT accept a room that ends in the number 1 or 2 or maybe 3. These rooms face South/South Westish (towards Liverpool St). The noise from the monorail is there, although not too bad. You will find that on Friday and especially Saturday nights is that this part of Sydney does not sleep...nor will you! This was even more in evidence come 5am on Sunday morning. The tinkle of empty bottles being transfered from one bin into a bigger bin and then probably into a garbage recycling truck went on for 90 minutes!!! Either people drink a lot, or they'd been hoarding bottles for a while - sounded like we were next to a glass recycling facility! Maybe it's quieter if you can get up high near the 50th floor too...we were down on the 19th level which is only 4 or 5 floors above ground (street level is level 10). Oh...and they reckon the bed was king size...small king size...my feet hung off the end and I'm 6'2". My feet don't hang off the end of my king size bed at home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and facility”
Reviews.Author: klsmithmn
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in April. Service was quite good. We arrived 8am after overseas flight but friendly desk staff helped store baggage so we could explore. Rooms were spacious, location is within 2 blocks of subway and grocery store. Many restaurant choices nearby by. 10 minute walk to Darling Harbor and 25 minutes to Circular Quay if you like to walk. Area seemed very safe. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views from our unit”
Reviews.Author: asianbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 BR apartment for 5 nights from Apr 14 on the 53rd floor. The view from the balcony was simply fantastic especially when we first came in around 7PM and the city lights were on. We had the view of Darling Harbour. There was no need to go up to centerpoint to see the city. The unit was very spacious and modern. There was a plasma TV in the living room, kitchen was well equipped, washer and dryer was in a separate room next to the kitchen. The master bedroom was spacious with an equally spacious bathroom with separate bath and shower. The unit was cleaned everyday altho the guideline says it was just a touch up, the room was always neat and clean when we came back at the end of the day with all the amenities (laundry powder, dishwashing powder, shampoo etc) replenished. The unit had everything their website claimed to have. The elevators were fast, altho the service elevator was out of commission for most times. There were a lot of brochures for tour suggestions available at the lobby. I just found the front desk to be unusually high that you wouldn't immediately notice when coming in especially if the staff behind the desk were all seated. The internet charge was pretty expensive and it helped that there was an internet shop at the mini shopping mall at the ground floor. You can also find food options in this mini mall. This apartment is in a very good location, very near the Town Hall. There are a lot of shopping options, dining places, malls and the underground walk to the train station which you can find on the next corner. It is very close to grocery outlets like Woolsworth across the Town Hall or Coles Central on George which is just a block away. Paddys market and Chinatown is just a few blocks away. Overall, I will not hesitate to come back to this apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it should be”
Reviews.Author: Australian-Fan
Reviews.Content: Apartment booked in Sept 2007 as soon as bookings available and asked for views of the city. On arrival did not like being made to sign credit slip in case we wrecked room! What a cheek! We were given apartment 2106A, on 21st floor. This overlooked car parks, air conditioning units and skyscraper buildings. We complained to indifferent staff, who all claimed to be managers, and were told we had not asked for a view (!), but they would move us in a couple of days. The balcony doors were locked (for security reasons, we were told), but were unlocked upon request. Glass shower screen fell off when my husband had a shower; ironing board fell apart. After two nights in this inferior apartment, we were moved (or rather we moved ourselves!) to apartment 5502A on the 55th floor. What a difference - superb views, and a superior apartment. On the day we left asked if there would be a room to change and refreshen, as we had to be out of the apartment by 10am, spent much of the day touring in Sydney and had some hours to wait for the shuttle bus. We were told a room was available. This turned out to be a single toilet in the lobby - it didn't even have a towel, and there was barely room for one person and a suitcase !! Not very impressive, and a sad end to our stay. Staff and management at this apartment block need to go on a customer service course. If you must stay here, and want views of the city, insist on an apartment on the 40th floor or above.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic apartment in Sydney centre”
Reviews.Author: maxele99
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights at the beginning of April in a studio apartment on the 54th floor. The apartment was clean and nicely furnished. It had separate large living and sleeping areas, a well equipped kitchen with dishwasher and washing maching. We had a very big balcony with amazing views over Darling Harbour and the CBD. We were already in Sydney and booked directly at the reception so we were able to ask for an apartment on a high floor and the man we spoke to was really friendly and helpful. I would advise booking by contacting the booking line directly. We also got a really good rate of around Â£75 a night. The spa pool was a welcome bonus after walking around all day. I would highly recommend these apartments for short or long term stays in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Beware booking through outside providers”
Reviews.Author: Peggysue45
Reviews.Content: After giving these apartments 9 out of 10 back in October not so the one on our most recent in Feb. In Oct we booked through Meriton direct this recent stay we booked through an outside provider & what a difference that appears to make as we were allocated apt 1601 this is the first floor above the office floors & way around the back of the building with an outlook of a derilect old building beside us to airconditioning units in front for our dare I say "view" whose continious noise made opening the balcony doors undesirable especially when trying to talk on the phone etc. The "open" balcony & the outdoor table & chairs were used by the pidgeons that made their home in the old building next door Now while we cannot complain about the apartment itself as the same standards as on the 49th floor were set on the 16th & apart from a blown bedside light that we mentioned & was never replaced the inside of the apartment itself could not be faulted. Thank god we were only there on business & as such in & out but still would have been nice to come in from a days work to relax on a clean balcony with some sort of a decent view. I bet no overseas visitor would be given this room or a couple above that would afford the same "views" This unfortunately is not the first time we have experienced this type of treatment when not booking direct with the hotel. Also the checkin reception staff were not the friendly staff we encountered on our 1st stay maybe bcause it was 10.30pm & they had had a long day whereas in comparison though check out staff were most helpful & obliging. I have sent a letter of complaint on our issues & have received a "when you return we will look after you" hmmmm we will see should we ever wish to return

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: samoorai
Reviews.Content: Four adults and a child were going to Sydney for a wedding. My mom-in-law suggested a serviced apartment and I googled accordingly. Found 'M-Power Accommodation' that offered different types of hotels/apartments for different kind of budgets. Contacted M-Power via email and they were very quick with their replies. When asked, they were very helpful with recommendations too. So I went with their recommendation for Meriton Kent St Apartment Hotel after reading favourable reviews in Trip Advisor. We asked for and got a high floor. The 52nd to be exact, so we could hardly hear the noises (nothing more than a distant hum) from the street even though the roads that surround the hotel were pretty busy. Our apartment faces Darling Harbour, so that was nice. The two-bedroom apartment (with two baths) is well furnished and the small kitchen (they provide dish washing detergent coz dirty dishes incur some outrageous charge) met our needs well enough. It was also convenient to have a washer and a dryer in the apartment (there's laundry detergent, but not dryer sheets or fabric softener). Good-sized bathrooms, but only one has a tub. Parents-in-law extended their stay and I booked a studio apartment for them in the same hotel. They liked it well enough too, although if I had known earlier, I would have asked for an apartment that is NOT on the same floor (15th) as the swimming pool for them. Reason: MIL told me that the cholrine from the pool would greet them whenever they stepped out of the lift. The hotel is a little expensive, but you get what you paid for. The location is great; it's easy to walk from the hotel to 1. the major shopping areas, 2. Darling Harbour (has a great playground and a carousel that operates on weekends), 3. eating places, and 4. public transportation. My son liked the apartment so much, he called it 'our other home'. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Realtraveller69
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this 'hotel' for 3 nights early February. The location is very convenient, in the middle of the busy shopping area. Circular quay and Darling Harbour are an easy walk away. I have to agree with the comments below regarding the service at reception. Although I have no particular complaint, the staff there was not the friendliest . The 1-bedroom apartment was very spacious for the two of us, we had everything we needed for our short stay. The furniture is as nice as it can be, not great quality, but I think this place is fairly new, so it still looks good. I was quite amused by the abundance of 'signs' about what you can and can't do in the apartment. (Although later on I found this a bit of a routine at other hotels in Australia as well.) Having just arrived after a very long haul flight, the first night was comfortable. However, for the rest of the time, the noise level from the street became very disturbing. I did read previous reviews about this, but since I have lived in cities all my life, I am very used to traffic noise etc. therefore I didn't think this would be an issue. Unfortunately ambulances, fire engines, police were passing through many times during the night. It also seemed that most of the street musicians picked this corner and all the party crowd hung around this area, making it almost impossible to sleep. For this reason I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Management needs customer service training”
Reviews.Author: SherlockTexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in a lovely apt. on the 42nd floor. However, after checking in we discovered that the airconditioning was not working and called the front desk. They said they would send someone up right away and we waited an hour and a half exhausted from our trip and just wanting to sleep so we called again. A maintanance man showed up and found that the compressor had been turned off so we finally did get some air even though it is confusing how to turn the units on. I had also asked the desk clerk earlier if they had anything I could use to make my American hair appliances to work with their outlets. He explained that they did not have anything but I could buy something for about $5 at the convenience store around the corner and told me how to get there. We returned with the unit and even showed it to him to make sure it would work and he replied "Yes". The next morning I used my $100+ professional flat iron and it burned out after several seconds! I mentioned this to the front desk on my way back to the room that day and the clerk asked to see the appliance as he thought I should be compensated something for my loss. Luckily,he followed me to my room as my key did not work when we got there and he told me he would speak to his manager about the appliance. After another call to the desk as the airconditioning did not work AGAIN, this time due to a tripped switch, the desk clerk informed me that his manager did not feel they were responsible for my loss. She said that since "they did not buy the adapter and we did" , it was not their problem even though the clerk "approved" it! The large rooms and the view can not make up for faulty airconditioning, bad room keys and management's poor attitude so I honestly can not recommend this hotel to other travellers at this time.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location and holiday”
Reviews.Author: MandyMelb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton Kent Street for 7 nights in early December 07. We had a one bedroom aparrtment on the 38th floor. While we were high enough to see some of darling harbour through the buildings (a lovely strip of blue with white sailboats on it), it would have been great to have been higher. I would NOT have wanted to be on a lower floor as even on the 38th floor we could hear music from the street, car horns etc. The apartments are lovely and I was genuinely surprised at the standard of the cleaning service. The daily "touch up" service is much more than that. They cleaned the bathroom, did our dishes, replaced linen and made the bed, amongst other things. To me, that was a full cleaning service - not a touch up. A nice surprise. The location of the apartment is fabulous. 5 minute walk to Darling Harbour where you can hop on a ferry to almost anywhere, 2 minute walk to the train or monorail. It is also right next to chinatown as well as many spanish restaurants for dinner or across the road from a supermarket and shopping centre (World Tower) so you can easily get food to cook for yourself. There were a couple of issues with maintenance of the apartment - which has been noted by other reviewers. Our bathroom door didnt close proprerly, the clothes dryer didnt get hot and the fan in the bathroom didnt work. However, I didnt report these issues to reception as they didnt really impact my stay so I cant complain too much (we only tried to use the dryer once and we just showered with the bathroom door open anyway). They may have fixed it while I was there if I had told them. I did complain about music once and security came right away, so that is good. We used the pool and sauna every day and loved having those facilities. The elevators were slow but we werent in any rush on holidays. Overall - a good stay, great location and good facilities.

Reviews.Title: “check your credit card statement”
Reviews.Author: gip
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful stay. Loved view and pool. Just wanted others to know we were charged $375 to much when I got my credit card statement!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: TCGGrafton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Meriton Kent Street for 4 days in a two bedroom apartment, on our way from Sydney to New Zealand. Seems like most others we found the lifts a little slow at times but overall we had a great stay and found the receptionist very friendly and helpful. We forgot to pack some medication and the reception staff were very helpful in putting us in contact with a doctor. And we were very greatful that we could store our lugagge and go shopping on our last day. The apartments we found were clean and had everything we needed. Loved having a washing machine and dryer - much better than a hotel!! We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous apartment but some downsides and floor 45 is only 35 above the street”
Reviews.Author: SwedishCath
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights in a one bedroom apartment at the end of January. I booked direct with the Meriton on their website and paid the $194 per night x 8 nights up front. At the time of booking I requested a high floor. We arrived at just before 1pm and an efficient but "superior" receptionist told us that we could have a room on floor 20 immediately or the planned room on floor 45 at 2pm. We decided to wait. A note about reception, the desk is about 1.4m high and the staff on the other side are all seated. This makes it uncomfortable for someone short like me to fill out papers and deal with the staff. With the exception of the guy who checked us out all the recpeption staff were efficient but cold. So when we got our room we were impressed. A large corner apartment with a nice sized bedroom and a well planned living/kitchen area. Nice touches in the layout were the facts that the bathroom and laundry were located at the end of the hallway by the front door to cause minimum disturbance to the bedroom and living room area. The balcony was huge with a fabulous view of Darling harbour and even the airport in the distance. Cool to watch the 747's landing. Unfortunately some of the details let the apartment down. All the knives were ridiculously blunt, despite getting someone up to show us how to work the oven we couldn't get it above 70 degrees, the handtowel rail fell off every day, one day the handle to the laundry came off in my hand. (This was fixed at no penalty charge to us by the time we returned the next day). Internet is available in the room but was very expensive. Reception did provide a cable to us free of charge with no bond. The room was well serviced daily but late in the afternoon which was a pain if you were back and wanted to relax. The lifts were mostly ok, queues formed in the lobby on a couple of occasions but mainly because only 5 people would get in a lift with room for 15. One lift was out of order for the whole 8 days we were there. The pool and jacuzzi were nice but I was put off when the hygiene guy took samples and then returned with a large sack of chemicals. The sauna did not work. Did not try the gym. Our keycards worked without a problem for the whole 8 days. In a previous hotel my keycard had to be repeatedly reprogrammed because it would not work, until we discovered that having it in my bag next to my mobile phone demagnitised it. One last thing you might consider is that if like us you get a room on the 45th floor you will discover that you are only on floor 35 above street level because the lobby and street access are on level 10!!!!! This means that level 20 is really rather low and therefore it is not surprising that it would be noisy from the street. At level 45 (35) we could hear traffic and sirens but no partying.

Reviews.Title: “Can do better”
Reviews.Author: pirate-allie
Reviews.Content: Previously we have stayed in the Radisson Plaza and the Westin but decided to try a serviced apartment instead. We won't be back as I didn't think it was very good value for the service we got. It was $218/night on wotif. I have to say, it was a HUGE corner apartment but it was incredibly noisy being on the 20th floor. Luckily the aircon drowned out much of the street party noise so it wasn't disastrous but obviously they don't have the soundproofing of other places. The location, overlooking George St is likely to result in plenty of noise compared to other locations perhaps. Yes it has free foxtel but a lot of the channels had dodgy sound and were in b/w. This wasn't really a problem as we hadn't come to Sydney to watch tv all day. I agree with someone else's comments about the lifts. Again, one was out of order and there were insufficient lifts to service the amount of users. The kitchen was well-equipped but there were draconian messages about having to ensure washing up was all done which I found surprising in a serviced apartment (my previous experience eg Medina Grand in Melbourne is that washing up is done every day - not that I expect this) especially when a lot of the cutlery/dishes weren't clean to start with! The bathroom was fine but starting to look a bit tired. It is good to have a laundry for longer stays. The pool was a good size although disappointing that no towels were provided. The gym looked good in principle but the gym station had sticky cables, the swiss balls were almost flat and there were only 2 treadmills and no signs by the management asking people to limit their time on the machines. It was busy which was not helped by a guy who spent 1.5hours on one of the treadmills. This was clearly not the hotel's fault but given the plethora of notices telling guests what to do elsewhere, I was surprised there was no notice in the gym asking for consideration (my experience shows that this is standard in most gyms because clearly people can't be considerate without being told to be!). I think the gym was ok but not if you want a serious work out. It wasn't as good as other gyms I have been to either in Melbourne or Sydney. Depends on what's important I guess as to whether this is an issue. One good thing is that the water machine was empty and reception actioned this when we mentioned it. Another positive is that they have left luggage and allow use of the pool/gym/showers if you have a late flight. OVERALL, I thought it was in a good location, the apartment was the biggest I have ever stayed in but the rules (eg $100 fee for lost room keys seems extortionate and I personally dislike hotels who insist on actually processing a deposit from your credit card rather than having it as security), the noise and the slightly-off facilities mean that we won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “The just don't care”
Reviews.Author: Steve147
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a studio apartment for two weeks over Christmas and New Year, and have to say much the same as some other reviewers. I'll start with the good .... - location is excellent, a block from Town Hall Station, five minute walk from Darling Harbour, plenty of convenience stores nearby that are open late - check-in: we arrived in Sydney at 9am, officially their check-in time is 2pm, but they had our room ready for 12:30. They didn't have to do this, and I appreciate the effort they made. - complimentary Foxtel TV - in-room CD and DVD players - modern, clean, the kind of place you should really enjoy spending time in Now, in no particular order, the bad .... - both of our room key-cards had to be re-programmed by reception every two or three days. So frustrating, and unnecessary, these should easily be able to retain all the information on them for two weeks. If they can't then there's something wrong with the cards, so stop re-issuing them. Throw them away and get some new ones that work. - apartment floors are served by five elevators, one of which was permanently out of order. I can accept that Christmas isn't the best time to get a repair company out, but they charge the earth for rooms around New Years Eve and the place was full so it's not like they couldn't afford it. But they would rather deny guests 20% of the elevator capacity at the busiest time of year. - I have to agree with what somebody else said, they have a whole load of daft rules, and if you break any of them you're fined a hundred dollars! Like if you lose your room key (which is just a plastic key-card, which costs pennies to replace) it's not worth a $100 fine - sometimes people lose things, it's not malicious, it's just human nature. And are they also saying that if you're unlucky enough to have your wallet or purse stolen and your key is in it, then Meriton Towers are going to take another hundred dollars from you as well? Come on! - another rule, which was on posters all over the place reminding their guests was a "no parties, no loud noise" rule, the penalty for which was immediate eviction and no refund. Which seemed a bit harsh, but if that's the rules then that's the rules (though we weren't going to have a party anyway). Except that when I complained to reception about neighbours having a party in their room (and I didnâ€™t want them evicted, just given a warning) I was told that there was nothing they could do as "theirs is a residential apartment". So Meriton Towers set the expectation that they have a zero-tolerance policy towards in-room parties, only for them to turn round and say that this applies to me, but that my neighbours could do whatever they liked! Unacceptable. - folder with details of all their draconian fines also had "helpful" details about how to operate the oven, dishwasher, etc. Except that the person who wrote it obviously didn't try to follow his own instructions, as the ones that were allegedly for our dishwasher bore no relation to what we actually had to do. OK, figuring out a dishwasher isn't rocket science, but it just shows a lack of thought towards the guests. - you need to be a giant to reach into the kitchen cupboards. I'm 6 foot (1.83m) tall and I was standing on tip-toes and barely getting my fingertips to the shelves. No doubt if I had caused a plate or cup to smash because of this, they would have fined me a hundred dollars! - two people are staying in a room for two weeks, so give them a wardrobe with three coat-hangers in it. Ridiculous. It's not even like some had been pinched by previous guests, as these were the unstealable ones where the metal ring bit is on the pole (and can't be removed). It's not right that one of the first things we had to do is go out and buy coat-hangers. - you've been out all day, you get back at about 4:30 or 5pm, go for a shower, pad about the apartment wearing not-a-lot, and generally relax and unwind. You don't want a knock at the door and have housekeeping come in to make your bed and vacuum the carpet and mop the floor, all with you watching them. Theyâ€™ve had all day, why wait till after 5pm? This wasn't an isolated incident, it happened again and again and again. You'll notice that none of these things would cost a lot to fix. Which is the frustrating thing - these are first-class apartments and I enjoyed the time I spent in them. But there are just too many little niggling problems that, when looked at together, leave me with the impression that there's no real care or consideration for their guests. And for that reason I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: rubydogUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 1 bedroom apartment on 36th floor with good views over harbour area.Excellent kitchen area with high spec appliances, dishwasher etc Apartment was cleaned daily and left spotless every day Only thing I did not like was the bond that was held on my visa card for a week, would recommend to anyone visiting Sydney as the location was excellent 10minutes walk to Darling Harbour with ferry access to all other areas It is worth paying a bit more for a 1 bedroom apartment rather than a studio

Reviews.Title: “couldn't complain”
Reviews.Author: panwestern
Reviews.Content: This place was great, remember it's a service hotel and you will be pleased. Clean, New, Bright, Good security, elevators were not bad. Pool was on the cool side, but had it's charm for my daughter. The real deal is in the price, location and newness. Great bars around and lots of food choices. We had 3 rooms which included a mix of all available options and all were a bargain in relation to full service hotels. I would not hesitate recommending this hotel to everyone. P.S dont get locked out on the patio, it locks behind you.

Reviews.Title: “A Well Serviced Apartment”
Reviews.Author: wombat23
Reviews.Content: I was nervous heading for Sydney due to the only problem we had with the Meriton on Kent: they never confirmed our booking. I made a query via email teo months in advance and then booked the same way, but never got a reply after sending credit card details. I wrote three times, without answer and called once. On the phone, I was assured we had the booking, but still never received the verbally promised email. They were, apparently, expecting us when we arrived. Our apartment was terrific. Miles above expectation for a city like Sydney. We've stayed in more expensive shoeboxes in Paris, London, and NYC; this apartment was paradise compared to what one might expect in those cities, and Sydney bests themas a family travel destination. Two large bedrooms, one king, one with 2 doubles for our 2 boys, each with a large en suite bath, a full kitchen with modern appliances, a separate laundry room, 36" LCD TV in the living room, lovely appointments all around with nice furniture and so on. The place was wonderful. We could live in such an apartment as a family. Our room (4301) looked out over Darling Harbour from 43 stories up. The location was splendid for our purposes. We also enjoyed the pool and hot tub. I am a scientist and a critical person, but this hotel was superb for our booking rate (about $230 AU). And what is a 'serviced apartment' anyway -- people replaced linens and made beds daily, and even loaded and ran the dishwasher one day. As far as I can tell, all you lose is room service food. In Sydney, with dozens of 24h delivering restaurants and proximity to Chinatown, &c., this is no compromise. The place is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Superb central apartment”
Reviews.Author: tourithst
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the Meriton on Kent St. This is an apartment hotel so don't expect hotel style service, but the trade off is worth it. Brand new room was enourmous ( full one bedroom apartment ) with full kitchen, bathroom, laundry and lounge and good sized balcony. If you are staying for a week i would recommend an apartment like this as its a lot bigger than a hotel room. Booked this on lastminute.com, and the price was extremely good value. Admittedly we were lucky and got a corner room, the side rooms might be a little smaller? If you're looking for somewhere clean and modern with neutral decor right in the city ( metres from the centre of george street ) then this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: bretto
Reviews.Content: Great position and handy to tourist attractions, monorail and one block from the George Street shopping precinct. There are cafes and restaurants in front of the entrance for meals and a supermarket 1 block away for supplies. The apartments are large, very well appointed, new and clean. Most have balconies. I stayed on floor 20 but would recommend asking for the highest floor possible. Lifts are fast and the higher you go, the better the view and the less street noise you get. Check in and out was quick, friendly and efficient. The only issues I had were with the late checkout policy and paying for broadband internet . Checkout at 11 instead of 10 (wow, one hour!) is free, then AUD 50 per hour, and payment for a full night is required for checkout after 1pm. Most places will let you stay free at least until noon (obviously according to availability). I also think that places that charge over $100 per night should offer free broadband internet, as many places are now doing. Here it cost minimum AUD 18, adding over 10% to the cost of the room!

Reviews.Title: “new but needs work”
Reviews.Author: haconstruct
Reviews.Content: Just back from this hotel at New Years. Room was on 15th floor, so was with the pool, sauna and gym. Hotel appeared to be brand new, and the room needed to have a final cleaning and punch list done. Kitchen was nice feature, but while the outfitting probably looked good on paper, what you get is not what you need, They have both coffe mugs and tea cups, but no cereal bowls, for example. Having a washer/dryer in unit was GREAT. Having only 8 inches between bed and door to bath was HORRID. Also, found the front desk staff to b rude and very UNINFORMED. Would I stay here again? For AUD92, I would, only as it seemed a bargain and location not bad (except that it is over a couple of pubs that tend to be extremely loud all night - and that means until 5:00 am on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: b416
Reviews.Content: These are actually serviced apartments - I was staying in a 2 bedroom suite, which was great value, very clean, very modern, and had alot of amenities: dishwasher, laundry en suite, 2 bathrooms, reliable Internet, balcony. I would MORE THAN RECOMMEND this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings about Meriton Kent.”
Reviews.Author: audreyu8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in total on 2 separate occasions within the week. I have to say that I wasn't very impressed with check-in staff except for Phillip who was really accommodating and always ready with a smile. We stayed in a studio both times with non-impressive views. On our 2nd stay, there was a nice, huge balcony though. Apartment decor was great. Bed was comfortable and bathroom was awesome. Laundry facilities was alright with the dryer acting up every now and them. Unfortunately, on our last night, the dryer completely stopped working with only cold air. We called front desk and was told that no one is available to assist except for the night guard, who of course, couldn't help us with our situation. The curtains in the room are somewhat flimsy and see-through. So, if you are a light sleeper and late riser, beware of being woken up by the sun. Also, there apparently is a file on hotel policies which include a AUD$100 fine should you leave dirty dishes upon check-out. We weren't told about this during check-in and it was only because I happened to flip through the file that I found this out. If not, I'm sure there have been others who have been charged without knowing this penalty. All in all, Meriton Kent was comfortable and location was awesome with attractions that are of walking distance. But with the price that we paid - AUD$188/ night and service that was mediocre, i highly doubt that we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the apartment and views”
Reviews.Author: nzweekender
Reviews.Content: Wonderful view from our room on level 43. Stayed two nights, excellent spacious 2 bedroom apartment, good facilities and very clean. Close to everything - Darling Harbour, shopping QVB, Pitt St etc all within short walking distance. Shops, supermarket, food outlets all in same block as hotel. We got great rate on wotif for room. Only minor thing was the staff at reception, not very helpful at check-in or check-out eg: told us to come back for room at specific time but still wasn't ready, no apology or revised time offered without being questioned, similar experience at check-out time. Didn't like the way they take a hold on your credit card and don't release it for 7 days even if no charges are made to the room. All of the staff and their practices aside the apartments are fabulous and well worth staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & place to stay”
Reviews.Author: austravelAustralia
Reviews.Content: I had a short stay at the Meriton Kent St in November 2007 after moving from another hotel. I stayed in a studio apartment, and although it wasn't huge, it was certainly big enough for 2 people. The room included a kitchenette with full sized fridge which was handy, a bathroom with separate laundry facilities, king size bed, tv, and opening windows. The room was light and airy, and very clean. The hotel is centrally located, making it easy to get around Sydney. I would recommend this location to anyone looking for great value and clean accomodation in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “I must be the only one....”
Reviews.Author: Munford
Reviews.Content: I feel awkward writing this because everyone else has had such a great time at the Meriton on Kent. We stayed just recently and had a bad time. I had emailed and asked for an early check in (if possible) but when I asked about this upon checking in the staff member said "I doubt that!" as if I was just being annoying. During our 4 day stay 2-3 lifts were out of service the whole time meaning lengthy waits to get up and down to our room. The apartment had a terrible smell (when we arrived a cleaner was spraying air freshener into the rug) so we left the ranchslider open the whole time. Several items in our kitchen were broken or still dirty, our soaps etc were not replenished the whole time we were there. Plus they haven't taken the $100 bond hold off my credit card yet either! I just felt so disappointed with this place! I have stayed in several places in Sydney and this would be the worst for me. The plus side is that the location is fantastic. Easy walking distance to the Monorail, Entertainment Centre and Darling Harbour. I did fill out a guest satisfaction review to give to the staff at the Meriton but when I checked out the same staff member who checked me in was on the desk and I didn't feel comfortable giving it to him. I do intend to post it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience!”
Reviews.Author: hemikiwi
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 night in a studio apartment booked through wotif.com. I got a great deal, only 99 dollars and I was very happy indeed to get such a good place in Sydney for that price! Pity I couldnt extend for the same price...they wanted 265 dollars per night which i was not prepared to pay. The apartments are located near town hall station, just off George Street, which is direct from the airport and relatively easy to find, once you exit the station. Reception wery very nice indeed, friendly, jokey but at all times professional. I only had a studio apartment on the 24th floor. I had requested a quiet room and that is what i got. I could hear people from the lobby, but not at all once in my studio apartment. The apartment was very clean indeed, which is just what i like. It was bigger than a hotel room and had a kitchenette , microwave and i think even some kind of oven. All the utensils looked decent too. The bed was very comfortable and TV worked fine with many channels. The bbathroom was very clean, with a nice shower and lots of fluffy white towels. there is also a washing machine and dryer for those who may be travelling or staying longer. I did not wait long at all for a lift at any time and I was popping in and out quite a lot. Overall a very good experience and i would have stayed longer if i could have had the original rate. I decided to move to the Marriot opposite Hyde Park instead as I got a great deal including an upgrade and breakfast for less than what the Meriton Kent St wanted for any additional night. So I got a bargain at the Meriton Kent Street apartments and enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and very new”
Reviews.Author: seeksadvice
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Meriton Kent Street for 12 days in late September - in a one-room apartment. Check-in was quick and fuss-free. I didn't understand what front-desk meant when the guy said I've got to open 2 doors to get to my apartment. I didn't think much of it....assuming it must be a private lift access type or something like that. But what it really was....the first door I opened led me to a 1.2m by 1.2m area - big enough for standing room only. I was then confronted by 2 different apartments A & B. Whereupon, you've got to use the key a second time to open the next door. That's fine....except when I was heaving luggage (for 2 full weeks) through 2 separate doors. Plus I was also paranoid that I could be ambushed by some nasty neighbours if they find out I'm living all alone by myself. The interior is very spacious and everything's spanking new. I must be no more than the 3rd person to use the cooking utensils and oven. So clean and shiny. Once I saw the kitchen, I couldn't resist but rush down to Coles (the big supermarket just diagonally across the street - at the basement of another Meriton apartment - Meriton World Tower). The supermarket tops what's already a very central location. The fresh produce and the range is fantastic at this particular Coles. There are also wine shops, internet cafes, restaurants and pharmacies in World Tower. Despite saying in the brochure they only do touch-ups for longer stays, i found my beds made everyday & towels replaced everyday. I have a double-bed and the living room has a foldable sofa-bed so i'm already entertaining thots of brining my family the next time I'm there. Food's aplenty - as it is near Chinatown - so food's available till late in the evenings. Fastfood, Chinese, Italian, Japanese, korean etc. And the famous Tetsuya's is apparently just across a little street (if you have money to spare). In the same building, there's a vietnamese place, a chinese eatery and a Japanese fastfood. But it's never nec to eat in the building 'cos you are surrounded by eating options. Possibly 'cos it's so central & high human traffic, it's a little noisy at night. Friday and Saturdays - sounds of smashing bottles and drunkards yelling. Other nights - I've heard ambulance/fire engine sirens at least on 2 consecutive nights. Transport - I take the train most of the time. So it's a 10 minute stroll to Town Hall station (the leisurely type of stroll). On the weekend, I even walked 30 mins to Circular Quay and the Rocks. Darling Harbour is about 15 mins away. The streets in Sydney are really very easy to navigate 'cos George Street, Pitt Street, Kent Street etc all run either parallel or perpendicular. Oh, to get to the fish market (more cooking!), take a monorail from one end of Chinatown outside Paddy's market. And ofcourse Paddy's market itself is full of fresh produce over the weekend. Wait for lifts can be more than 3 minutes long as there's always 2 out of 5 lifts not working. Very multinational clientele there - Australians, Americans, Asians etc. Gym and pool are basic but that's ok with me - nicer gyms usually not-so-nice price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: aus_isis
Reviews.Content: I was in Sydney for 5 days with work. These are apartment style accomadation as as such, not much at front desk, but the rooms and clean fresh and look new. Good beds and while parking is a bit expensive, there are plenty of spots and easy access. Some noice from the streets below, however if you are ona higher floor, then this would probably be less. I also booked direct on the web site as someone else had suggested, which was cheaper than wotif etc I will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pygmyt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a studio apt at meriton kent st ( becoz of good reviews on this site) earlier this month and we both loved the hotel. We had requested an early check in and a room with a bath on a high floor. I had very little expectation of all the requests being catered for but, guess what, we had a room, with a bath, on a high floor AND they checked us in the moment we arrived at 10am (thanks to Junior at the front desk!). Our room was clean. comfortable and we had everything we needed for our 3-day stay. The washing machine tripped up a couple of times, but nothing a few pressing of random buttons couldn't solve. The view was spectacular and the location awesome - we walked to all the tourist sites! We would definitely definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5* but good!”
Reviews.Author: molins
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Meriton in July to start off our round the world trip. We were on a budget but also wanted home comforts. I consulted tripadvisor for many of our hotel reservations which we booked independently. We paid AUD149. 00 per night for a studio and had a great 5 nights stay. However, on arrival when we decided to take a siesta Â¨jet lag" we discovered the apartment hadnÂ´t been cleaned. The sheets and pillow cases were not clean, there were hairs all over the floor and even toe nails!! I was not impressed to say the least. I immediatley called recepetion and the house cleaner came with four other staff members to inspect the room (it was shocking how dirty it was) The studio is new and very well equiped, for the money its very good value. But its clearly not 5*. The apartment was cleaned and the house keeper apologised. We did go down to the pool once but the water was cold, the jacuzzi was dirty (brown foam) and there are no lockers or changing room facilites. We loved the location and travelled around easily with the metro. The reception staff were helpful and booked us a "boutique wine tour" it was ok but nothing special the guide was a little informal and the only thing boutique is perhaps the van which is a mercades. I would recommend the apartments but donÂ´t expect 5*.

Reviews.Title: “it's not really a hotel”
Reviews.Author: WernMachine
Reviews.Content: The Meriton Kent street is excellent, that's true. For the price of a regular Sydney Hotel you get an apartment with a fully equipped kitchen.. if indeed that is what you are looking for. My wife and I stayed at the Meriton Kent street and travelers should be warned that it is not a hotel and so does not (in any self-contained form) have a restaurant nor as a consequence can it include breakfast. This probably does not matter much because there are plenty of restaurants in the vicinity.
