Still, it is more like staying in a serviced apartment and this can take the edge off a romantic interlude but you get the feeling you are doing things a bit on the cheap, as are they, because there is not full-service as in a regular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Furnished Apartments”
Reviews.Author: kkeating
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Meriton on Kent Street in March of 2007, while they were still under construction. Despite the work, we found our one-bedroom apartment in great condition - we were actually the first ones to stay in it! The staff were very nice, providing us with a few extra things we asked for that were missing from the apartment (cereal bowls and etc.). The location is great, and the view from the upper floors over Darling Harbour are fabulous. Our apartment had a separate bedroom, a living room and dining room area, a covered balcony with a table and chairs, an open kitchen, a bathroom with a shower/tub combo and a washer and dryer. The kitchen was fully furnished with an oven, microwave, refridgerator and dishwasher, so we were able to have breakfast there every morning and make a dinner there too. The king size bed was very comfortable, and the flat screen tv and dvd player in the living room were great to have. Since the apartment had just been finished, all the rooms and furnishings were very clean. We were very happy to spend a week there, and we could have easily and comfortably stayed for much longer. We chose the Kent St. property because of its low construction period rates - I expect it will become much more expensive once construction is complete. Still, if it suits your budget, I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “perfect apartment”
Reviews.Author: fussymum
Reviews.Content: After looking at wotif rates as guide for prices I tried Meriton online booking and got a better price than on offer elsewhere....I had to pay the total cost upfront, but that didn't bother me and I didn't see it get an cheaper on wotif /needitnow....after I booked. We paid $229 per night for our 4 nights. we were staying over the weekend, Fridays and Saturdays can attract higher rates. Now as for the two bedroom apartment it was just like the website showed....very modern and new. Check in was a breeze...especially since my guest arrived hours before me and I had paid the account....a phone call DIRECT to Kent st staff made them aware my guest would be arriving before me....so no hassle for him when he turned up. We were on the 23rd floor and while we had a view of other buildings....it was fine. I am not a fan of king beds made up from two king singles...and I just kept generally to my side of the bed....they were a little too firm compared to what I'm use to...but not totally uncomfortable. The only night the city noise bothered me was on Sat night....I could here a lot of horns and the odd yelling....but it didn't last forever.....but it did reach our level. Other than those small issues....I really enjoyed all they had to offer. Cleaning staff were very thorough. ..bathrooms were a good size.....bath was lovely and big.....needed it after walking all day. There are plenty of places to eat nearby and all transport is close. Nigel my friend said the pool and spa were great....and he used them most days. The lifts were quick and we didn't wait long at all. I will use Meriton again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ilovethebeach86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend away with 2 friends. We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment. A few things of notice and point. Check in was fine. However our room wasnt ready however they quickly found us a room on a high level. It was slightly rude that they demanded a $500 deposit and FULL payment before we checked in. The lack of trust did not go down well. However: The apartments are of outstanding quality. Very new and very fresh. This may be due to the property's strick rules with regards to guests and smoking. They are very large with a huge balcony. The master bedroom is quite large with a mirror above the bed that was very entertaining. Location was fantastic and pool (althogh not used) was avail However is indoor which isnt my thing. Downs were: the pathetic bond, payment and demand for a $100 replacement fee for our lost plastic key card... i know for a fact they cost $5. The daily touch up is really nothing... they didnt even replace all towels...lifts take a while I would return here for sure. Location is fantstic. Value is best in sydney, Meriton really has something good going on....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Holiday!!”
Reviews.Author: Loft_V
Reviews.Content: We booked off Wotif.com and got an awesome deal. $885 AUD for 5 nights. We had a one bedroom on the 53rd floor. WOW what amazing views. Could even see out to the Sydney airport. Location is also excellent, everything close by. Lifts were a bit slow, but considering it being the Queens birthday weekend we werent surprised as there was a lot of people staying. Staff were fantastic, room was excellent. Would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Meriton on Kent,”
Reviews.Author: whitigirl
Reviews.Content: We were in Sydney for two conferences and staying for a week, we were most impressed with the Meriton on Kent, the staff were fantastic, we flew in at 8.30am and they had a room ready for us when we arrived. We stayed in a studio and a one bedroom, the hotel was quite booked up so we had to change rooms midstay however the staff made it so easy, we were given a late checkout and when they finished cleaning the room we were going into, they rang us and we were able to move to the apartment next door. We were travelling with our clients and they stayed in the Meriton also, and had the same service. There are plenty of eating places around the Meriton, our fave was the spanish place on Liverpool. Some of the places are dodgy but you can tell from the outside. Really close to everything. We were on the 54th floor and the views were incredible. I was expecting the wait for the lifts to be horrendous per other reviews but they were only long waits at 10am (check out time)

Reviews.Title: “superb! free foxtel!”
Reviews.Author: biccy
Reviews.Content: Hi all, my boyfriend and I stayed at this 5-star hotel for 2 nights in a studio apartment for AU$99pn!! -- a deal too good to be true!!! It's in an excellent location, near Town Hall train station, Chinatown, the monorail and tram. Our 22nd floor room was SUPERB - spacious and fantastically furnished. Marble kitchen with stainless steel appliances. Massive bathroom with internal laundry. FREE FOXTEL! plus a mini-hifi and dvd-player. If only it had an ensuite spa... Sleeping was a breeze. The large windows were thick enough for you to sleep like a baby... You could even open the windows, breathe in some fresh air, listen to the hectic traffic on George St.. The negatives? bad coffee, and bad shampoo hehe.. the reception staff were very rude and grumpy towards us when we tried to check-in at 10:30am instead of 2pm. Oh! and the hotel has really strict rules.. eg.. be quiet or be evicted. wash dishes or pay $100 hehe In summary.. I wish I could live here.... lying in bed watching free foxtel all day and all night... with my own coffee and shampoo of course.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected.”
Reviews.Author: James45ChCh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Meriton Kent Street Sydney for 4 days. Arrived in Sydney very early and couldn't get into the room until 2pm but the staff at reception were great and made a bathroom accessible and also stored the luggage. I had requested a high floor when booking. Ofcourse, there is no guarantee, but as luck would have it I scored the 46th floor. On opening the door to the apartment, I was struck by the simple but up to date decor and then .......... the view. Wow. A huge balcony that overlooked Darling Harbour. It was amazing. The apartment was a one bedroom. Amazingly comfortable bed. Not sure about the mirror on the ceiling??? Definietly not a request. The kitchen was great, well equipped and the lounge area was more than comfortable with a flat tv screen, cd player, table chairs, couch etc. The style was minimal but modern and more than I had expected. Loved it loved it loved it. Didn't use the pool or gym area but checked it out and it looked great. The location is great also and surprisingly I didn't hear any traffic noise at night. It is within easy walking distance to almost everything - darling harbour, oxford street, queen victoria building, and a great stroll down to the rocks and circular quay (approx 25 minutes walk). I would highly reccommend this apartment and will be staying there again on my return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: ladychippy
Reviews.Content: My Mother and myself booked a a secret Meriton Hotel with Lastminute.com for 2 nights. The first night we were booked into Meriton Kent street in a Studio apartment. Due to the studio aprtments being booked out for the second night of our stay we had to make a separate booking and ended up staying in the other Meriton hotel on Pitt Street. When we arrived at Kent street we were given a room on the 51st floor. Our first impressions of the room were great, good quality furniture, Amazing ciew of the city, Comfortable bed and very clean. It had all comforts of home and felt very homely. Meriton on Kent street was in close proximity to Darling harbour and china town. Also very handy to Town hall and QVB. Overall a great experience. It was a pity when then had to move the Meriton on Pitt Street in which we paid more for a one bedroom apartment and found it was not as good as the Studio apartment at Kent street. Only being on the 19th floor and had views of drab old buildings. It also had not as good quality furniture. Was so impressed with Meriton on Kent street have already booked my next stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Meriton Kent Street Apartments”
Reviews.Author: 24binalong
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights for a seminar. I chose it because it was very new and had features that I was looking for namely a gym and a kitchenette. I would rate the room as excellent. The view was more than I expected and because I was on the 49th floor the traffic noise was not a problem. The room was a good size, the kitchen was decent as well. And the tv had the requisite 4 remote controls. There is internet access but it is not wireless (a distinct disadvantage). Close by were lots of little restuarants, a supermarket, cinemas, pub. Accessibility to the train (Town Hall) and the bus (at the QVB) was fabulous. Unfortunately my conference took up a lot of time so I didn't get to see the gym. The downside was the availability of taxis at the hotel was minimal if at all. I was sent to George St by the receptionist and had to wait 20 mins for a taxi to stop and then was told that I was on the wrong side of the road for my destination in Surry Hills, so I had to get out, cross and try to flag another one. From then on, I always asked which side of the road I should be on. The price was very good for Sydney. I was sent an SMS on Sunday afternoon saying that rooms would be $50/night... I did consider missing my flight home to take advantage of this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: PiedOysterPickers
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked the Meriton Kent Street the night before our stay in Apr '07 and could not have been happier with the cost & room. We were looking to stay at a hotel, but for $155/night we booked a one bedroomed apartment at the Meriton - and could not have been happier. We had an apartment on the 27th floor with good city views - the location of the hotel meant we could easily walk to Darling Harbour and explore Sydney on foot. The size and facilities in the apartment were excellent, very modern decoration, very clean, with a good size bedroom, living/dining area incl huge tv/dvd/stereo, large bathroom with separate shower & bath - we could quite happily have lived there! The kitchen was kitted out with everything you could want incl a very large fridge/freezer, oven, kettle, toaster, microwave, cutlery, plates etc, dishwasher, iron & board, washing machine and tumble dryer! We were lucky enough to be in Sydney on Anzac Day so we spent a leisurely morning having a cooked breakfast in the apartment that day before doing the Bridge Climb! At the Meriton we seemed to have the best of both worlds - the space and amenities of an apartment with the daily maid service you would expect in a hotel that tidied the beds and loaded the dishwasher. There was also a swimming pool, gym and steam/sauna available for guests - though the swimming pool water was suspiciously cloudy for my liking... The only (very small) downside was that the hotel wasn't completely finished when we stayed - we spent 10 mins trying to find the Internet room and Vending machine before being told by reception that the areas had not yet been built! But this didn't put us off of a good stay at the Meriton. We had a fantastic stay and would definitely recommend the Meriton.

HotelInfo.Name: Meriton Serviced Apartments Kent Street
HotelInfo.Address: 528 Kent Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
